block.text: Na em i lukim wanpela Isip i wok long mekim nogut long wanpela Israel. Orait em i helpim dispela Israel na i bekim rong dispela Isip i bin mekim long em. Em i paitim dispela Isip na kilim em i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He supposed that his brothers understood that God, by his hand, was giving them deliverance; but they didn’t understand.”

block.text: Moses i ting ol brata bilong en bai i save olsem, God i laik helpim ol long han bilong en. Tasol ol i no save.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The day following, he appeared to them as they fought, and urged them to be at peace again, saying, ‘Sirs, you are brothers. Why do you wrong one another?’

block.text: Long de bihain, Moses i lukim tupela Israel i wok long pait. Em i laik mekim i dai pait bilong tupela, na em i go long tupela na i tok, 'E, yutupela i brata tasol. Bilong wanem yutupela i bagarapim yutupela yet?'

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he who did his neighbor wrong pushed him away, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and a judge over us?

block.text: Tasol dispela man i as bilong trabel em i sakim Moses i go bek. Na em i tok, 'Husat i makim yu na yu kamap hetman na jas bilong mipela?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Do you want to kill me, as you killed the Egyptian yesterday?’

block.text: Yu laik kilim mi i dai, olsem asde yu kilim dispela Isip, a?'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Moses fled at this saying, and became a stranger in the land of Midian, where he became the father of two sons.”

block.text: Moses i harim dispela tok, na em i ranawe. Em i go i stap long graun bilong ol Midian. Na bihain em i marit na i gat tupela pikinini man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When forty years were fulfilled, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai, in a flame of fire in a bush.

block.text: "Orait 40 yia i go pinis, na wanpela ensel i kamap long Moses long graun i no gat man, klostu long maunten Sainai. Ensel i stap insait long paia i kamap namel long ol han bilong wanpela liklik diwai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Moses saw it, he wondered at the sight. As he came close to see, a voice of the Lord came to him and said:

block.text: Moses i lukim na i tingting planti long dispela samting i kamap. Em i laik lukim gut na em i go klostu, na Bikpela i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’ Moses trembled, and dared not look.

block.text: 'Mi God bilong ol tumbuna bilong yu. Mi God bilong Abraham na bilong Aisak na bilong Jekop.' Na Moses i guria, na em i pret long lukluk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said to him, ‘Take your sandals off of your feet, for the place where you stand is holy ground.

block.text: Na Bikpela i tokim em, 'Yu mas lusim su bilong yu, long wanem, dispela graun yu sanap long en em i bilong mi yet na i tambu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have surely seen the affliction of my people that is in Egypt, and have heard their groaning. I have come down to deliver them. Now come, I will send you into Egypt.’”

block.text: Mi lukim pinis olgeta pasin nogut ol i mekim long ol lain manmeri bilong mi long Isip. Mi harim pinis krai bilong ol, na nau mi kam daun bilong kisim bek ol long han bilong ol Isip. Olsem na yu kirap. Mi laik salim yu i go long Isip.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This Moses, whom they refused, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and a judge?’--God has sent him as both a ruler and a deliverer by the hand of the angel who appeared to him in the bush.

block.text: "Pastaim ol Israel i bin sakim Moses, na tokim em olsem, 'Husat i makim yu na yu kamap hetman na jas bilong mipela?' Orait dispela man Moses tasol God i salim i go olsem hetman na man bilong kisim bek ol. God i strongim em long han bilong dispela ensel i kamap long em long liklik diwai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This man led them out, having worked wonders and signs in Egypt, in the Red Sea, and in the wilderness for forty years.

block.text: Moses i bringim ol i go lusim Isip, na em i wokim ol kain kain mirakel long Isip na long solwara Retsi na long graun i no gat man, inap long 40 yia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is that Moses, who said to the children of Israel, ‘The Lord our God will raise up a prophet for you from among your brothers, like me; him shall you hear’

block.text: Dispela Moses tasol i bin tokim ol Israel olsem, 'God bai i makim wanpela brata bilong yupela, na mekim em i kamap profet olsem mi yet.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is he who was in the assembly in the wilderness with the angel that spoke to him on Mount Sinai, and with our fathers, who received living oracles to give to us.

block.text: Bihain ol tumbuna bilong yumi i go bung long graun i no gat man, na dispela Moses tasol i stap wantaim ol. Na em i go antap long maunten Sainai na ensel i givim tok long em. Em i kisim tok bilong God, dispela tok i gat laip, na em i givim dispela tok long yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Our forefathers would not listen to him but rejected him, and turned back in their hearts to Egypt.

block.text: "Tasol ol tumbuna bilong yumi ol i no laik harim tok bilong Moses. Nogat. Ol i sakim tok bilong em, na long bel bilong ol i laikim tumas long i go bek long Isip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to Aaron, ‘Make us gods that will go before us, for as for this Moses, who led us out of the land of Egypt, we don’t know what has become of him.’

block.text: Ol i tokim Aron olsem, 'Mipela i no save wanem samting i bin kamap long Moses, dispela man i bin kisim yumi long Isip na bringim yumi i kam. Olsem na yu mas wokim ol god bilong mipela, na ol i ken i go paslain long mipela na bringim mipela long rot.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: They made a calf in those days, and brought a sacrifice to the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their hands.

block.text: Long dispela taim ol i wokim wanpela pikinini bulmakau, na ol i mekim ofa long dispela giaman god. Na ol i amamas long dispela samting ol i bin wokim long han bilong ol yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But God turned, and gave them up to serve the army of the sky, as it is written in the book of the prophets, ‘Did you offer to me slain animals and sacrifices forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?

block.text: Olsem na God i givim baksait long ol, bai ol i ken lotu long san na mun na sta samting, olsem tok i stap long buk bilong ol profet, 'Yupela ol Israel, taim yupela i bin i stap 40 yia long ples wesan nating, na yupela i kilim ol bulmakau na sipsip na mekim ofa, ating yupela i mekim ol dispela ofa long mi, a? Nogat tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You took up the tabernacle of Moloch, the star of your god Rephan, the figures which you made to worship. I will carry you away beyond Babylon.’”

block.text: Dispela bikpela haus sel yupela i karim em i no haus sel bilong mi. Em i bilong giaman god Molek. Na yupela i bin karim tu piksa bilong sta bilong giaman god Refan. Yupela i wokim ol dispela piksa bilong giaman god, bilong yupela i ken lotu long ol. Olsem na bai mi rausim yupela long kantri bilong yupela, na salim yupela i go i stap long graun i stap long hapsait bilong kantri Babilon.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Our fathers had the tabernacle of the testimony in the wilderness, even as he who spoke to Moses commanded him to make it according to the pattern that he had seen.

block.text: "Taim ol tumbuna bilong yumi i stap long graun i no gat man, ol i gat haus sel bilong God. Long dispela haus God i save kamapim tok tru bilong en. Taim ol i wokim dispela haus sel, ol i mekim olgeta samting olsem God i bin tokim Moses na ol i bihainim stret piksa Moses i bin lukim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having received the tabernacle, our fathers, under Joshua, brought it with them when they entered into the possession of the nations, whom God drove out before the face of our fathers, to the days of David.

block.text: Bihain ol lain pikinini bilong ol dispela tumbuna i kisim dispela haus sel na ol i kam wantaim Josua bilong kisim graun bilong ol man bilong ol arapela lain. Na God i rausim ol dispela lain long pes bilong ol tumbuna bilong yumi. Na ol i sanapim haus sel na em i stap long dispela graun inap long taim bilong King Devit,

ReferenceBlocks.text: David found favor in the sight of God and asked to find a habitation for the God of Jacob.

block.text: em dispela man God i save mekim gut long en. Devit i bin beten long God i ken larim em i wokim wanpela gutpela haus bilong ol lain tumbuna bilong Jekop i ken i go long en na lotu long God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Solomon built him a house.

block.text: Tasol bihain, Solomon i bin wokim dispela haus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: However, the Most High doesn’t dwell in temples made with hands: The prophet says:

block.text: "Tasol God Antap Tru i no save stap long ol haus ol man i wokim. Em i olsem profet i bin tok, 'Bikpela i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘heaven is my throne, and the earth a footstool for my feet. What kind of house will you build me?’ says the Lord; ‘or what is the place of my rest?

block.text: "Heven em i sia king bilong mi, na graun em i ples mi putim lek bilong mi antap long en. Olsem na bai yupela i wokim wanem kain haus bilong mi? Na wanem hap bai i stap ples malolo bilong mi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Didn’t my hand make all these things?’”

block.text: Mi yet mi bin wokim dispela olgeta samting.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You stiff-necked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, you always resist the Holy Spirit! As your fathers did, so you do.

block.text: Na Stiven i tokim ol kaunsil moa olsem, "Yupela i man bilong bikhet. Bel na tingting bilong yupela i pas olsem bilong ol haiden. Na yau bilong yupela i pas na yupela i no save harim tok bilong God. Oltaim yupela i save sakim tok bilong Holi Spirit, olsem ol tumbuna bilong yupela i bin mekim bipo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Which of the prophets didn’t your fathers persecute? They killed those who foretold the coming of the Righteous One, of whom you have now become betrayers and murderers.

block.text: Wanem profet bipo i stap, na ol tumbuna bilong yupela i no bin mekim pasin nogut long em? Nogat. Ol i bin kilim i dai ol man bipo i bin tokaut olsem, Man Bilong Mekim Stretpela Pasin, em bai i kam. Na nau dispela man i kam pinis na yupela i putim em long han bilong ol birua na kilim em i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You received the law as it was ordained by angels, and didn’t keep it!”

block.text: Yupela i bin kisim lo bilong God long han bilong ol ensel, tasol yupela i no bihainim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed at him with their teeth.

block.text: Ol kaunsil i harim tok bilong Stiven, na ol i belhat nogut tru long em na ol i kaikaim tit bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, being full of the Holy Spirit, looked up steadfastly into heaven, and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing on the right hand of God,
and said,

block.text: Tasol Holi Spirit i pulap long Stiven, na em i lukluk i go antap long heven. Em i lukim gutpela lait na bilas bilong God long heven, na em i lukim Jisas i sanap i stap long han sut bilong God.
Na Stiven i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God!”

block.text: "Harim. Mi lukim heven i op, na Pikinini Bilong Man em i sanap i stap long han sut bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they cried out with a loud voice, and stopped their ears, and rushed at him with one accord.

block.text: Ol i harim dispela tok na ol i singaut strong moa, na ol i pasim yau bilong ol. Na ol i kirap wantaim na ol i ran i go holimpas Stiven.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They threw him out of the city, and stoned him. The witnesses placed their garments at the feet of a young man named Saul.

block.text: Na ol i rausim em i go ausait long taun, na ol i tromoi ston long em bilong kilim em i dai. Ol man pastaim i bin sutim tok long em, ol i rausim longpela klos bilong ol na putim i stap klostu long lek bilong wanpela yangpela man, nem bilong en Sol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They stoned Stephen as he called out, saying,

block.text: Taim ol i wok long tromoi ston long Stiven, Stiven i prea olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit!”

block.text: "Bikpela Jisas, yu kisim spirit bilong mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He kneeled down, and cried with a loud voice,

block.text: Na em i brukim skru na i singaut strong moa,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, don’t hold this sin against them!”

block.text: "Bikpela, yu no ken bekim dispela sin long ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, he fell asleep.

block.text: Stiven i tok olsem, na em i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 8

Saul was consenting to his death. A great persecution arose against the assembly which was in Jerusalem in that day. They were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria, except for the apostles.

block.text: Na long ai bilong Sol, dispela pasin ol i mekim long Stiven em i stret. manmeri bilong sios i stap long Jerusalem. Olsem na olgeta manmeri bilong sios i ranawe i go nabaut long olgeta hap bilong distrik Judia na Samaria. Tasol ol aposel i stap yet long Jerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Devout men buried Stephen, and lamented greatly over him.

block.text: Sampela man i save bihainim gut pasin God i laikim, ol i planim Stiven, na ol i mekim bikpela krai long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Saul ravaged the assembly, entering into every house, and dragged both men and women off to prison.

block.text: Na Sol i wok long bagarapim ol manmeri bilong sios. Em i go insait long ol haus bilong ol na em i kisim ol man na meri wantaim. Na em i pulim ol i go na i putim ol long kalabus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore those who were scattered abroad went around preaching the word.

block.text: Ol dispela manmeri i bin ranawe i go nabaut long olgeta hap, ol i autim gutnius long ol ples ol i stap long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Philip went down to the city of Samaria, and proclaimed to them the Christ.

block.text: Filip i go long wanpela taun bilong Samaria, na em i autim gutnius bilong Krais long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The multitudes listened with one accord to the things that were spoken by Philip, when they heard and saw the signs which he did.

block.text: Planti manmeri moa ol i harim tok bilong Filip na ol i lukim ol mirakel em i wokim, na ol i putim yau gut long tok bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For unclean spirits came out of many of those who had them. They came out, crying with a loud voice. Many who had been paralyzed and lame were healed.

block.text: Ol i lukim Filip i rausim ol spirit nogut i bin i stap long planti manmeri, na ol dispela spirit i singaut nogut tru na i lusim ol. Na planti man bun bilong ol i dai o lek bilong ol i nogut, ol i kamap orait gen.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There was great joy in that city.

block.text: Olsem na bikpela amamas i kamap long ol manmeri bilong dispela taun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But there was a certain man, Simon by name, who used to practice sorcery in the city, and amazed the people of Samaria, making himself out to be some great one.

block.text: Wanpela man i stap long dispela taun, nem bilong en Saimon. Bipo em i save mekim ol kain kain pasin bilong soim strong na pawa na mekim olkain marila samting, na ol manmeri bilong Samaria i lukim na ol i tingting planti. Em i save tok olsem, "Mi bikman."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone listened to him, from the least to the greatest, saying,

block.text: Na ol bikman na ol manmeri nating, olgeta i strong long harim tok bilong Saimon. Ol i save tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man is that great power of God.”

block.text: "Dispela strong bilong God, ol i kolim Bikpela Strong, em i stap long dispela man."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They listened to him, because for a long time he had amazed them with his sorceries.

block.text: Ol i strong long harim tok bilong em, long wanem, planti taim ol i bin lukim em i mekim ol narakain samting tru, na ol i save tingting planti.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when they believed Philip preaching good news concerning the Kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.

block.text: Tasol taim Filip i autim gutnius bilong kingdom bilong God na bilong nem bilong Jisas Krais, ol man na meri wantaim i bilip na ol i kisim baptais.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon himself also believed. Being baptized, he continued with Philip. Seeing signs and great miracles occurring, he was amazed.

block.text: Na Saimon tu i bilip na i kisim baptais. Na em i raun wantaim Filip na i lukim ol kain kain bikpela mirakel Filip i wokim, na em i tingting planti.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when the apostles who were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them.

block.text: Ol aposel i stap long Jerusalem ol i harim tok long ol Samaria i bin kisim tok bilong God. Olsem na ol i salim Pita wantaim Jon i go long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they arrived, they prayed for them, that they might receive the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Tupela i go kamap, orait tupela i beten bai God i givim Holi Spirit long ol dispela Samaria,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He had not yet fallen on none of them. They had only been baptized in the name of Christ Jesus.

block.text: long wanem, Holi Spirit i no bin kam yet long ol. Ol i kisim baptais tasol long nem bilong Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they laid their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Tupela i beten pinis, orait tupela i putim han antap long ol, na ol i kisim Holi Spirit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when Simon saw that the Holy Spirit was given through the laying on of the apostles’ hands, he offered them money,
saying,

block.text: Saimon i lukim tupela aposel i putim han antap long ol na ol i kisim Holi Spirit. Olsem na em i kisim mani i kam long tupela, na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give me also this power, that whomever I lay my hands on may receive the Holy Spirit.”

block.text: "Yutupela givim dispela strong long mi tu. Olsem na sapos mi putim han antap long wanpela man, em i ken kisim Holi Spirit."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter said to him,

block.text: Tasol Pita i tokim Saimon olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “May your silver perish with you, because you thought you could obtain the gift of God with money!

block.text: "Mani bilong yu i ken bagarap wantaim yu yet! Samting God i save givim olsem presen, em yu ting yu inap baim long mani, a? Nogat tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You have neither part nor lot in this matter, for your heart isn’t right before God.

block.text: Bel bilong yu i no stret long ai bilong God. Olsem na yu no inap i stap insait long dispela wok bilong God mipela i mekim. Nogat tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Repent therefore of this, your wickedness, and ask God if perhaps the thought of your heart may be forgiven you.

block.text: Yu mas tanim bel na givim baksait long dispela pasin nogut bilong yu. Na yu mas beten long Bikpela na askim em long pinisim dispela asua bilong dispela tintin nogut i stap long bel bilong yu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I see that you are in the gall of bitterness and in the bondage of iniquity.”

block.text: Mi tok olsem, long wanem, mi lukim yu i mangal tru long kisim presen bilong God na dispela mangal i kamap olsem marasin nogut i bagarapim tingting bilong yu na i mekim yu i stap kalabus bilong sin."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon answered,

block.text: Na Saimon i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Pray for me to the Lord, that none of the things which you have spoken happen to me.”

block.text: "Yutupela i mas prea long Bikpela bai em i ken marimari long mi, na bai ol dispela samting yutupela i tok long en i no ken kamap long mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They therefore, when they had testified and spoken the word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem, and preached the Good News to many villages of the Samaritans.

block.text: Orait tupela aposel i autim tok bilong Bikpela na i tokim ol manmeri long ol samting Bikpela i bin mekim long tupela. Na bihain tupela i go bek long Jerusalem. Na taim tupela i wokabaut i go, tupela i autim gutnius long planti ples bilong ol Samaria.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip, saying,

block.text: Wanpela ensel bilong Bikpela i tokim Filip olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Arise, and go toward the south to the way that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza. This is a desert.”

block.text: "Yu kirap na yu go long hap saut, na yu go long dispela rot i lusim Jerusalem na i go daun long taun Gasa." Dispela rot i stap long hap i no gat man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He arose and went; and behold, there was a man of Ethiopia, a eunuch of great authority under Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, who was over all her treasure, who had come to Jerusalem to worship.

block.text: Orait Filip i kirap na i go. Na long dispela rot em i lukim wanpela man bilong Afrika. Em i wanpela bikman long gavman bilong kwin o Kandasi bilong Afrika, na em i save bosim olgeta mani samting bilong kwin. Em wanpela man ol i bin rausim bol bilong en. Dispela man i bin kam long Jerusalem bilong lotu,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was returning and sitting in his chariot, and was reading the prophet Isaiah.
The Spirit said to Philip,

block.text: na nau em i laik i go bek. Em i sindaun long karis bilong en, na i ritim buk bilong profet Aisaia, na i go.
Na Holi Spirit i tokim Filip olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go near, and join yourself to this chariot.”

block.text: "Yu go wokabaut klostu long dispela karis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Philip ran to him, and heard him reading Isaiah the prophet, and said,

block.text: Orait Filip i ran i go klostu, na i harim dispela man i ritim buk bilong profet Aisaia. Na Filip i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you understand what you are reading?”

block.text: "Ating yu save long as bilong dispela tok yu ritim, o nogat?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na dispela man i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How can I, unless someone explains it to me?”

block.text: "Sapos i no gat man i tokim mi long as bilong dispela tok, orait bai mi inap save olsem wanem?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He begged Philip to come up and sit with him.

block.text: Na em i tokim Filip, "Yu kam antap long karis na sindaun wantaim mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the passage of the Scripture which he was reading was this,

block.text: Dispela hap bilong buk em i ritim, em i gat tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He was led as a sheep to the slaughter. As a lamb before his shearer is silent, so he doesn’t open his mouth.

block.text: "Em i no bin mekim wanpela tok. Em i pasim maus olsem sipsip ol i kisim i go bilong kilim, na olsem pikinini sipsip ol i laik katim gras bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In his humiliation, his judgment was taken away. Who will declare His generation? For his life is taken from the earth.”

block.text: Ol i daunim em tru, na ol i no mekim stretpela kot long em. Olsem na em i no gat ol lain pikinini i stap, bai ol man i ken stori long ol. Nogat. Ol i bin pinisim laip bilong en, na em i no i stap moa long graun."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The eunuch answered Philip,

block.text: Dispela man i ritim dispela tok pinis, orait em i askim Filip olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is the prophet talking about? About himself, or about someone else?”

block.text: "Mi askim yu. Profet i tok long husat na i mekim dispela tok? Em i tok long em yet, o em i tok long narapela man?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Philip opened his mouth, and beginning from this Scripture, preached to him Jesus.

block.text: Orait Filip i autim tok long dispela man. Pastaim em i autim as bilong tok dispela man i bin ritim, na bihain em i autim ol arapela tok bilong gutnius bilong Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they went on the way, they came to some water, and the eunuch said,

block.text: As they went on the way, they came to some water, and the eunuch said,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, here is water. What is keeping me from being baptized?”

block.text: "Lukim, wara i stap. Ating wanpela samting i pasim rot na mi no inap kisim baptais?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: And Philip said,

block.text: And Philip said,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you believe with all your heart, you may”.

block.text: "Sapos yu bilip tru long bel bilong yu, orait yu ken kisim baptais."

ReferenceBlocks.text: And he answered and said,

block.text: Na em i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God”.

block.text: "Mi bilip long Jisas Krais em i Pikinini Bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded the chariot to stand still, and they both went down into the water, both Philip and the eunuch, and he baptized him.

block.text: Orait dispela man i tok na draiva i mekim ol hos i pulim karis ol i sanap. Na Filip wantaim dispela man i go daun long wara. Na Filip i baptaisim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught Philip away, and the eunuch didn’t see him any more, for he went on his way rejoicing.

block.text: Na tupela i lusim wara na i kam antap, na wantu Spirit bilong Bikpela i kisim Filip i go, na dispela man i no lukim em moa. Tasol dispela man i amamas na i bihainim rot bilong en na i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Philip was found at Azotus. Passing through, he preached the Good News to all the cities, until he came to Caesarea.

block.text: Na Filip i lukim olsem em i stap long taun Asdot, na em i go long olgeta taun nabaut na em i autim gutnius bilong Jisas. Na bihain em i go kamap long taun Sisaria.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 9
But Saul was still breathing threats and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord.

block.text: Long dispela taim Sol i tok strong yet long bagarapim ol disaipel bilong Bikpela na kilim ol i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went to the high priest,
and asked for letters from him to the synagogues of Damascus, that if he found any who were of the Way, whether men or women, he might bring them bound to Jerusalem.

block.text: Olsem na em i go long hetpris,

na i askim hetpris long raitim ol pas long ol hetman bilong ol haus lotu bilong ol Juda i stap long taun Damaskus. Orait hetpris i raitim ol pas na em i givim long Sol. Ol pas i gat tok olsem, "Sapos Sol i lukim sampela man o sampela meri i bihainim rot bilong Jisas, orait em i ken kalabusim ol na bringim ol i kam long Jerusalem."

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he traveled, it happened that he got close to Damascus, and suddenly a light from the sky shone around him.

block.text: Orait Sol i lusim Jerusalem na i go long Damaskus. Taim em i kamap klostu long Damaskus, na wantu wanpela lait bilong heven i kam daun long em. Dispela lait i strong tumas

ReferenceBlocks.text: He fell on the earth, and heard a voice saying to him,

block.text: na Sol i pundaun long graun. Na em i harim maus bilong wanpela man i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Saul, Saul, why do you persecute me?”

block.text: "Sol, Sol, bilong wanem yu wok long bagarapim mi?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na Sol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who are you, Lord?”

block.text: "Bikpela, yu husat?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said,

block.text: Na em i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting: it is hard for you to kick against the goads.”

block.text: "Mi Jisas, yu wok long bagarapim mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And he trembling and astonished said,
“Lord, what should I do?”
And the Lord said to him,
“Rise up, and enter into the city, and you will be told what you must do.”

block.text: Tasol yu kirap na yu go insait long taun. Bihain bai wanpela man i tokim yu long ol samting yu mas mekim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The men who traveled with him stood speechless, hearing the sound, but seeing no one.

block.text: Ol man i go wantaim Sol ol i kirap nogut, na ol i no gat toktok. Ol i harim maus bilong man i toktok, tasol ol i no lukim wanpela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Saul arose from the ground, and when his eyes were opened, he saw no one. They led him by the hand, and brought him into Damascus.

block.text: Orait Sol i kirap na i opim ai, tasol ai bilong en i tudak. Olsem na ol i holim han bilong en na kisim em i go insait long Damaskus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was without sight for three days, and neither ate nor drank.

block.text: Em i stap tripela de, na ai bilong en i stap tudak tasol. Na em i no kaikai na i no dring.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now there was a certain disciple at Damascus named Ananias. The Lord said to him in a vision,

block.text: Wanpela disaipel bilong Jisas i stap long Damaskus, nem bilong en Ananaias. Na long driman Bikpela i kolim nem bilong en,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Ananias!”

block.text: "Ananaias."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na em i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, it’s me, Lord.”

block.text: "Bikpela, mi stap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said to him,

block.text: Na Bikpela i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Arise, and go to the street which is called Straight, and inquire in the house of Judah for one named Saul, a man of Tarsus. For behold, he is praying.

block.text: "Yu kirap na yu go long dispela rot, nem bilong en Stretpela Rot. Long haus bilong Judas yu mas askim long wanpela man bilong taun Tarsus, nem bilong en Sol. Nau em i prea i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In a vision he has seen a man named Ananias coming in, and laying his hands on him, that he might receive his sight.”

block.text: Ai bilong en i tudak, tasol long driman em i bin lukim wanpela man, nem bilong en Ananaias, i kam insait na i putim han antap long en, bilong mekim ai bilong en i lukluk gen."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Ananias answered,

block.text: Na Ananaias i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, I have heard from many about this man, how much evil he did to your saints at Jerusalem.

block.text: "Bikpela, mi harim planti man i toktok long dispela man, long olkain pasin nogut em i bin mekim long ol manmeri bilong yu long Jerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Here he has authority from the chief priests to bind all who call on your name.”

block.text: Em i kisim tok orait long ol bikpris, bilong em i ken kalabusim ol manmeri bilong dispela ples ol i save lotu na prea long nem bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Lord said to him,

block.text: Tasol Bikpela i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go your way, for he is my chosen vessel to bear my name before the nations and kings, and the children of Israel.

block.text: "Yu go. Nau dispela man em i kamap wokman bilong mi. Mi makim em pinis long i go long ol arapela lain manmeri na long ol king, na long ol Israel tu, na autim nem bilong mi long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I will show him how many things he must suffer for my name’s sake.”

block.text: Bai mi soim em olkain pen na hevi em i mas karim long taim em i autim nem bilong mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Ananias departed, and entered into the house. Laying his hands on him, he said,

block.text: Orait Ananaias i go. Em I go insait long haus, na i putim han antap long Sol na i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brother Saul, the Lord, who appeared to you on the road by which you came, has sent me, that you may receive your sight, and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”

block.text: "Brata Sol, Bikpela Jisas i bin kamap long yu long rot, na nau em I salim mi i kam long yu, bilong yu ken lukluk gen na Holi Spirit i ken pulap long yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately something like scales fell from his eyes, and he received his sight. He arose and was baptized.

block.text: Ananaias i tok pinis, orait wantu samting olsem grile i stap long ai bilong Sol i lusim ai na i pundaun na em inap lukluk gen. Na em i kirap na i kisim baptais.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took food and was strengthened. Saul stayed several days with the disciples who were at Damascus.

block.text: Na bihain Sol i kaikai na i kamap strong gen. Sol i stap sampela de wantaim ol disaipel long Damaskus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately in the synagogues he proclaimed the Christ, that he is the Son of God.

block.text: Na bihain em i go stret long ol haus lotu bilong ol Juda, na em i autim tok olsem, "Jisas em i Pikinini Bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: All who heard him were amazed, and said,

block.text: Olgeta man i harim tok bilong Sol, ol i kirap nogut. Na ol i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Isn’t this he who in Jerusalem made havoc of those who called on this name? And he had come here intending to bring them bound before the chief priests!”

block.text: "Em dispela man tasol i bin bagarapim ol manmeri i save lotu na prea long nem bilong Jisas. Em i mekim olsem long Jerusalem, na nau em i kam hia bilong kalabusim ol na bringim ol I go long ol bikpris."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Saul increased more in strength, and confounded the Jews who lived at Damascus, proving that this is the Christ.

block.text: Tasol strong bilong Sol i kamap bikpela moa, na em i tok klia gut tru long ol Juda i stap long Damaskus olsem, "Jisas em dispela man God i makim bilong kisim bek ol manmeri bilong en." Ol Juda i harim ol toktok bilong Sol na ol i kirap nogut na ol i no mekim wanpela tok bilong daunim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When many days were fulfilled, the Jews conspired together to kill him.

block.text: Planti de i go pinis, na ol Juda i kibung na ol i pasim tok long kilim Sol i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: However, their plot became known to Saul. They watched the gates both day and night that they might kill him.

block.text: Na Sol i harim tok long dispela samting ol i laik mekim. Orait ol Juda i was long olgeta dua bilong taun long san na long nait tu, bilong kilim em i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore, his disciples took him by night, and let him down through the wall, lowering him in a basket.

block.text: Tasol ol disaipel bilong Sol i kisim em long nait na ol i bringim em i go antap long bikpela banis i raunim taun. Na ol i tokim em long sindaun long wanpela bikpela basket, na ol i slekim basket i go daun long ausait bilong taun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Saul had come to Jerusalem, he tried to join himself to the disciples; but they were all afraid of him, not believing that he was a disciple.

block.text: Bihain Sol i go long Jerusalem, na em i laik bung wantaim ol disaipel. Tasol olgeta ol i pret long em, na ol i no bilip olsem em i bin kamap disaipel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles and declared to them:

block.text: Tasol Barnabas i kisim Sol na i bringim em i go long ol aposel. Em i stori long ol long

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He saw and spoke to the Lord while he was on the road, and he preached boldly at Damascas in the Name of the Lord.”

block.text: Sol i bin lukim Bikpela long rot, na Bikpela i givim toktok long em. Na Barnabas i stori tu long Sol i bin tokaut strong long nem bilong Jisas long Damaskus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was with them entering into Jerusalem.

block.text: Olsem na Sol i stap wantaim ol long Jerusalem na em i raun wantaim ol. Em i no pret, na em i wok strong long tokaut long nem bilong Bikpela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He preached boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus. He spoke and disputed against the Hellenists, but they were seeking to kill him.

block.text: Em i wok long toktok wantaim ol Juda i save tok Grik, na em i pait long toktok wantaim ol. Tasol ol i wok long painim rot bilong kilim em i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the brothers knew it, they brought him down to Caesarea, and sent him off to Tarsus.

block.text: Taim ol brata i save long dispela, ol i bringim Sol i go daun long taun Sisaria, na ol i salim em i go long taun Tarsus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the assemblies throughout all Judea and Galilee and Samaria had peace, and were built up. They were multiplied, walking in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Olsem na long olgeta hap bilong Judia na Galili na Samaria ol manmeri bilong sios, ol i stap gut. Ol arapela man i no mekim nogut long ol, na sios i kamap strong. Ol i bihainim pasin bilong aninit long Bikpela, na Holi Spirit i strongim bel bilong ol. Na planti manmeri i kam insait long sios.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, as Peter went throughout all those parts, he came down also to the saints who lived at Lydda.

block.text: Pita i wokabaut i go long olgeta hap, na em i go daun long taun Lida tu na i stap wantaim ol manmeri bilong God long Lida.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There he found a certain man named Aeneas, who had been bedridden for eight years, because he was paralyzed.
Peter said to him,

block.text: Long dispela ples em i lukim wanpela man, nem bilong en Ainias. Olgeta bun bilong en i dai, na em i bin slip i stap long bet tasol inap long 8 -pela yia.
Na Pita i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Aeneas, Jesus Christ heals you. Take up your mat and get up.!”

block.text: "Ainias, nau Jisas Krais i mekim yu i kamap orait gen. Yu kirap na stretim bet bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he arose.
All who lived at Lydda and in Sharon saw him, and they turned to the Lord.

block.text: Orait em i kirap kwiktaim.
Na olgeta man bilong taun Lida na bilong stretpela hap graun bilong Saron, ol i lukim Ainias i kamap orait gen, na ol i tanim bel i go long Bikpela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, which when translated, means Dorcas. This woman was full of good works and acts of mercy which she did.

block.text: Long Jopa wanpela disaipel meri i stap, nem bilong en Tabita. Long tok Grik ol i kolim Dorkas. Oltaim em i save mekim ol gutpela pasin na em i save helpim ol manmeri i sot long ol samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened in those days that she fell sick, and died. When they had washed her, they laid her in an upper room.

block.text: Long dispela taim em i kisim sik na i dai. Na ol i wasim bodi bilong en na putim em long wanpela rum antap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As Lydda was near Joppa, the disciples, hearing that Peter was there, sent two men to him, imploring him

block.text: Taun Lida i stap klostu long Jopa, na ol disaipel i bin harim tok olsem Pita i stap long Lida. Olsem na ol i salim tupela man i go bringim tok long en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do not to delay in coming.”

block.text: "Plis, yu kam hariap long mipela. Yu no ken wet."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter got up and went with them. When he had come, they brought him into the upper room. All the widows stood by him weeping, and showing the coats and garments which Dorcas had made while she was with them.

block.text: Orait Pita i kirap i go wantaim tupela. Em i go kamap, na ol i bringim em i go long dispela rum antap. Olgeta meri, man bilong ol i dai pinis, ol i kam sanap klostu long Pita na ol i krai i stap. Ol i soim em olgeta klos na saket samting Tabita i bin wokim, taim em i stap yet wantaim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter put them all out, and kneeled down and prayed. Turning to the body, he said,

block.text: Na Pita i rausim olgeta manmeri i go ausait, na em i brukim skru na i mekim prea. Na em i tanim pes i go long bodi bilong meri na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tabitha, get up!”

block.text: "Tabita, yu kirap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: She opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter, she sat up.

block.text: Orait meri i opim ai bilong en, na i lukim Pita, na i kirap sindaun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He gave her his hand, and raised her up. Calling the saints and widows, he presented her alive.

block.text: Orait Pita i holim han bilong en na i kirapim em, na em i sanap. Na Pita i singautim ol manmeri bilong God, wantaim ol meri, man bilong ol i dai pinis, na em i soim ol olsem Tabita i stap laip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And it became known throughout all Joppa, and many believed in the Lord.

block.text: Tok bilong dispela samting Pita i mekim i go nabaut long olgeta hap bilong taun Jopa, na ol manmeri i harim. Na planti ol i bilip long Bikpela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, that he stayed many days in Joppa with one Simon, a tanner.

block.text: Na Pita i stap planti de long Jopa. Em i stap wantaim wanpela man nem bilong en Saimon. Dispela man i save kisim ol skin bilong bulmakau samting na redim bilong ol arapela kain wok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 10
Now there was a certain man in Caesarea, Cornelius by name, a centurion of what was called the Italian Regiment.

block.text: Wanpela man i stap long taun Sisaria, nem bilong en Kornilius. Em i kepten bilong 100 soldia bilong ol Rom. Em i bilong dispela lain soldia ol i kolim lain soldia bilong Itali.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was a devout man, and one who feared God with all his house, who gave gifts for the needy generously to the people, and always prayed to God.

block.text: Em i save bihainim gut pasin God i laikim. Na em wantaim olgeta lain i stap long haus bilong en ol i save aninit long God. Em i save givim planti mani samting bilong helpim ol Juda i sot long ol samting. Na oltaim em i save beten long God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: At about the ninth hour of the day, he clearly saw in a vision an angel of God coming to him, and saying to him,

block.text: Long wanpela de, olsem long 3 klok long apinun, em i lukim wanpela samting olsem driman i klia tumas. Em I lukim wanpela ensel bilong God i kam insait long haus na i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Cornelius!”

block.text: "Kornilius."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He, fastening his eyes on him, and being frightened, said,

block.text: Na Kornilius i lukluk long em na i pret tumas. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is it, Lord?”

block.text: "Bikman, olsem wanem?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Na ensel i tokim Kornilius olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your prayers and your gifts to the needy have gone up for a memorial before God.

block.text: "God i harim pinis beten bilong yu na em i tingting long pasin yu save mekim bilong givim mani samting long ol manmeri i sot long ol samting. Na God i laikim dispela pasin bilong yu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now send men to Joppa, and get Simon, who is surnamed Peter.

block.text: Nau yu mas salim ol man i go long Jopa na painim wanpela man, nem bilong en Saimon, em i gat narapela nem Pita. Na ol i mas tokim em long kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He lodges with one Simon, a tanner, whose house is by the seaside: he will tell you what you should do..”

block.text: He lodges with one Simon, a tanner, whose house is by the seaside: he will tell you what you should do.”

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the angel who spoke to him had departed, Cornelius called two of his household servants and a devout soldier of those who waited on him continually.

block.text: Ensel i givim tok pinis long Kornilius na em i go. Na Kornilius i singautim tupela wokboi bilong en wantaim wanpela soldia. Dispela soldia em tu i save bihainim pasin God i laikim, na oltaim em i save stap wantaim Kornilius.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having explained everything to them, he sent them to Joppa.

block.text: Na Kornilius i tokim gut dispela tripela man long olgeta samting i bin kamap long en, na em i salim ol i go long Jopa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now on the next day as they were on their journey, and got close to the city, Peter went up on the housetop to pray at about noon.

block.text: Ol man Kornilius i salim, ol i wokabaut i go na ol i slip long rot. Long de bihain ol i wokabaut i go moa na klostu long belo ol i kamap klostu long taun Jopa. Long dispela taim Pita i go antap long rup bilong haus, bilong mekim prea.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He became hungry and desired to eat, but while they were preparing, he fell into a trance.

block.text: Pita i hangre na em i laik kaikai. Na taim ol i wok yet long redim kaikai, em i lukim wanpela samting olsem driman.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He saw heaven opened and a certain container descending to him, like a great sheet let down by four corners on the earth.

block.text: Em i lukim skai i op, na wanpela samting i kam daun, em i olsem bikpela laplap tru. I gat samting i holim 4 -pela kona bilong en na i slekim i kam daun long graun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the sheet were all kinds of four-footed animals of the earth, wild animals, reptiles, and birds of the sky.
A voice came to him,

block.text: Insait long dispela laplap i gat olgeta kain abus na palai samting na na olkain pisin i stap.
Na Pita i harim wanpela maus i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rise, Peter, kill and eat!”

block.text: "Pita, yu kirap kilim abus na kaikai."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter said,

block.text: Tasol Pita i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Not so, Lord; for I have never eaten anything that is common or unclean.”

block.text: "Bikpela, mi no ken tru! I no gat wanpela taim mi bin kaikai wanpela samting i no klin long ai bilong yu na i tambu long mipela i kaikai."

ReferenceBlocks.text: A voice came to him again the second time,

block.text: Na namba 2 taim dispela maus i tokim em gen olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What God has cleansed, you must not call unclean.”

block.text: "Samting God i bin mekim i kamap klin, dispela yu no ken kolim i no klin."

ReferenceBlocks.text: This was done three times, and immediately the vessel was received up into heaven.

block.text: Dispela samting i kamap tripela taim, na kwiktaim dispela laplap i go antap gen long skai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Peter was very perplexed and he wondered:

block.text: Orait Pita i tingting planti na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What does this vision mean?”

block.text: "As bilong dispela driman mi lukim, em i olsem wanem?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Meanwhile, the men who were sent by Cornelius, were looking for Simon’s house, and were now standing at the gate.
They called out and asked:

block.text: Em i tingting olsem yet, na dispela ol man Kornilius i bin salim ol i kam, ol i kamap. Ol i bin askim ol man long haus bilong Saimon i stap we, na nau ol i kam sanap long dua.
Na ol i singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is Simon, who is surnamed Peter lodging here?”

block.text: "Saimon, narapela nem bilong en Pita, em i stap hia, o nogat?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: While Peter was pondering the vision, the Spirit said to him,

block.text: Pita i tingting yet long dispela driman, na Holi Spirit i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, three men seek you.
Arise, go down and go with them, doubting nothing; for I have sent them.”

block.text: "Harim. Tripela man i kam painim yu.
Olsem na yu kirap na yu go daun na go wantaim ol. Yu no ken tingting planti. Mi yet mi bin salim ol i kam."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter went down to the men, and said,

block.text: Na Pita i go daun long dispela ol man, na i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, I am he whom you seek. Why have you come?”

block.text: "Dispela man yupela i wok long painim, em mi tasol. Yupela i kam long wanem samting?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Na ol i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We were sent by Cornelius, a centurion, a righteous man and one who fears God, and well spoken of by all the nation of the Jews. He was directed by a holy angel to invite you to his house, and to listen to what you say.”

block.text: "Kornilius, em i kepten bilong 100 soldia, em i salim mipela i kam. Em i stretpela man na em i save pret long God. Olgeta lain Juda ol i save tok, em i gutpela man. Wanpela ensel bilong God i tokim em long singautim yu i go long haus bilong en na em i ken harim sampela tok bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: So he called them in and lodged them.

block.text: Orait na Pita i kisim ol i go insait long haus na em i lukautim ol long dispela nait.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the next day Peter arose and went out with them, and some of the brothers from Joppa accompanied him.

block.text: Na long de bihain em i kirap i go wantaim ol. Na sampela bilong ol disaipel bilong Jisas i stap long Jopa ol i go wantaim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the next day they entered into Caesarea. Cornelius was waiting for them, having called together his relatives and his near friends.

block.text: Pita wantaim ol dispela man i wokabaut i go, na ol i slip long rot wanpela nait, na ol i go kamap long taun Sisaria. Na Kornilius i wetim ol i stap. Em i singautim pinis ol wanlain bilong en wantaim ol pren tru bilong en, na ol i bung i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it happened that Peter entered, Cornelius met him, fell down at his feet, and worshiped him.

block.text: Pita i go insait, na Kornilius i kam klostu long em na i brukim skru klostu long lek bilong Pita na i lotu long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter raised him up, saying,

block.text: Tasol Pita i kirapim em na i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Stand up! I myself am also a man.”

block.text: "Yu kirap. Mi tu mi man tasol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he talked with him, he went in and found many gathered together.
He said to them,

block.text: Na Pita i toktok wantaim em na i go insait, na em i lukim planti manmeri i bung i stap.
Na Pita i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You yourselves know how it is an unlawful thing for a man who is a Jew to join himself or come to one of another nation. But God has shown me that I shouldn’t call any man unholy or unclean.

block.text: "Yupela yet i save, i tambu tru long mipela Juda i stap wantaim ol man bilong ol arapela lain. Na i tambu long mipela i go klostu long ol tu. Tasol God i bin soim mi olsem, mi no ken kolim wanpela man i no klin long ai bilong God, na mi no ken ting em i tambu long mipela i pas wantaim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore also I came without complaint when I was sent for. I ask therefore, why did you send for me?”

block.text: Olsem na mi no sakim tok. Mi harim singaut bilong yupela na mi kam. Orait nau mi askim yupela, bilong wanem yupela i singautim mi?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Cornelius said,

block.text: Na Kornilius i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Four days ago, I was fasting until this hour, and at the ninth hour, I prayed in my house, and behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,

block.text: "Samting i bin kamap long mi, na nau 3 -pela de i go pinis. Em i olsem. Mi stap long haus bilong mi, na mi mekim prea long 3 klok, em long wankain taim olsem nau. Mi prea i stap na wantu mi lukim wanpela man i sanap long pes bilong mi, na laplap samting bilong en i lait tumas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and said, ‘Cornelius, your prayer is heard, and your gifts to the needy are remembered in the sight of God.

block.text: Na em i tok, 'Kornilius, God i harim pinis beten bilong yu, na em i tingting long pasin yu save mekim bilong givim mani samting long ol manmeri i sot long ol samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Send therefore to Joppa, and summon Simon, who is surnamed Peter. He lodges in the house of Simon a tanner, by the seaside. When he comes, he will speak to you.’

block.text: Olsem na yu mas salim ol man i go long Jopa na singautim Saimon, em i gat narapela nem Pita. Dispela man i stap long haus bilong narapela Saimon, em i man bilong mekim wok long skin bulmakau samting, na haus bilong en i stap arere long solwara.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I sent to you at once, and it was good of you to come. Now therefore we are all here present in the sight of God to hear all things that have been commanded you by God.”

block.text: Olsem na kwiktaim mi salim sampela man i go long yu. Na yu mekim gutpela pasin na yu kam. Orait nau mipela olgeta i kam i stap hia long ai bilong God bilong harim olgeta tok Bikpela i bin givim long yu bilong tokim mipela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter opened his mouth and said,

block.text: Orait Pita i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Truly I perceive that God doesn’t show favoritism;

block.text: "Tru tumas, nau mi save, God i save mekim wankain pasin long olgeta manmeri, maski ol i bilong wanem lain.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but in every nation he who fears him and works righteousness is acceptable to him.

block.text: Long olgeta lain em i save laikim ol manmeri i aninit long em na i mekim stretpela pasin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The word which he sent to the children of Israel, preaching good news of peace by Jesus Christ--he is Lord of all—

block.text: Yupela i save long dispela tok God i givim long mipela ol lain bilong Israel. Em i autim gutnius olsem, Jisas Krais em i Bikpela bilong olgeta man, na em i save mekim yumi i kamap wanbel wantaim God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: you know what happened, which was proclaimed throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee, after the baptism which John preached;

block.text: Yupela yet i save long olgeta samting i bin kamap long olgeta hap bilong kantri Israel bihain long taim Jon i bin autim tok long ol man i mas kisim baptais. Ol dispela samting i bin stat long distrik Galili.

ReferenceBlocks.text: even Jesus of Nazareth, how God anointed him with the Holy Spirit and with power. He went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, for God was with him.

block.text: Yupela i save, God i bin makim Jisas bilong Nasaret, na givim Holi Spirit na bikpela strong long em. Na Jisas i go long ol ples nabaut na i helpim ol manmeri. God i stap wantaim em na em i mekim orait gen olgeta man Satan i bin bagarapim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We are witnesses of everything he did both in the country of the Jews, and in Jerusalem; whom they also killed, hanging him on a tree.

block.text: Na mipela i man bilong autim tok bilong olgeta samting em i bin mekim long olgeta ples bilong mipela Juda na long Jerusalem. Ol i hangamapim dispela man long wanpela diwai, na long dispela pasin ol i kilim em i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God raised him up the third day, and caused him to be seen.

block.text: Tasol long de namba 3 God i kirapim em bek na i mekim em i kamap long ai bilong ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was not seen by all the people, but by witnesses whom God had already chosen -- by us, who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.

block.text: Tasol em i no kamap long olgeta Juda. Nogat. Em i kamap long mipela ol man bipo God i bin makim bilong autim tok bilong em. Na taim em i kirap bek pinis long matmat, mipela i bin kaikai na dring wantaim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that this is he who is appointed by God as the Judge of the living and the dead.

block.text: Na em i tokim mipela long autim tok long ol manmeri na tokaut klia olsem, 'God i bin makim dispela man tasol bai em i stap man bilong harim kot bilong ol man i stap laip na bilong ol man i dai pinis.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the prophets testify about him, that through his name everyone who believes in him will receive remission of sins.”

block.text: Olgeta profet i bin autim tok long ol samting em bai i mekim, na ol i bin tok olsem, long nem bilong dispela man tasol, God i save lusim sin bilong olgeta man i bilip long em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit fell on all those who heard the word.

block.text: Pita i autim tok yet, na Holi Spirit i kam daun long olgeta manmeri i stap harim tok bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They of the circumcision who believed were amazed, as many as came with Peter, because the gift of the Holy Spirit was also poured out on the Gentiles.

block.text: They of the circumcision who believed were amazed, as many as came with Peter, because the gift of the Holy Spirit was also poured out on the Gentiles.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For they heard them speaking in other languages and magnifying God. Then Peter answered,

block.text: For they heard them speaking in other languages and magnifying God. Then Peter answered,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Can any man forbid the water, that these who have received the Holy Spirit as well as we should not be baptized?”

block.text: "Ol dispela lain i kisim pinis Holi Spirit wankain olsem yumi. Olsem na husat inap tambuim yumi long baptaisim ol long wara?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded them to be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked him to stay some days.

block.text: Na Pita i tokim ol dispela manmeri olsem, "Yupela i mas kisim baptais long nem bilong Jisas Krais." Ol i kisim baptais pinis, orait ol i tokim em long i stap sampela de wantaim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 11
Now the apostles and the brothers who were in Judea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.

block.text: Ol aposel na ol brata i stap nabaut long distrik Judia ol i harim tok long ol manmeri bilong arapela lain tu i kisim pinis tok bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Peter had come up to Jerusalem, those who were of the circumcision contended with him,
saying,

block.text: Na taim Pita i go long Jerusalem, ol lain disaipel i strong long bihainim pasin bilong katim skin, ol i krosim em.
Ol i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You went to uncircumcised men and ate with them!”

block.text: "Yu mekim wanem kain pasin na yu go long haus bilong ol man i no save katim skin, na yu kaikai wantaim ol?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter began, and explained to them in order, saying,

block.text: Orait Pita I stori long olgeta samting i bin kamap long em. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in a trance I saw a vision: I saw something like a large sheet let down from heaven by four corners. It came down to where I was.

block.text: "Mi stap long taun Jopa, na mi beten i stap, na mi lukim wanpela samting olsem driman. Mi lukim wanpela samting i kam daun long skai, em i olsem bikpela laplap tru. I gat samting i holim 4 -pela kona bilong en na i slekim i kam daun long mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When I had looked intently at it, I considered, and saw the four-footed animals of the earth, wild animals, creeping things, and birds of the sky.

block.text: Mi laik save gut long dispela samting, na mi lukluk gut insait long dispela laplap na mi lukim olkain abus ol man i save lukautim na ol wel abus na ol palai samting na ol pisin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I also heard a voice saying to me, ‘Rise, Peter, kill and eat!’

block.text: Na mi harim wanpela maus i tokim mi olsem, 'Pita, yu kirap kilim abus na kaikai.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I said, ‘Not so, Lord, for nothing unholy or unclean has ever entered into my mouth.’

block.text: Tasol mi tok, 'Bikpela, mi no ken tru! I no gat wanpela taim mi bin kaikai wanpela samting i no klin long ai bilong yu na i tambu long mipela i kaikai.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: But a voice answered me the second time out of heaven, ‘What God has cleansed, don’t you call unclean.’

block.text: Tasol dispela maus i kam long heven em i tok namba 2 taim gen olsem, 'Samting God i bin mekim i kamap klin, dispela yu no ken kolim i no klin.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: This was done three times, and all were drawn up again into heaven.

block.text: Dispela samting i kamap tripela taim, na dispela olgeta samting i go antap gen long skai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, immediately three men stood before the house where I was, having been sent from Caesarea to me.

block.text: "Long dispela taim stret, tripela man i kam kamap long dispela haus mipela i stap long en. Wanpela man i stap long Sisaria em i bin salim ol i kam long mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Spirit told me to go with them, without discriminating. These six brothers also accompanied me, and we entered into the man’s house.

block.text: Na Holi Spirit i tokim mi olsem, 'Yu go wantaim ol. Yu no ken tingting planti.' Na dispela 6 -pela brata hia ol tu ol i go wantaim mi, na mipela i go insait long haus bilong dispela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He told us how he had seen the angel standing in his house, and saying to him, ‘Send to Joppa, and get Simon, whose surname is Peter.

block.text: Na em i tokim mipela long em i bin lukim ensel i kam sanap insait long haus bilong en, na ensel i tok, 'Yu mas salim ol man i go long Jopa na painim Saimon, em i gat narapela nem Pita. Na ol i mas tokim em long kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will speak to you words by which you will be saved, you and all your house.’

block.text: Em bai i givim sampela tok long yu, na long dispela tok God bai i kisim bek yu wantaim olgeta lain i stap long haus bilong yu.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: As I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell on them, even as on us at the beginning.

block.text: Dispela man i bin singautim mi i kam, em i toktok pinis, orait mi stat long toktok, na Holi Spirit i kam daun long ol, wankain olsem em i bin kam long yumi namba wan taim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I remembered the word of the Lord, how he said, ‘John indeed baptized in water, but you will be baptized in the Holy Spirit.’

block.text: Na mi tingim gen dispela tok bipo Bikpela i bin mekim. Em i bin tok olsem, 'Jon i bin baptaisim ol manmeri long wara, tasol yupela bai i kisim baptais long Holi Spirit.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: If then God gave to them the same gift as us, when we believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I, that I could withstand God?”

block.text: Bipo yumi bilip long Bikpela Jisas Krais, na God i givim Holi Spirit olsem presen long yumi. Na nau God i givim dispela wankain presen tasol long ol. Olsem na mi husat na mi inap pasim wok God yet i mekim long ol?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard these things, they held their peace, and glorified God, saying,

block.text: Ol man i harim dispela tok bilong Pita, na ol i no gat tingting moa bilong kros. Nogat. Ol i litimapim nem bilong God na ol i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then God has also granted to the Gentiles repentance to life!”

block.text: "Nau yumi save, God i larim ol arapela lain tu i tanim bel na kisim laip."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They therefore who were scattered abroad by the oppression that arose about Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus, and Antioch, speaking the word to no one except to Jews only.

block.text: Taim ol i bin kilim Stiven i dai ol i bin mekim nogut long ol arapela manmeri i bilip long Jisas tu. Olsem na planti bilong ol i bin ranawe i go nabaut, na sampela i bin i go long distrik Fonisia na ailan Saiprus na taun Antiok, na ol i wok long autim gutnius bilong Jisas. Tasol ol i no autim tok long ol manmeri bilong ol arapela lain. Nogat. Ol i autim long ol Juda tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But there were some of them, men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who, when they had come to Antioch, spoke to the Hellenists, preaching the Lord Jesus.

block.text: Tasol i gat sampela man namel long ol, ol i man bilong Saiprus na bilong taun Sairini, ol i go long Antiok na ol i autim gutnius bilong Bikpela Jisas long ol Grik tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number believed and turned to the Lord.

block.text: Na strong bilong Bikpela i stap long ol, olsem na planti manmeri i bilip na i tanim bel na i kamap disaipel bilong Bikpela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The report concerning them came to the ears of the assembly which was in Jerusalem. They sent out Barnabas to go as far as Antioch.

block.text: Ol manmeri bilong sios long Jerusalem i harim tok long dispela, na ol i salim Barnabas i go long Antiok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had come and had seen the grace of God, he was glad. He exhorted them all, that with purpose of heart they should remain near to the Lord.

block.text: Em i go kamap na i lukim olsem God i bin helpim ol na mekim gut tru long ol, na em i amamas. Em i kirapim tingting bilong olgeta manmeri, long ol i mas bihainim Bikpela oltaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he was a good man, and full of the Holy Spirit and of faith, and many people were added to the Lord.

block.text: Barnabas em i gutpela man, na Holi Spirit i pulap long em, na em i gat strongpela bilip. Na bikpela lain manmeri ol i kam insait long lain bilong Bikpela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Barnabas went out to Tarsus to look for Saul.

block.text: Orait Barnabas i go long Tarsus bilong painim Sol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. It happened, that for a whole year they were gathered together with the assembly, and taught many people. The disciples were first called Christians in Antioch.

block.text: Em i lukim Sol pinis, orait em i bringim em i kam long Antiok. Na long wanpela yia olgeta, tupela i sindaun wantaim ol manmeri bilong sios long Antiok, na tupela i skulim bikpela lain manmeri long tok bilong God. Long Antiok ol disaipel i kisim nem Kristen namba wan taim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now in those days, prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.

block.text: Long dispela taim sampela profet i lusim Jerusalem na i kam daun long Antiok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of them named Agabus stood up. Being prompted by the Holy Spirit, he said:

block.text: Wanpela profet ol i kolim Agabus, em i sanap na long strong bilong Holi Spirit em i autim tok long

ReferenceBlocks.text: “There will be a large famine all over the world.”

block.text: bikpela hangre bai i kamap long olgeta hap bilong graun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: (This famine happened in the days of Claudius.)

block.text: Na bihain, taim Sisar Klodius i stap king, dispela hangre i kamap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Since the disciples had plenty, they each decided to send help to the brothers who lived in Judea;

block.text: Ol Kristen i harim dispela tok bilong Agabus, na ol i pasim tok long salim mani i go long ol brata long Judia, bilong helpim ol. Na olgeta Kristen i givim mani inap long skel bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They did this, sending it to the elders by Barnabas and Saul.

block.text: Na ol i salim Barnabas na Sol na tupela i bringim dispela mani i go na givim long ol hetman bilong sios.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 12
Now about that time, King Herod stretched out his hands to oppress some of the assembly.

block.text: Long dispela taim King Herot i bagarapim sampela man bilong sios.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He killed James, the brother of John, with the sword.

block.text: Em i tok, na ol i kilim i dai Jems, em brata bilong Jon, long bainat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he saw that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded to seize Peter also. This was during the days of unleavened bread.

block.text: Herot i lukim ol Juda i laikim dispela samting em i mekim, olsem na em i kalabusim Pita tu. Em i mekim dispela long taim bilong Ol Bikpela De Bilong Bret I No Gat Yis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had arrested him, he put him in prison, and delivered him to four squads of four soldiers each to guard him. He intended to bring him out to the people after the Passover.

block.text: Em i holimpas Pita na i putim em long kalabus. Em i putim Pita long han bilong 4 -pela lain soldia, na ol i senis senis long was long em. Dispela 4 -pela lain wan wan i gat 4 -pela soldia i stap long en, inap 16 soldia olgeta. Herot i laik wet inap Bikpela De Bilong Tingim De God I Larim Ol Israel I Stap Gut, em i pinis, na bai em i bringim Pita i kam na kotim em long ai bilong ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter therefore was kept in the prison, but constant prayer was made by the assembly to God for him.

block.text: Olsem na Pita i stap long haus kalabus, na ol soldia i was long em. Tasol oltaim ol manmeri bilong sios i wok long beten strong long God, bai God i ken helpim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The same night when Herod was about to bring him out, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, and was bound with two chains. Guards in front of the door kept the prison.

block.text: Orait Herot i makim wanpela de bilong bringim Pita i kamap long kot. Na long nait, taim dispela de i no kamap yet, Pita i slip i stap namel long tupela soldia. Ol i bin pasim em long tupela sen. Na ol arapela soldia i stap sentri long dua bilong haus kalabus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And behold, an angel of the Lord stood by him, and a light shone in the cell. He struck Peter on the side, and woke him up, saying,

block.text: Na wantu ensel bilong Bikpela i kamap, na lait i kamap insait long haus kalabus. Na ensel i paitim banis bilong Pita na i kirapim em, na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Stand up quickly!”

block.text: "Yu kirap kwik."

ReferenceBlocks.text: His chains fell off from his hands.

block.text: Na tupela sen i lus long han bilong Pita na i pundaun long graun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The angel said to him,

block.text: Na ensel i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get dressed and put on your sandals.”

block.text: "Pasim let na putim su,"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He did so. He said to him,

block.text: na Pita i mekim olsem. Na ensel i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Put on your cloak, and follow me.”

block.text: "Putim longpela klos bilong yu na bihainim mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: And he went out and followed him. He didn’t know that what was being done by the angel was real, but thought he saw a vision.

block.text: Na Pita i lusim dispela rum na i bihainim ensel i go. Tasol em i no save, dispela samting ensel i mekim em i kamap tru. Pita i ting em i driman tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they were past the first and the second guard, they came to the iron gate that leads into the city, which opened to them by itself. They went out, and went down one street, and immediately the angel departed from him.

block.text: Tupela i wokabaut i go na i lusim tupela soldia i stap sentri, na tupela i kamap long dua ain bilong lusim kalabus na i go long taun. Dispela dua em yet i op, na tupela i go ausait na i wokabaut i go long wanpela rot. Na kwiktaim ensel i lusim Pita na i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Peter had come to himself, he said,

block.text: Orait tingting bilong Pita i kamap klia, na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now I truly know that the Lord has sent out his angel and delivered me out of the hand of Herod, and from everything the Jewish people were expecting.”

block.text: "Nau mi save tru, Bikpela i bin salim ensel bilong en i kam, na em i kisim mi bek long han bilong Herot na long olgeta samting ol lain Juda i tingting long mekim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Thinking about that, he came to the house of Mary, the mother of John whose surname was Mark, where many were gathered together and were praying.

block.text: Na em i go long haus bilong Maria, em mama bilong Jon. Jon em i gat narapela nem Mak. Planti manmeri i bung long dispela haus na ol i beten i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a maid named Rhoda came to answer.

block.text: Pita i paitim dua ausait long haus, na wanpela wokmeri, nem bilong en Roda, em i kam bilong opim dua.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When she recognized Peter’s voice, she didn’t open the gate for joy, but ran in, and reported that Peter was standing in front of the gate.
They said to her,

block.text: Tasol taim em i harim maus bilong Pita, bel bilong en i amamas tumas, na em i no opim dua. Nogat. Em i ran i go insait na i tokim ol manmeri olsem, "Pita i kam i stap long dua!"
Na ol i tokim em olsem,

block.characterId: people praying at John Mark's mother's house

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people praying at John Mark's mother's house
ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are crazy!”

block.text: "Yu longlong, o?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But she insisted:

block.text: Tasol em i strong na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is true… he is at the door!”

block.text: "Nogat. Tru tumas em i stap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Na ol i tok,

block.characterId: people praying at John Mark's mother's house

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people praying at John Mark's mother's house
ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is his angel.”

block.text: "Ating yu lukim ensel bilong en tasol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter continued knocking. When they had opened, they saw him, and were amazed.

block.text: Tasol Pita i wok long paitim dua yet. Orait ol i go opim dua na ol i lukim em, na ol i kirap nogut tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, beckoning to them with his hand to be silent, declared to them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. He said,

block.text: Na Pita i mekim nais long han bai ol i mas pasim maus. Na em i stori long ol long pasin Bikpela i bin mekim bilong bringim em i kam ausait long haus kalabus. Na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell these things to James, and to the brothers.”

block.text: "Yupela i mas tokim Jems na ol brata long ol dispela samting."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he departed, and went to another place.

block.text: Na Pita i lusim ol na i go long narapela hap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers about what had become of Peter.

block.text: Long moning ol soldia i lukim Pita i no stap na ol i kirap nogut tru, na ol i wok long askim ol yet olsem, "Pita i go we?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Herod had sought for him, and didn’t find him, he examined the guards, and commanded that they should be put to death. He went down from Judea to Caesarea, and stayed there.

block.text: Herot i painimaut olsem Pita i no i stap, na em i tokim ol man long go painim Pita, tasol ol i no lukim em. Olsem na em i kotim ol dispela soldia i bin was long Pita, na em i tok long ol i mas i dai. Na bihain, Herot i lusim Judia na i go daun long taun Sisaria na i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Herod was very angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon. They came with one accord to him, and, having befriended Blastus, the king’s personal aide, they asked for peace because their country depended on the king’s country for food.

block.text: King Herot i gat bikpela kros long ol manmeri bilong taun Tair na Saidon. Olsem na ol i bung wantaim na i kam lukim em, long wanem, ol i save kisim kaikai bilong ol long kantri Herot i bosim. Ol i toktok pastaim wantaim Blastus, em ofisa i bosim rum slip bilong king, na em i wanbel wantaim ol. Na bihain, ol i go lukim Herot na askim em long marimari long ol na mekim i dai dispela kros.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On an appointed day, Herod dressed himself in royal clothing, sat on the throne, and gave a speech to them.
The people shouted,

block.text: Orait Herot i makim wanpela de, na long dispela de em i putim bilas bilong king, na em i sindaun long sia king bilong en, na em i mekim bikpela tok long ol.
Na ol manmeri i wok long singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The voice of a god, and not of a man!”

block.text: "Em i maus bilong wanpela god. Em i no maus bilong man."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately an angel of the Lord struck him, because he didn’t give God the glory, and he was eaten by worms and died.

block.text: Herot i harim dispela tok bilong ol, na em i no laik litimapim nem bilong God, olsem na wantu ensel bilong Bikpela i paitim em. Na sik nogut i kamap long en, na ol liklik snek i kaikai em, na em i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the word of God grew and multiplied.

block.text: Tasol tok bilong Bikpela i kamap strong na i go long planti ples.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Barnabas and Saul returned to Jerusalem, when they had fulfilled their service, also taking with them John whose surname was Mark.

block.text: Na Barnabas wantaim Sol tupela i pinisim wok bilong tupela long Jerusalem, na tupela i go bek long Antiok. Na tupela i bringim Jon Mak i go wantaim tupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 13
Now in the assembly that was at Antioch there were some prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon who was called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen the foster brother of Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.

block.text: Sios bilong Antiok i gat sampela man i save autim tok profet na sampela man i save skulim ol manmeri long pasin God i laikim. Nem bilong ol i olsem, Barnabas, na Simeon, em i gat narapela nem Niger, na Lusius bilong taun Sairini, na Sol, na Manain, em wanpela poroman bilong namba wan gavman Herot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they served the Lord and fasted, the Holy Spirit said,

block.text: Wanpela taim ol manmeri bilong sios i lotu long Bikpela na ol i tambu long kaikai. Na Holi Spirit i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Separate Barnabas and Saul for me, for the work to which I have called them.”

block.text: "Yupela i mas makim Barnabas wantaim Sol bilong mekim dispela wok mi bin singautim tupela long mekim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then, when they had fasted and prayed and laid their hands on them, they sent them away.

block.text: Olsem na ol i tambu long kaikai na i mekim prea, na ol i putim han long tupela, na ol i salim tupela i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So, being sent out by the Holy Spirit, they went down to Seleucia. From there they sailed to Cyprus.

block.text: Holi Spirit i salim tupela i go, na tupela i go daun long taun Selusia. Long Selusia tupela i kalap long sip, na sip i kisim tupela i go long ailan Saiprus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they were at Salamis, they proclaimed the word of God in the Jewish synagogues. They had also John as their attendant.

block.text: Tupela i kamap long taun Salamis, na tupela i go long ol haus lotu bilong ol Juda na autim tok bilong God. Jon Mak i bin i go wantaim tupela, na em i helpim tupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had gone through the island to Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name was Bar Jesus.

block.text: Tupela i wokabaut long olgeta hap bilong ailan Saiprus, na tupela i kamap long taun Pafos. Long Pafos tupela i lukim wanpela man i stap, nem bilong en Barjisas. Em i man bilong mekim posin na ol kain kain marila samting. Na em i wanpela giaman profet bilong lain Juda.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was with the proconsul, Sergius Paulus, a man of understanding. This man summoned Barnabas and Saul, and sought to hear the word of God.

block.text: Dispela man i save stap wantaim namba wan gavman, nem bilong en Sergius Paulus. Sergius Paulus em i man i gat gutpela tingting na save. Em i singautim Barnabas na Sol i kam, long wanem, em i laik harim tok bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn aside the proconsul from the faith.

block.text: Dispela man bilong mekim posin na marila samting, long tok Grik ol i save kolim em long nem Elimas. Orait Elimas i laik daunim wok bilong Barnabas na Sol, long wanem, em i no laik bai namba wan gavman i bilip long Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Saul, who is also called Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, fastened his eyes on him,
and said,

block.text: Tasol Holi Spirit i pulap long Sol, narapela nem bilong en Pol, na em i lukluk strong long Elimas na i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Full of all deceit and all cunning, you son of the devil, you enemy of all righteousness!

block.text: "Yu pikinini bilong Satan. Yu birua bilong olgeta stretpela pasin. Olgeta pasin bilong giaman na olgeta pasin nogut i pulap tru long yu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Will you not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?

block.text: Yu save bagarapim olgeta stretpela rot bilong Bikpela. Ating yu no laik lusim dispela pasin?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now, behold, the hand of the Lord is on you, and you will be blind, not seeing the sun for a season!”

block.text: Orait harim. Nau han bilong Bikpela em i paitim yu, na ai bilong yu bai i pas. Nau bai yu no inap lukim san, na bai yu stap olsem longtaim liklik."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately a mist and darkness fell on him. He went around seeking someone to lead him by the hand.

block.text: Pol i tok olsem na wantu tasol samting olsem klaut i tudak olgeta i pasim ai bilong Elimas. Na em i go nabaut na i wok long painim man bilong holim han bilong em na soim rot long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the proconsul, when he saw what was done, believed, being astonished at the teaching of the Lord.

block.text: Namba wan gavman i lukim dispela samting, na em i bilip. Tingting bilong en i kirap tru long tok bilong Bikpela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Paul and his company set sail from Paphos, and came to Perga in Pamphylia. John departed from them and returned to Jerusalem.
