block.text: Pol na ol man i wokabaut wantaim em ol i lusim taun Pafos, na sip i kisim ol i go long taun Perga long provins Pamfilia. Tasol Jon Mak i lusim ol, na em i go bek long Jerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they, passing on from Perga, came to Antioch of Pisidia. They went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day, and sat down.

block.text: Ol i lusim Perga, na ol i wokabaut i go kamap long taun Antiok long distrik Pisidia. Na long de Sabat ol i go insait long haus lotu bilong ol Juda, na ol i sindaun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After the reading of the law and the prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent to them, saying,

block.text: Ol hetman bilong haus lotu i ritim pinis tok bilong lo na tok bilong ol profet, orait ol i tokim wanpela man long i go tokim Pol wantaim ol wanwok bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers, if you have any word of exhortation for the people, speak.”

block.text: "Ol brata, sapos yupela i gat wanpela tok bilong strongim bel bilong ol manmeri, orait yupela i ken autim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul stood up, and beckoning with his hand said,

block.text: Na Pol i sanap na i mekim nais long han bai ol i pasim maus, na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Men of Israel, and you who fear God, listen.

block.text: "Yupela man bilong Israel, na yupela ol arapela man i save aninit long God, yupela harim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The God of this people chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they stayed as aliens in the land of Egypt, and with an uplifted arm, he led them out of it.

block.text: God bilong ol lain Israel em i makim ol tumbuna bilong mipela olsem ol manmeri bilong em yet. Na taim ol i lusim graun bilong ol na ol i go i stap long Isip, em i mekim ol i kamap bikpela lain. Bihain, long strong bilong em yet, em i kisim ol long Isip na bringim ol i kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For a period of about forty years he put up with them in the wilderness.

block.text: Na long taim ol i stap long ples wesan nating, em i karim hevi long pasin bilong ol inap long 40 yia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, he gave them their land for an inheritance, for about four hundred fifty years.

block.text: Long graun Kenan God i bagarapim 7 -pela lain manmeri, na em i givim dispela graun long ol Israel, bai em i ken i stap graun bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After these things he gave them judges until Samuel the prophet.

block.text: Olgeta dispela samting i kamap insait long 450 yia samting. Na bihain long ol Israel i kisim graun pinis, God i makim ol hetman bilong bosim ol Israel, i go inap long taim bilong profet Samuel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Afterward they asked for a king, and God gave to them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for forty years.

block.text: "Orait long dispela taim ol i singaut long kisim wanpela king, na God i makim Sol bilong bosim ol, na em i stap king inap long 40 yia. Sol em i pikinini bilong Kis, em man bilong lain Benjamin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had removed him, he raised up David to be their king, to whom he also testified, ‘I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after my heart, who will do all my will.’

block.text: Tasol God i rausim em na i makim Devit bilong i stap king bilong ol. Em i tokim ol man long Devit olsem, 'Mi lukim pinis Devit, pikinini bilong Jesi, na bel bilong mi i laikim dispela man. Em bai i bihainim olgeta laik bilong mi.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: From this man’s seed, God has brought salvation to Israel according to his promise.

block.text: Na God i mekim olsem bipo em i bin promis, na long lain bilong dispela man Devit, God i makim wanpela man bilong kisim bek yumi, na i salim em i kam long Israel. Dispela man em Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Before Jesus came, John had first preached the baptism of repentance to Israel.

block.text: "Taim Jisas i no statim wok bilong en yet, Jon i bin autim tok long ol Israel i mas tanim bel na kisim baptais.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As John was fulfilling his course, he said, ‘What do you suppose that I am? I am not he. But behold, one comes after me the sandals of whose feet I am not worthy to untie.’

block.text: Klostu Jon i laik pinisim wok bilong en, na em i tok olsem, 'Yupela i ting mi husat? Mi no dispela man yupela i wetim. Tasol yupela harim. Bihain bai wanpela man i kam, na mi no gutpela man inap long mi lusim string i pasim su bilong en.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Brothers, children of the stock of Abraham, and those among you who fear God, the word of this salvation is sent out to you.

block.text: "Ol brata, yupela man bilong lain bilong Abraham, na yupela ol arapela man i save aninit long God, harim. Dispela tok bilong God i kisim bek ol manmeri, em God i salim i kam long yumi tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the inhabitants of Jerusalem and their rulers did not recognize Jesus. By condemning him they fulfilled the words of the prophets which are read every sabbath day.”

block.text: Ol man i stap long Jerusalem, wantaim ol hetman bilong ol, ol i no save gut long dispela man. Na ol i no tingim gut tok bilong ol profet, ol i save ritim long olgeta de Sabat. Olsem na ol i bin tok long dispela man i mas i dai, na long dispela pasin ol inapim tok ol profet i bin mekim bipo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Though they found no cause for death, they still asked Pilate to have him killed.

block.text: Ol i no painim wanpela rong long em inap long ol i kotim em na kilim em i dai, tasol ol i strong long namba wan gavman Pailat i mas kilim em i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had fulfilled all things that were written about him, they took him down from the tree, and laid him in a tomb.

block.text: Ol i mekim pinis olgeta samting bipo ol profet i bin tok long ol man bai i mekim long em, orait ol i kisim em i kam daun long diwai kros, na ol i planim em long wanpela matmat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But God raised him from the dead.

block.text: Tasol God i kirapim em bek long matmat,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was seen for many days by those who came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are his witnesses to the people.

block.text: na long planti de ol man i bin lusim Galili na i go long Jerusalem wantaim em, ol i bin lukim em. Nau ol dispela man ol i save autim tok bilong em long ol lain Juda.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We bring you good news of the promise made to the fathers,

block.text: "Na mipela i autim gutnius long yupela olsem. God i bin promis long ol tumbuna long em bai i salim man i kam bilong kisim bek yumi,

ReferenceBlocks.text: that God has fulfilled the same to us, their children, in that he raised up Jesus. As it is also written in the second psalm, ‘You are my Son. Today I have become your father.’”

block.text: na nau em i kirapim Jisas long matmat bilong em i ken inapim dispela promis long yumi ol lain pikinini bilong ol. Tok bilong dispela samting i stap long namba 2 song bilong Buk Song. Dispela tok i olsem, 'Yu pikinini bilong mi. Nau mi kamap papa bilong yu.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Concerning that he raised him up from the dead, now no more to return to corruption, he has spoken thus: ‘I will give you the holy and sure blessings of David.’

block.text: God i kirapim em long matmat, na em i no inap i go bek long matmat moa na i sting. Em i olsem God i bin tok, 'Bai mi mekim gut long yupela na givim ol gutpela samting long yupela, olsem bipo mi bin promis long King Devit. Na dispela samting bai i kamap tru olsem mi bin tok.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore he says also in another psalm, ‘You will not allow your Holy One to see decay.’

block.text: Na i gat narapela tok tu i stap long buk bilong God. Em i olsem, 'Bai yu no larim man yu bin makim bilong mekim wok bilong yu i sting long matmat.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: For David, after he had in his own generation served the counsel of God, fell asleep, and was laid with his fathers, and saw decay.

block.text: Yumi save, long taim Devit i stap long graun, em i bin bihainim laik bilong God. Na bihain em i dai na ol i planim em long matmat bilong ol tumbuna bilong en, na bodi bilong en i sting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he whom God raised up saw no decay.

block.text: Tasol dispela man God i kirapim long matmat, bodi bilong en i no sting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Be it known unto you therefore, brethren, that through this man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins.

block.text: Olsem na, ol brata, mipela i autim tok long yupela olsem. Yupela i ken save gut, dispela man em i kam bilong lusim ol sin bilong yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Through him everyone who believes is justified from all things, from which they could not be justified by the law of Moses.

block.text: Lo bilong Moses i no inap long lusim sin bilong yupela na kolim yupela stretpela man. Tasol dispela man em i save lusim olgeta sin bilong olgeta man i bilip long em, na em i kolim ol i stretpela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Beware therefore, lest that come on you which is spoken in the prophets:

block.text: Olsem na yupela lukaut. Nogut dispela samting bipo ol profet i bin tok long en, em i kam long yupela. Ol i bin tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘Behold, you scoffers, and wonder, and perish; for I work a work in your days, a work which you will in no way believe, if one declares it to you.’”

block.text: 'Yupela man bilong tok bilas, yupela lukluk, na bai yupela i kirap nogut na bai yupela i bagarap. Mi bai mekim narakain samting i kamap namel long yupela. Na sapos wanpela man i tokim yupela long dispela samting mi laik mekim, bai yupela i no inap bilipim.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when the Jews went out of the synagogue, the Gentiles begged him, saying:

block.text: Pol i autim tok pinis, orait em wantaim Barnabas i laik wokabaut i go ausait, na ol manmeri i tokim tupela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Preach these words to us on the next Sabbath.”

block.text: "Long dispela de Sabat i laik kamap, yutupela i mas kam bek na autim sampela tok moa long mipela long ol dispela samting."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when the synagogue broke up, many of the Jews and of the devout proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas; Paul and Barnabas spoke to them and urged them to continue in the grace of God.

block.text: Na ol i lusim haus lotu na i go ausait, na planti Juda wantaim planti manmeri bilong ol arapela lain i bihainim pasin bilong lotu bilong ol Juda, ol i bihainim Pol wantaim Barnabas. Na tupela i givim tok long ol na kirapim tingting bilong ol long ol i mas bihainim laik bilong God na i stap strong long marimari bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The next Sabbath almost the whole city was gathered together to hear the word of God.

block.text: Long de Sabat bihain, klostu olgeta manmeri bilong dispela taun ol i kam bung bilong harim Pol tupela Barnabas i autim tok bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with jealousy, and contradicted the things which were spoken by Paul, and blasphemed.

block.text: Tasol taim ol Juda i lukim dispela bikpela lain manmeri, bel bilong ol i nogut tru. Na ol i wok long daunim tok bilong Pol, na ol i tok bilas long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul and Barnabas spoke out boldly, and said,

block.text: Olsem na Pol tupela Barnabas i tokaut strong long ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It was necessary that God’s word should be spoken to you first. Since indeed you thrust it from you, and judge yourselves unworthy of eternal life, behold, we turn to the Gentiles.

block.text: "Tru, mitupela i mas givim tok bilong God long yupela Juda pastaim. Tasol yupela i givim baksait long dispela tok, na i olsem yupela yet i tok, 'Mipela i no inap long kisim laip i stap gut oltaim.' Olsem na yupela harim. Nau mitupela i no ken autim tok moa long yupela. Mitupela bai i autim tok long ol arapela lain,

ReferenceBlocks.text: For so has the Lord commanded us, saying, ‘I have set you as a light for the Gentiles, that you should bring salvation to the uttermost parts of the earth.’”

block.text: long wanem, Bikpela i tokim mipela olsem, 'Mi mekim yu i kamap olsem lait bilong olgeta kantri, na bai yu helpim ol manmeri long olgeta hap bilong graun, na bai mi kisim bek ol.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: As the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the word of God. As many as were appointed to eternal life believed.

block.text: Ol manmeri bilong ol arapela lain i harim dispela tok, na bel bilong ol i gutpela tru. Ol i amamas long tok bilong Bikpela. Na olgeta manmeri God i bin makim bilong kisim laip i stap gut oltaim, dispela ol manmeri i bilip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord’s word was spread abroad throughout all the region.

block.text: Na ol i kisim tok bilong Bikpela i go nabaut long olgeta hap bilong dispela distrik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Jews stirred up the devout and prominent women and the chief men of the city, and stirred up a persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and threw them out of their borders.

block.text: Tasol ol Juda i kirapim bel bilong ol meri i gat biknem na i save bihainim pasin bilong lotu bilong ol, na ol i kirapim bel bilong ol hetman bilong dispela taun, na ol manmeri bilong taun i stat long mekim nogut long Pol tupela Barnabas. Na ol i rausim tupela long dispela distrik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came to Iconium.

block.text: Olsem na tupela i rausim pipia graun i stap long lek bilong tupela, bai ol manmeri i ken save ol i gat asua long dispela pasin bilong ol. Na tupela i lusim Antiok na i go long taun Aikoniam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples were filled with joy with the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Tasol Holi Spirit i pulap long ol manmeri bilong Antiok i bilip long Jisas, na ol i amamas tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 14
It happened in Iconium that they entered together into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spoke that a great multitude both of Jews and of Greeks believed.

block.text: Long Aikoniam Pol na Barnabas i mekim wankain pasin olsem tupela i bin mekim long Antiok. Tupela i go insait long haus lotu bilong ol Juda, na tupela i autim tok. Tupela i autim gut tru na bikpela lain Juda na Grik ol i bilip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the disbelieving Jews stirred up and embittered the souls of the Gentiles against the brothers.

block.text: Tasol sampela Juda i no bilip, ol i kirapim bel bilong ol manmeri bilong ol arapela lain, na ol i mekim ol i bel nogut long ol manmeri i bilip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore they stayed there a long time, speaking boldly in the Lord. The Lord testified to the word of his grace by granting signs and wonders to be done by their hands.

block.text: Tupela i stap longpela taim long Aikoniam, na tupela i no pret long autim tok bilong marimari bilong Bikpela. Na Bikpela i givim strong long tupela, na tupela i wokim ol kain kain mirakel. Long dispela pasin Bikpela i soimol manmeri olsem, dispela tok tupela i autim, em i tru tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the multitude of the city was divided. Part sided with the Jews, and part with the apostles.

block.text: Tasol ol manmeri bilong dispela taun ol i bruk tupela lain. Sampela i wanbel wantaim ol Juda, na sampela i wanbel wantaim tupela aposel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of both the Gentiles and the Jews, with their rulers, made a violent attempt to mistreat and stone them.

block.text: Bihain ol Juda wantaim ol man bilong ol arapela lain ol i kirap wantaim ol hetman bilong ol, na ol i laik mekim nogut long Pol tupela Barnabas. Ol i laik tromoi ol ston na kilim tupela i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they became aware of it, they fled to the cities of Lycaonia, Lystra, Derbe, and the surrounding region.

block.text: Barnabas tupela Sol i harim tok long dispela samting ol man i laik mekim, orait tupela i ranawe i go long tupela taun bilong distrik Likonia, em taun Listra na Derbe, na long ol ples i stap klostu long dispela tupela taun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There they preached the Good News.

block.text: Na tupela i wok long autim gutnius long ol dispela ples.

ReferenceBlocks.text: At Lystra a certain man sat, crippled in his feet from birth, who had never walked.

block.text: Long taun Listra i gat wanpela man i stap, em i no gat strong long lek bilong en. Taim mama i karim em, em i lek nogut pinis na em i no bin wokabaut liklik. Em i save sindaun tasol i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was listening to Paul speaking. Paul fastened his eyes on him, and saw that he had faith to be made whole.

block.text: Dispela man i harim Pol i autim tok. Na Pol i lukluk strong long em, na em i lukim olsem dispela man i bilip na em inap long kamap gutpela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said with a loud voice,

block.text: Olsem na Pol i tokaut strong olsem

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Stand upright on your feet!”

block.text: "Yu kirap na sanap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He leaped up and walked.

block.text: Orait dispela man i kalap na sanap na em i wokabaut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the multitude saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voice, saying in the language of Lycaonia,

block.text: Planti manmeri i lukim dispela samting Pol i mekim, na ol i singaut long tok ples bilong Likonia olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The gods have come down to us in the likeness of men!”

block.text: "Ol god i kamap olsem man, na ol i kam daun long yumi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They called Barnabas “Jupiter,” and Paul “Mercury,” because he was the chief speaker.

block.text: Na Barnabas ol i kolim god Sus. Na Pol em i man bilong mekim toktok, olsem na ol i kolim em god Hermes.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The priest of Jupiter, whose temple was in front of their city, brought oxen and garlands to the gates, and would have made a sacrifice along with the multitudes.

block.text: Haus lotu bilong god Sus i stap klostu long dua bilong banis i raunim dispela taun. Na pris bilong dispela haus lotu em i kisim sampela bulmakau man na sampela plaua ol i bin ropim, na em i kam long dua bilong banis bilong taun. Em wantaim ol manmeri ol i laik mekim ofa long Barnabas wantaim Pol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the apostles, Barnabas and Paul, heard of it, they tore their clothes, and sprang into the multitude, crying out,

block.text: Tasol tupela aposel i harim tok long dispela samting ol i laik mekim, na tupela i kirap nogut tru na brukim klos bilong tupela. Na tupela i ran i go namel long ol manmeri na tupela i singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Men, why are you doing these things? We also are men of like passions with you. We bring you good news, that you should turn from these vain things to the living God, who made the sky and the earth and the sea, and all that is in them.

block.text: "Ol pren, watpo yupela i mekim dispela pasin? Mitupela i man tasol, wankain olsem yupela. Mitupela i autim gutnius long yupela olsem, yupela i mas lusim ol dispela samting nating yupela i save lotu long en, na yupela i mas tanim i go long God i gat laip. Em God i bin wokim skai na graun na solwara, wantaim olgeta samting i stap long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the generations gone by, He allowed all the nations to walk in their own ways.

block.text: Tru, long taim bilong ol tumbuna em i bin larim olgeta lain manmeri i wokabaut long pasin bilong ol yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yet he didn’t leave himself without witness, in that he did good and gave you rains from the sky and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness.”

block.text: Tasol em i no bin hait olgeta bai ol man i no ken save long em. Nogat. Oltaim em i save mekim gutpela pasin long yupela. Em i mekim ren i lusim skai na i kam daun long yupela, na em i mekim planti gutpela kaikai i kamap. Em i givim yupela planti kaikai na i mekim bel bilong yupela i amamas."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even saying these things, they hardly stopped the multitudes from making a sacrifice to them.

block.text: Tupela i mekim dispela tok, tasol tupela i hatwok tru long pasim ol manmeri, bai ol i no ken mekim ofa long tupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jews came from Antioch and Iconium and they persuaded the crowd to take their side. Then they stoned Paul and dragged him out of town, because they thought that he was dead.

block.text: Tasol bihain sampela Juda bilong taun Antiok na Aikoniam i kam long taun Listra, na ol i pulim tingting bilong ol manmeri na mekim ol i birua long Pol. Olsem na ol i tromoi ston long Pol. Na taim ol i ting em i dai pinis, ol i pulim bodi bilong en i go lusim i stap ausait long taun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But as the disciples stood around him, he rose up, and entered into the city. On the next day he went out with Barnabas to Derbe.

block.text: Tasol ol manmeri i bilip long Jisas, ol i kam sanap raunim em, na Pol i kirap gen na i go insait long taun. Na long de bihain em i go wantaim Barnabas long taun Derbe.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had preached the Good News to that city, and had made many disciples, they returned to Lystra, Iconium, and Antioch.

block.text: Tupela i autim gutnius long Derbe, na tupela i mekim planti manmeri i kamap disaipel. Na bihain tupela i go bek long Listra na Aikoniam na Antiok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They strengthened the disciples and encouraged them to continue in the faith, and said:

block.text: na tupela i strongim bel bilong ol disaipel. Tupela i tok strong long ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Through many afflictions we will enter into the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: "Yupela i mas i stap strong long bilip. Yumi laik i go insait long kingdom bilong God, tasol pastaim yumi mas wokabaut long rot i gat planti hevi i stap long en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had appointed elders for them in every assembly, and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord, on whom they had believed.

block.text: Na tupela i makim ol hetman bilong olgeta sios. Na tupela i tambu long kaikai na i mekim prea, na long dispela pasin tupela i putim ol dispela lain i bilip long Bikpela long han bilong Bikpela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They passed through Pisidia, and came to Pamphylia.

block.text: Bihain Barnabas na Sol i wokabaut i go namel long distrik Pisidia, na tupela i go kamap long provins Pamfilia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had spoken the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia.

block.text: Tupela i autim tok bilong God long taun Perga, na bihain tupela i go daun long taun Atalia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: From there they sailed to Antioch, from where they had been committed to the grace of God for the work which they had fulfilled.

block.text: Long Atalia tupela i kalap long sip, na sip i kisim tupela i go long Antiok, em dispela taun bipo ol Kristen i bin putim tupela long han bilong God, bai em i ken marimari long tupela, na tupela i ken mekim dispela wok. Nau tupela i mekim pinis, na tupela i go bek long Antiok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had arrived, and had gathered the assembly together, they reported all the things that God had done with them, and that he had opened a door of faith to the nations.

block.text: Tupela i kamap pinis, orait tupela i singautim ol manmeri bilong sios i kam bung. Na tupela i tokim ol long olgeta samting God i bin mekim long han bilong tupela.Tupela i tok olsem, "God i bin opim rot long ol manmeri bilong ol arapela lain, na ol i bilip."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They stayed there with the disciples for a long time.

block.text: Na tupela i stap planti de wantaim ol disaipel long Antiok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 15
Some men came down from Judea and taught the brothers,

block.text: Orait sampela man bilong Judia i kam daun long Antiok na ol i skulim ol Kristen olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Unless you are circumcised after the custom of Moses, you can’t be saved.”

block.text: "Sapos yupela i no bihainim pasin bilong Moses na ol i no katim skin bilong yupela, orait God bai i no inap kisim bek yupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore when Paul and Barnabas had no small discord and discussion with them. They appointed Paul and Barnabas and some others of them to go up to Jerusalem to the apostles and elders about this question.

block.text: Pol tupela Barnabas i harim tok ol dispela man i mekim, na tupela i kirapim bikpela tok pait wantaim ol, na ol i paitim toktok moa yet long dispela samting. Olsem na ol Kristen i makim Pol na Barnabas wantaim ol arapela man bilong i go long Jerusalem na stretim tok wantaim ol aposel na ol hetman bilong sios.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They, being sent on their way by the assembly, passed through both Phoenicia and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the Gentiles. They caused great joy to all the brothers.

block.text: Ol Kristen i salim ol i go, na ol i wokabaut i go namel long distrik Fonisia na Samaria. Ol i wok long toksave long ol Kristen bilong dispela tupela distrik, long God i bin tanim bel bilong ol manmeri bilong ol arapela lain. Ol Kristen i harim dispela tok na ol belgut tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had come to Jerusalem, they were received by the assembly and the apostles and the elders, and they reported all things that God had done with them.

block.text: Ol i go kamap long Jerusalem, na olgeta manmeri bilong sios wantaim ol aposel na hetman ol i gude tru long ol. Na Pol tupela Barnabas i tokim ol long olgeta samting God i bin mekim long han bilong tupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But some of the sect of the Pharisees who believed rose up, saying,

block.text: Tasol sampela Kristen bilong lain bilong ol Farisi ol i kirap na ol i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is necessary to circumcise them, and to command them to keep the law of Moses.”

block.text: "Sapos ol man bilong ol arapela lain i laik kam insait long lain bilong yumi, orait yupela i mas katim skin bilong ol, na yupela i mas tokim ol long ol i mas bihainim lo bilong Moses."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The apostles and the elders were gathered together to see about this matter.

block.text: Orait na ol aposel na ol hetman ol i bung bilong stretim dispela tok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When there had been much discussion, Peter rose up and said to them,

block.text: Ol i mekim planti toktok pinis, na Pita i sanap na i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers, you know that a good while ago God made a choice among you, that by my mouth the nations should hear the word of the Good News, and believe.

block.text: "Ol brata, yupela i save, bipo God i tilim wok long yumi, na em i makim mi bilong givim gutnius long ol arapela lain, bai ol i ken harim na bilip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God, who knows the heart, testified about them, giving them the Holy Spirit, just like he did to us.

block.text: God i save long bel bilong olgeta manmeri, na em i givim Holi Spirit long ol, wankain olsem em i bin givim long yumi. Long dispela pasin em i soim yumi olsem, bel bilong en i amamas long kisim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He made no distinction between us and them, cleansing their hearts by faith.

block.text: Em i no mekim wanpela pasin long yumi na narapela pasin long ol. Nogat. Ol i bilip long em, na long rot bilong dispela bilip tasol em i mekim ol i kamap klin long ai bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now therefore why do you tempt God, that you should put a yoke on the neck of the disciples which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?

block.text: Olsem na bilong wanem yupela i laik traim God nau? Yupela i no ken pasim dispela hevipela samting long sol bilong ol Kristen. Bipo ol tumbuna bilong yumi na yumi tu i no inap long karim dispela hevi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But we believe that we are saved through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, just as they are.”

block.text: Tasol yumi bilip olsem, long marimari bilong Bikpela Jisas, God bai i kisim bek yumi, olsem em i kisim bek ol dispela man tu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: All those assembled kept silence, and they listened to Barnabas and Paul reporting what signs and wonders God had done among the nations through them.

block.text: Pita i tok olsem, orait ol man i kibung i stap, ol i no mekim wanpela tok. Ol i putim yau long tok bilong Barnabas wantaim Pol. Na tupela i autim tok bilong olkain mirakel God i bin wokim long han bilong tupela namel long ol manmeri bilong ol arapela lain.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After they were silent, James answered,

block.text: Tupela i tok pinis, orait Jems i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers, listen to me.
Simeon has reported how God first visited the nations, to take out of them a people for his name.

block.text: "Ol brata, yupela harim tok bilong mi.
Saimon i tokim yupela pinis long namba wan taim God i kam long ol man bilong ol arapela lain, bilong kisim ol lain manmeri bilong ol na mekim ol i kamap lain bilong em yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This agrees with the words of the prophets. As it is written,

block.text: Na tok bilong ol profet tu em i wankain. Ol i bin raitim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘After these things I will return. I will again build the tabernacle of David, which has fallen. I will again build its ruins. I will set it up again.

block.text: 'Bikpela i tok, "Lain bilong Devit i olsem wanpela haus sel i pundaun pinis. Tasol bihain bai mi kam bek, na bai mi sanapim gen. Ol samting bilong dispela haus i bagarap, em bai mi wokim nupela gen, na bai mi sanapim gen dispela haus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the rest of men may seek after the Lord; All the Gentiles who are called by my name, Says the Lord, who does all these things.

block.text: Then the rest of men may seek after the Lord; All the Gentiles who are called by my name, Says the Lord, who does all these things.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All his works are known to God from eternity.’”

block.text: All his works are known to God from eternity.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Therefore my judgment is that we don’t trouble those from among the Gentiles who turn to God.

block.text: "Olsem na tingting bilong mi em i olsem. Yumi no ken givim hevi long ol dispela man bilong ol arapela lain i bin tanim bel i go long God. Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Instead, we write to them that they abstain from the pollution of idols, from sexual immorality, from what is strangled, and from blood.

block.text: Mobeta yumi raitim pas i go long ol, na tokim ol olsem, ol i no ken kisim kaikai samting ol man i bin ofaim long ol giaman god na long dispela pasin em i kamap doti long ai bilong God. Na ol i no ken mekim ol kain kain pasin pamuk. Na ol i no ken kaikai abus ol man i pasim nek bilong en na kilim i dai, long wanem, ol i no ken kaikai abus i gat blut i stap yet long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Moses from generations of old has in every city those who preach him, being read in the synagogues every Sabbath.”

block.text: Yumi save, long bipo yet na i kam inap long nau, long olgeta taun bilong ol arapela lain i gat ol man i save autim tok bilong Moses. Na long olgeta de Sabat ol i save ritim tok bilong em insait long ol haus lotu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then it seemed good to the apostles and the elders, with the whole assembly, to choose men out of their company, and send them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas: They chose Judas called Barsabbas, and Silas, chief men among the brothers.

block.text: Orait ol aposel na ol hetman wantaim olgeta manmeri bilong sios ol i pasim tok, na ol i makim tupela man bilong ol. Wanpela em Judas, em i gat narapela nem Barsabas, na narapela em Sailas. Tupela i stap lida namel long ol Kristen. Na ol i salim tupela i go long taun Antiok wantaim Pol na Barnabas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They wrote these things by their hand:

block.text: Long han bilong tupela ol i salim wanpela pas i gat tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The apostles, the elders, and the brothers, to the brothers who are of the Gentiles in Antioch, Syria, and Cilicia: greetings.

block.text: "Mipela aposel na mipela hetman, mipela ol brata bilong yupela, mipela i raitim dispela pas i go long yupela ol brata bilong ol arapela lain i stap long taun Antiok na long olgeta hap bilong provins Siria na Silisia. Gude tru ol brata.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Because we have heard that some who went out from us have troubled you with words, unsettling your souls, saying, ‘You must be circumcised and keep the law,’ to whom we gave no commandment;

block.text: Mipela i harim pinis olsem, sampela man bilong mipela i bin kam long yupela na mekim yupela i kirap nogut long toktok bilong ol. Na ol i wok long paulim tingting bilong yupela. Tasol mipela i no tokim ol long mekim olsem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: it seemed good to us, having come to one accord, to choose out men and send them to you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul.

block.text: Mipela i harim tok long dispela samting i bin kamap, olsem na mipela i wanbel na mipela i pasim tok long makim tupela brata na salim tupela i kam long yupela, wantaim tupela brata mipela i save laikim tumas, em Barnabas na Pol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: These men have risked their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

block.text: Maski tupela inap tru long lusim laip bilong tupela, tupela i no pret long tokaut long nem bilong Jisas Krais, Bikpela bilong yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who themselves will also tell you the same things by word of mouth.

block.text: Olsem na mipela i salim Judas tupela Sailas i kam long yupela, na tupela bai i givim dispela tok long yupela long maus bilong tupela yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it seemed good to the Holy Spirit, and to us, to lay no greater burden on you than these necessary things:

block.text: Holi Spirit i stap wantaim mipela na mipela i pasim tok olsem, mipela i no laik putim planti hevi long yupela. Olsem na yupela i mas bihainim ol dispela pasin tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: that you abstain from things sacrificed to idols, from blood, from things strangled, and from sexual immorality, from which if you keep yourselves, it will be well with you. Farewell.”

block.text: Yupela i no ken kaikai abus ol i bin kilim bilong mekim ofa long ol giaman god. Na yupela i no ken kaikai abus i gat blut i stap yet long en, olsem na yupela i no ken kaikai abus ol man i bin pasim nek bilong en na kilim i dai. Na yupela i mas abrusim olkain pasin pamuk. Sapos yupela i lukaut gut na yupela i abrusim ol dispela pasin, em bai i gutpela. Em tasol tok bilong mipela. Yupela i ken i stap gut."

ReferenceBlocks.text: So, when they were sent off, they came to Antioch. Having gathered the multitude together, they delivered the letter.

block.text: Orait ol manmeri bilong sios i salim ol dispela man na ol i go daun long Antiok. Na long Antiok ol i bungim ol manmeri bilong sios na ol i givim dispela pas long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had read it, they rejoiced over the encouragement.

block.text: Ol manmeri i ritim pinis, na ol i amamas long kisim dispela gutpela tok bilong strongim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Judas and Silas, also being prophets themselves, encouraged the brothers with many words, and strengthened them.

block.text: Judas wantaim Sailas tupela i profet. Olsem na tupela i givim planti gutpela tok long ol Kristen, na long dispela pasin tupela i strongim bel bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After they had spent some time there, they were sent back with greetings from the brothers to the apostles.

block.text: After they had spent some time there, they sent them back to the apostles with their greetings.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Silas was pleased to stay there.
But Paul and Barnabas stayed in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.

block.text: Silas decided to stay there.
Na Pol wantaim Barnabas tupela i stap long Antiok. Tupela i wok wantaim planti arapela man long skulim ol manmeri long tok bilong God na long autim gutnius bilong Bikpela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After some days Paul said to Barnabas,

block.text: Sampela de i go pinis, orait Pol i tokim Barnabas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let’s return now and visit our brothers in every city in which we proclaimed the word of the Lord, to see how they are doing.”

block.text: "Mitupela i mas i go bek na lukim ol brata long olgeta taun, bipo mitupela i autim tok bilong Bikpela long ol. Olsem bai mitupela i ken save, ol i stap gut, o nogat."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Barnabas said:

block.text: Orait Barnabas i

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let’s take John who is also called Mark with us.”

block.text: laik kisim Jon, narapela nem bilong en Mak, i go wantaim tupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Paul said:

block.text: Tasol Pol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is not a good idea to take someone who deserted us in Pamphylia, and did not continue with us in the work.”

block.text: "Dispela man bipo em i bin lusim mitupela long provins Pamfilia, na em i no laik i go wantaim mitupela long mekim wok, olsem na mitupela i no ken kisim em i go wantaim mitupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the contention grew so sharp that they separated from each other. Barnabas took Mark with him, and sailed away to Cyprus.

block.text: Tupela i tok kros planti long dispela samting. Olsem na tupela i bruk na tupela i no moa wok wantaim. Barnabas i kisim Mak i go wantaim em, na tupela i kalap long wanpela sip na i go long ailan Saiprus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul chose Silas, and went out, being commended by the brothers to the grace of God.

block.text: Na Pol i kisim Sailas. Na taim tupela i laik i go, ol Kristen i tokim tupela olsem, "Marimari bilong Bikpela i ken i stap wantaim yutupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the assemblies.

block.text: Orait na tupela i wokabaut i go nabaut long provins Siria na Silisia, na Pol i wok long strongim ol manmeri bilong ol sios i stap long dispela hap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 16
He came to Derbe and Lystra: and behold, a certain disciple was there, named Timothy. He was the son of a Jewess who believed; but his father was a Greek.

block.text: Pol i go kamap long Derbe na long Listra tu. Long dispela taun wanpela Kristen i stap, nem bilong en Timoti. Em i pikinini bilong wanpela Juda meri, em i Kristen. Na papa bilong en i bilong ol Grik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The brothers who were at Lystra and Iconium gave a good testimony about him.

block.text: Ol Kristen long Listra na Aikoniam ol i tok long pasin bilong em olsem, Timoti i gutpela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul wanted to have him go out with him, and he took and circumcised him because of the Jews who were in those parts; for they all knew that his father was a Greek.

block.text: Pol i laikim Timoti i go wantaim em. Olsem na em i kisim em na i katim skin bilong en. Em i ting long ol Juda i stap long ol dispela hap, na em i mekim dispela pasin, long wanem, olgeta Juda i save olsem, papa bilong Timoti em i Grik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they went on their way through the cities, they delivered the decrees to them to keep which had been ordained by the apostles and elders who were at Jerusalem.

block.text: Ol i wokabaut i go long ol taun, na dispela tok bipo ol aposel na ol hetman ol i pasim long Jerusalem, em ol i givim long ol Kristen. Na ol i tok, "Yupela i mas bihainim dispela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the assemblies were strengthened in the faith, and increased in number daily.

block.text: Olsem na bilip bilong ol manmeri bilong ol sios i kamap strong moa, na namba bilong ol i go bikpela moa long olgeta de.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had gone through the region of Phrygia and Galatia, they were forbidden by the Holy Spirit to speak the word in Asia.

block.text: Pol na Sailas na Timoti i wokabaut i go namel long distrik Frigia na Galesia, long wanem, Holi Spirit i bin tambuim ol long autim tok long provins Esia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had come opposite Mysia, they tried to go into Bithynia, but the Spirit didn’t allow them.

block.text: Ol i go inap long distrik Misia, na ol i laik wokabaut i go insait long provins Bitinia, tasol Spirit bilong Jisas i pasim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Passing by Mysia, they came down to Troas.

block.text: Olsem na ol i abrusim Misia na ol i go daun long taun Troas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A vision appeared to Paul in the night. There was a man of Macedonia standing, begging him, and saying,

block.text: Na long nait Pol i lukim wanpela samting olsem driman. Em i lukim wanpela man bilong provins Masedonia i sanap na i singautim Pol na i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come over into Macedonia and help us.”

block.text: "Yu mas brukim solwara na yu kam long Masedonia na helpim mipela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had seen the vision, immediately we sought to go out to Macedonia, concluding that the Lord had called us to preach the Good News to them.

block.text: Pol i lukim pinis dispela samting, orait kwiktaim mipela i painim rot bilong i go long Masedonia. Mipela I save, God i singautim mipela bilong autim gutnius long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Setting sail therefore from Troas, we made a straight course to Samothrace, and the day following to Neapolis.

block.text: Olsem na mipela i kalap long sip long Troas, na sip i ran i go stret long Samotres. Na long narapela de em i ran i go long Neapolis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: From there we went to Philippi, which is a city of Macedonia, the foremost of the district, a Roman colony. We were staying some days in this city.

block.text: Na mipela i lusim dispela ples na i go kamap long Filipai. Em i wanpela taun bipo ol Rom i kam sindaun long en, na em i namba wan taun bilong distrik Masedonia. Mipela i stap sampela de long dispela taun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the Sabbath day we went forth outside of the city by a riverside, where we supposed there was a place of prayer. We sat down, and spoke to the women who had come together.

block.text: Na long de Sabat mipela i go ausait long dua bilong banis bilong taun, na mipela i go long wanpela wara. Mipela i ting klostu long dispela wara i gat ples bilong mekim prea. Na long dispela wara mipela i lukim sampela meri ol i bung i stap, na mipela i sindaun toktok wantaim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain woman named Lydia, a seller of purple, of the city of Thyatira, one who worshiped God, heard us. The Lord opened her heart to listen to the things which were spoken by Paul.

block.text: Wanpela meri, nem bilong en Lidia, em i harim dispela tok. Em i save lotu long God. Em i meri bilong taun Taiataira, na em i save wok bisnis long retpela laplap. Bikpela i tanim bel bilong em, na em i putim yau long dispela tok Pol i mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When she and her household were baptized, she begged us, saying,

block.text: Em i kisim baptais, na ol wanhaus bilong en wantaim. Em i kisim baptais pinis, na em i tokim mipela,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come into my house, and stay.”

block.text: "Sapos yupela i ting mi bilip tru long Bikpela, orait yupela I ken i kam i stap long haus bilong mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: So she persuaded us.

block.text: Na em i strong tumas long mipela, na mipela i bihainim tok bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, as we were going to prayer, that a certain girl having a spirit of divination met us. She brought her masters much gain by fortune telling.

block.text: Long wanpela de mipela i wokabaut i go long ples bilong mekim prea, na wanpela wokmeri nating i bungim mipela long rot. Dispela meri i gat wanpela spirit i stap long en, na em i save tokaut long ol samting bai i kamap bihain. Olsem na ol bosman bilong dispela meri i save kisim planti mani long wok dispela meri i save mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Following Paul and us, she cried out,

block.text: Orait dispela meri i bihainim Pol na mipela, na em i wok long singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “These men are servants of the Most High God, who proclaim to us a way of salvation!”

block.text: "Ol dispela man ol i wokman bilong God Antap Tru. Ol i save tokim yupela long rot bilong God i kisim bek yupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: She was doing this for many days. But Paul, becoming greatly annoyed, turned and said to the spirit,

block.text: Planti de dispela meri i mekim olsem. Na bihain Pol i les tru long harim singaut bilong en, olsem na em i tanim na i tokim dispela spirit,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I command you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her!”

block.text: "Long nem bilong Jisas Krais, mi tokim yu, yu lusim dispela meri na yu go."

ReferenceBlocks.text: It came out that very hour.

block.text: Na wantu dispela spirit i lusim meri na i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when her masters saw that the hope of their gain was gone, they seized Paul and Silas, and dragged them into the marketplace before the rulers.

block.text: Ol bosman bilong dispela meri ol i lukim olsem rot bilong ol bilong kisim mani i no moa i stap. Olsem na ol i holimpas Pol tupela Sailas, na ol i pulim tupela i go long ol hetman long ples bung.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had brought them to the magistrates, they said,

block.text: Ol i bringim tupela i go long ol jas, na ol i tokim ol jas olsem,

block.characterId: owners of fortune telling slave girl

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: owners of fortune telling slave girl
ReferenceBlocks.text: “These men, being Jews, are agitating our city.

block.text: "Dispela tupela man i bilong lain Juda. Tupela i wok long kirapim trabel long taun bilong yumi.

block.characterId: owners of fortune telling slave girl

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: owners of fortune telling slave girl
ReferenceBlocks.text: They set forth customs which it is not lawful for us to accept or to observe, being Romans.”

block.text: Na tupela i laik pulim ol manmeri long bihainim sampela pasin em i tambu long yumi ol man bilong kantri Rom i mekim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The multitude rose up together against them, and the magistrates tore their clothes off of them, and commanded them to be beaten with rods.

block.text: Ol manmeri i kam bung, ol tu i sutim tok long tupela. Orait ol jas i rausim klos bilong tupela na ol i tokim sampela man long paitim tupela long kanda.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had laid many stripes on them, they threw them into prison, charging the jailer to keep them safely.

block.text: Ol i paitim tupela nogut tru, na ol jas i putim tupela long kalabus. Na ol i givim strongpela tok long woda i bosim haus kalabus, long em i mas was gut tru long tupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Upon receiving such an order, he threw them into the inner prison, and secured their feet in the stocks.

block.text: Woda i harim dispela tok bilong ol jas, orait em i putim tupela long rum i stap insait tru long haus kalabus. Na em i pasim strong lek bilong tupela long plang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But about midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the prisoners were listening to them.

block.text: Long biknait Pol tupela Sailas i wok long beten na mekim song long God. Na ol arapela kalabus i harim i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken. Immediately all the doors were opened, and everyone’s bonds were loosened.

block.text: Na wantu wanpela bikpela guria i kamap, na i sakim olgeta pos bilong haus kalabus. Na olgeta dua bilong haus kalabus i op, na ol sen bilong olgeta kalabus i lus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The jailer, being roused out of sleep and seeing the prison doors open, drew his sword and was about to kill himself. He thought that the prisoners had escaped.

block.text: Na woda i kirap na i lukim olgeta dua bilong haus kalabus i op i stap, na em i ting olgeta kalabus i ranawe pinis. Olsem na em i pulim bainat bilong en na i laik kilim i dai em yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Paul cried out,

block.text: Tasol Pol i singaut strong,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t harm yourself, for we are all here!”

block.text: "Yu no ken bagarapim yu yet. Mipela olgeta i stap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called for lights and sprang in, and, fell down trembling before Paul and Silas.

block.text: Na woda i singaut long ol man long bringim lait, na em i ran i kam insait long rum Paul tupela Sailas i stap long en. Em i pret tru na em i guria, na em i pundaun klostu long lek bilong Pol na Sailas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He brought them out and said,

block.text: Na bihain woda i kisim tupela i go ausait, na i askim tupela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sirs, what must I do to be saved?”

block.text: "Tupela bikman, mi mas mekim wanem samting na bai God i kisim bek mi?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Na tupela i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Believe in the Lord Jesus Christ, and you will be saved, you and your household.”

block.text: "Yu mas bilip long Bikpela Jisas, na bai God i kisim bek yu wantaim ol lain bilong yu, na bai yupela i bilong em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They spoke the word of the Lord to him, and to all who were in his house.

block.text: Na tupela i autim tok bilong Bikpela long em na long ol lain bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took them the same hour of the night, and washed their stripes. He was immediately baptized, he and all his household.

block.text: Na long biknait yet, dispela woda i kisim tupela na i wasim sua bilong tupela. Na em wantaim olgeta lain bilong en i kisim baptais.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He brought them up into his house, and set food before them. He rejoiced greatly with all his household, having believed in God.

block.text: Na woda i kisim tupela i go long haus bilong en, na em i givim kaikai long tupela. Na em wantaim olgeta lain bilong en, ol i amamas tru, long wanem, nau ol i bilip long God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when it was day, the magistrates sent the sergeants, saying,

block.text: Long moning ol jas i salim ol plisman i kam, na ol i tokim woda olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let those men go.”

block.text: "Ol jas i tok, yu ken lusim dispela tupela man i go."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The jailer reported these words to Paul, saying,

block.text: Na woda i go tokim Pol. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The magistrates have sent to let you go; now therefore come out, and go in peace.”

block.text: "Ol jas i salim tok long lusim yutupela i go. Olsem na yutupela i ken lusim kalabus na i go, na yutupela i ken i stap bel isi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Paul said to them,

block.text: Tasol Pol i tokim ol plisman olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They have beaten us publicly, without a trial, men who are Romans, and have cast us into prison! Do they now release us secretly? No, most certainly, but let them come themselves and bring us out!”

block.text: “They have beaten us publicly, without a trial, men who are Romans, and have cast us into prison! Do they now release us secretly? No, most certainly, but let them come themselves and bring us out!”

ReferenceBlocks.text: The sergeants reported these words to the magistrates. They were afraid when they heard that they were Romans.

block.text: Orait ol plisman i bringim tok bilong Pol i go long ol jas. Na taim ol jas i harim olsem Pol na Sailas i man bilong Rom, ol i pret.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to appease them, escorted them from the prison, and requested them, saying:

block.text: Olsem na ol jas i go long haus kalabus na tok sori long tupela, na ol i bringim tupela i go ausait. Na ol i askim tupela long

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Please, leave our city.”

block.text: lusim dispela taun na i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went out of the prison, and entered into Lydia’s house. When they had seen the brothers, they encouraged them, and departed.

block.text: Bihain long tupela i lusim haus kalabus, tupela i go long haus bilong Lidia. Tupela i lukim ol Kristen na i givim sampela tok long ol bilong strongim bel bilong ol. Na bihain tupela i lusim taun na i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 17
Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where there was a Jewish synagogue.

block.text: Pol wantaim ol poroman bilong en i wokabaut i go long taun Amfipolis. Na ol i lusim dispela taun na i go long taun Apolonia. Na ol i lusim dispela taun tu na i go kamap long taun Tesalonaika. Wanpela haus lotu bilong ol Juda i stap long dispela taun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul, as was his custom, went to them, and for three Sabbath days reasoned with them from the Scriptures.

block.text: Na Pol i mekim wankain pasin olsem oltaim em i save mekim. Em i go insait long dispela haus lotu wantaim ol Juda, na long tripela de Sabat em i toktok wantaim ol long ol tok i stap long buk bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He explained and demonstrated that the Christ had to suffer and rise again from the dead, and said,

block.text: Em i autim as bilong tok bilong God na i tokim ol olsem, "Dispela man God i makim bilong kisim bek ol manmeri bilong en, em i mas karim pen na i dai, na bihain em i mas kirap bek." Na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This Jesus, whom I proclaim to you, is the Christ.”

block.text: "Dispela Jisas mi autim tok bilong en long yupela, em tasol dispela man God i makim bilong kisim bek ol manmeri bilong en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of them were persuaded, and joined Paul and Silas, of the devout Greeks a great multitude, and not a few of the chief women.

block.text: Orait na sampela manmeri namel long ol, ol i bilip, na ol i bihainim Pol tupela Sailas. I gat sampela Grik i save lotu long God, na bikpela lain bilong ol i bihainim tupela. Na planti bilong ol meri i gat biknem, ol tu i bihainim tupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the unpersuaded Jews took along some wicked men from the marketplace, and gathering a crowd, set the city in an uproar. Assaulting the house of Jason, they sought to bring them out to the people.

block.text: Tasol ol Juda i lukim ol dispela lain i bihainim tupela, na ol i bel nogut. Olsem na ol i kisim sampela bilong ol man nogut i save stap nabaut long ples bung. Na ol i bungim planti manmeri moa, na ol i kirapim bel bilong ol manmeri bilong dispela taun, na ol i go brukim dua bilong haus bilong Jeson. Na ol i wok long painim Pol tupela Sailas, bilong kisim tupela i go ausait na putim long han bilong ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they didn’t find them, they dragged Jason and certain brothers before the rulers of the city, crying,

block.text: Tasol ol i no lukim tupela, olsem na ol i pulim Jeson wantaim ol arapela Kristen i go long ol hetman bilong dispela taun. Na ol i singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “These who have turned the world upside down have come here also.

block.text: "Dispela ol man i save raun na mekim pasin nogut i kamap long olgeta hap bilong graun, na nau ol i kam i stap hia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: These people whom Jason has received all act contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying that there is another king, Jesus!”

block.text: Na Jeson i kisim ol i go i stap long haus bilong en. Olgeta dispela man ol i save sakim lo bilong Sisar. Ol i save tok, 'Narapela king i stap, nem bilong en Jisas.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: The multitude and the rulers of the city were troubled when they heard these things.

block.text: Ol manmeri wantaim ol hetman bilong taun ol i harim dispela tok, na ol i kirap nogut na i wok long singaut nabaut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had taken security from Jason and the rest, they let them go.

block.text: Orait ol hetman i mekim Jeson wantaim ol arapela man i baim kot pastaim, na ol i lusim ol i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The brothers immediately sent Paul and Silas away by night to Beroea. When they arrived, they went into the Jewish synagogue.

block.text: Tudak i kamap pinis, orait ol Kristen i salim Pol wantaim Sailas i go long taun Beria. Tupela i go kamap long Beria, na tupela i go insait long haus lotu bilong ol Juda.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now these were more noble than those in Thessalonica. This is because they received the word with all readiness of the mind, examining the Scriptures daily to see whether these things were so.

block.text: Ol Juda i stap long Beria ol i gutpela lain manmeri, na pasin bilong ol i winim tru pasin bilong ol Juda bilong Tesalonaika. Ol i harim tok bilong Pol, na ol i laikim tru. Na long olgeta de ol i save ritim na skelim tok i stap long buk bilong God, bilong ol i ken save, tok bilong Pol em i tru, o nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many of them therefore believed; also of the prominent Greek women, and not a few men.

block.text: Olsem na planti manmeri bilong ol Juda i bilip. Na planti Grik i gat nem, ol tu i bilip, ol man na meri wantaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was proclaimed by Paul at Beroea also, they came there likewise, agitating the multitudes.

block.text: Bihain ol Juda bilong Tesalonaika i harim tok long Pol i autim tok bilong God i stap long Beria. Olsem na ol i go long dispela taun, na ol i paulim tingting bilong ol manmeri na mekim ol i kirap nogut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the brothers immediately sent out Paul to go as far as to the sea, and Silas and Timothy still stayed there.

block.text: Orait na kwiktaim ol Kristen i salim Pol i go daun long nambis. Tasol Sailas tupela Timoti i stap long Beria.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But those who escorted Paul brought him as far as Athens. Receiving a commandment to Silas and Timothy that they should come to him very quickly, they departed.

block.text: Na ol man i bringim Pol long rot, ol i bringim em i go inap long Atens. Na bihain ol i laik i go bek, na Pol i salim tok long Sailas wantaim Timoti olsem, "Yutupela i mas i kam long mi kwiktaim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was stirred within him as he saw the city full of idols.

block.text: Pol i wetim Sailas tupela Timoti i stap long Atens, na em i lukim dispela taun i gat planti tumas piksa bilong ol giaman god. Na dispela i mekim bel bilong en i nogut tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So he reasoned in the synagogue with the Jews and the devout persons, and in the marketplace every day with those who met him.

block.text: Olsem na em i go long haus lotu bilong ol Juda na em i toktok wantaim ol Juda na ol man bilong ol arapela lain i save lotu long God. Na long olgeta de em i go long ples bung na i toktok wantaim ol manmeri i kam i stap long dispela hap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of the Epicurean and Stoic philosophers also were conversing with him. Some said,

block.text: Na sampela saveman bilong ol lain Epikurian na ol lain Stoik, ol i pait long toktok wantaim em. Sampela i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What does this babbler want to say?”

block.text: "Dispela man bilong toktok nabaut em i laik tok wanem?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others said,

block.text: Na sampela i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He seems to be advocating foreign deities,”

block.text: "Ating em i autim tok bilong ol god bilong narapela ples."

ReferenceBlocks.text: because he preached Jesus and the resurrection.

block.text: Pol i laik autim gutnius bilong Jisas na em i tokim ol long Jisas na long pasin bilong kirap bek long matmat, olsem na ol i mekim dispela tok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They took hold of him, and brought him to a meeting of the Areopagus, saying:

block.text: Orait ol i kisim Pol na bringim em i go long ol kaunsil i save bung long maunten Areopagus. Na ol i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “May we know what this new teaching is, which is spoken by you?

block.text: "Mipela i laik save long dispela nupela tok yu save givim long ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For you bring certain strange things to our ears. We want to know therefore what these things mean.”

block.text: Mipela i harim tok bilong yu, na mipela i pilim em i narakain tru. Olsem na mipela i laik save long as bilong dispela tok yu mekim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now all the Athenians and the strangers living there spent their time in nothing else, but either to tell or to hear some new thing.

block.text: Olgeta Atens wantaim ol man bilong ol arapela ples i kam i stap long taun Atens, ol i no save mekim narapela samting. Nogat. Oltaim ol i save laikim tumas long harim tok long ol nupela kain tingting, na ol i save toktok namel long ol yet long olkain nupela tok ol i bin harim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul stood in the middle of the Areopagus and said,

block.text: Orait Pol i sanap namel long ol kaunsil long maunten Areopagus na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You men of Athens, I perceive that you are very religious in all things.

block.text: "Yupela man bilong Atens, mi lukim yupela i strong moa long mekim olgeta kain pasin bilong lotu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as I passed along, and observed the objects of your worship, I found also an altar with this inscription: ‘TO AN UNKNOWN GOD.’ What therefore you worship in ignorance, this I announce to you.

block.text: Pastaim mi wokabaut i go, na mi lukim ol samting yupela i save lotu long en. Na mi lukim wanpela alta tu, ol i bin raitim tok long en olsem, 'Dispela alta em i bilong wanpela god mipela i no save long en.' Orait dispela God yupela i no save long en na yupela i lotu nating long en, nau mi laik autim tok bilong en long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The God who made the world and all things in it, he, being Lord of heaven and earth, doesn’t dwell in temples made with hands.

block.text: "God i bin wokim graun wantaim olgeta samting i stap long graun, dispela God em i Bikpela bilong heven na bilong graun. Olsem na em i no save sindaun insait long ol haus lotu ol man i wokim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Neither is he served by men’s hands, as though he needed anything, since he himself gives to all life and breath, and all things.

block.text: Em i no sot long wanpela samting na yumi man i mas mekim wanpela samting long han bilong yumi bilong helpim em. Nogat. Em yet i save givim laip na win na olgeta samting long olgeta manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He made from one blood every nation of men to dwell on all the surface of the earth, having determined appointed seasons, and the boundaries of their dwellings.

block.text: Long wanpela tumbuna tasol em i bin mekim olgeta lain manmeri i kamap. Na em i putim ol i stap long olgeta hap bilong graun. Em yet i bin makim taim bilong ol i ken i stap, na em i bin putim mak bilong graun bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God did this so that men would seek the Lord, if perhaps they might reach out for him and find him, though he is not far from each one of us.

block.text: God i laik bai ol manmeri i ken kam long em na save tru long em, olsem na em i putim ol i stap, bai ol i ken wok long painim em. Tasol em i no i stap longwe long yumi olgeta wan wan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘For in him we live, and move, and have our being.’ As some of your own poets have said, ‘For we are also his offspring.’

block.text: 'Yumi save kisim laip long em na em wanpela tasol i givim strong long yumi na yumi save wokabaut.' I olsem sampela saveman bilong yupela ol i bin tok, 'Yumi tu i stap pikinini bilong em.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being then the offspring of God, we ought not to think that the Godhead is like gold, or silver, or stone, engraved by art and design of man.

block.text: Orait yumi stap pikinini bilong God, olsem na yumi no ken ting God em i olsem gol na silva na ston. Na yumi no ken ting em i olsem ol samting yumi man i save wokim long han na tingting bilong yumi yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The times of ignorance therefore God overlooked. But now he commands that all people everywhere should repent.

block.text: "Bipo ol man i no gat save, na God i no toktok planti long ol samting ol i bin mekim long dispela taim. Tasol nau em i tok strong long olgeta man long olgeta ples i mas tanim bel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he has appointed a day in which he will judge the world in righteousness by the man whom he has ordained; of which he has given assurance to all men, in that he has raised him from the dead.”

block.text: Em i makim pinis wanpela de bilong em bai i kotim ol manmeri. Na long stretpela pasin bilong en, em bai i skelim pasin bilong olgeta manmeri bilong graun. Na em i bin makim wanpela man bilong bosim dispela kot. Dispela man i bin dai na God i kirapim em bek long matmat. Olsem na yumi ken bilip tru long God i bin givim dispela wok long em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked; but others said,

block.text: Ol i harim dispela tok bilong man i kirap bek long matmat, na sampela i tok bilas long Pol. Na sampela i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We want to hear you again concerning this.”

block.text: "Mipela i laik harim yu i toktok gen long dispela samting."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Thus Paul went out from among them.

block.text: Orait Pol i lusim ol na i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But certain men joined with him, and believed, among whom also was Dionysius the Areopagite, and a woman named Damaris, and others with them.

block.text: Tasol sampela man i bihainim em na ol i bilip. Wanpela em Dionisius, em wanpela memba bilong dispela kaunsil i save bung long maunten Areopagus. Na wanpela meri, nem bilong en Damaris, em i bilip, na ol arapela manmeri tu i bilip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 18
After these things Paul departed from Athens, and came to Corinth.

block.text: Bihain Pol i lusim Atens na i go long taun Korin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He found a certain Jew named Aquila, a man of Pontus by race. He had recently come from Italy, with his wife Priscilla, because Claudius had commanded all the Jews to depart from Rome. Paul went to see Aquila and Priscilla.

block.text: He found a certain Jew named Akwila. As ples bilong Akwila em provins Pontus. Bipo liklik, em wantaim meri bilong en, Prisila, tupela i bin lusim kantri Itali na i kam, long wanem, Sisar Klodius i bin tokim olgeta Juda long ol i mas lusim biktaun Rom na i go long narapela hap. Orait Pol i go lukim tupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Because he practiced the same trade, he lived with them and worked, for by trade they were tent makers.

block.text: Em i save mekim wankain wok olsem tupela, em wok bilong wokim ol haus sel. Olsem na Pol i stap wantaim tupela, na ol i wok i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He reasoned in the synagogue every Sabbath, and persuaded Jews and Greeks.

block.text: Long olgeta de Sabat Pol i save go long haus lotu bilong ol Juda na em i save toktok wantaim ol. Em i laik kirapim tingting bilong ol Juda na ol Grik bai ol i bilip long Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Silas and Timothy came down from Macedonia, Paul was compelled by the Spirit, testifying to the Jews that Jesus was the Christ.

block.text: Tasol taim Sailas tupela Timoti i lusim Masedonia na i kam daun, orait Pol i wok long autim tok bilong God long olgeta de. Em i autim tok strong long ol Juda olsem, "Jisas em i man God i makim bilong kisim bek ol manmeri bilong en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they opposed him and blasphemed, he shook out his clothing and said to them,

block.text: Tasol ol Juda i no laik harim tok bilong en, na ol i tok bilas long em. Olsem na em i mekim olsem em i rausim pipia i stap long klos bilong en, na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your blood be on your own heads! I am clean. From now on, I will go to the Gentiles!”

block.text: "Sapos yupela i lus, em i asua bilong yupela yet. Mi no gat rong long dispela. Nau bai mi go autim tok long ol man bilong ol arapela lain."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He departed there, and went into the house of a certain man named Justus, one who worshiped God, whose house was next door to the synagogue.

block.text: Orait na Pol i lusim dispela haus lotu, na em i go long haus bilong wanpela man, nem bilong en Titius Jastus. Dispela man i save lotu long God, na haus bilong en i stap klostu tru long haus lotu bilong ol Juda.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Crispus, the ruler of the synagogue, believed in the Lord with all his house. Many of the Corinthians, when they heard, believed and were baptized.

block.text: Hetman bilong haus lotu bilong ol Juda, em wanpela man nem bilong en Krispus. Em wantaim olgeta famili bilong en, ol i bilip long Bikpela. Na planti manmeri bilong Korin ol i harim tok bilong Pol, na ol tu i bilip na kisim baptais.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said to Paul in the night by a vision,

block.text: Long wanpela nait Bikpela i kamap long Pol long wanpela samting olsem driman, na i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t be afraid, but speak and don’t be silent;

block.text: "Yu no ken pret. Nogat. Yu mas tokaut. Yu no ken pasim maus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: for I am with you, and no one will attack you to harm you, for I have many people in this city.”

block.text: Mi stap wantaim yu, na i no inap wanpela man i kirap na i mekim nogut long yu, long wanem, planti manmeri bilong mi i stap long dispela taun."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He lived there a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.

block.text: Pol i stap long Korin inap long wan yia na 6 mun, na em i lainim ol long tok bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews with one accord rose up against Paul and brought him before the judgment seat,
saying,

block.text: Tasol taim Galio i kamap namba wan gavman bilong provins Akaia, ol Juda i kirap wantaim na i birua long Pol. Ol i bringim em i go long kot, na ol i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man persuades men to worship God contrary to the law.”

block.text: "Dispela man i save lainim ol manmeri long sakim tok bilong lo na mekim lotu long God long narakain pasin."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Paul was about to open his mouth, Gallio said to the Jews,

block.text: Pol i laik bekim tok bilong ol, tasol Galio i tokim ol Juda olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If indeed it were a matter of wrong or of wicked crime, you Jews, it would be reasonable that I should bear with you;

block.text: "Yupela ol Juda, sapos dispela man i kalapim lo o sapos em i mekim wanpela kain pasin nogut, orait mi inap harim tok bilong yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but if they are questions about words and names and your own law, look to it yourselves. For I don’t want to be a judge of these matters.”

block.text: Tasol yupela i wari long ol pasin bilong toktok na long ol nem na long lo bilong yupela yet, na yupela i kam long mi. Maski, yupela yet i mas stretim dispela tok. Mi no inap harim kot long kain samting olsem."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He drove them from the judgment seat.

block.text: Na em i rausim ol long kot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then all the Greeks laid hold on Sosthenes, the ruler of the synagogue, and beat him before the judgment seat. Gallio didn’t care about any of these things.

block.text: Na ol Korin i holimpas Sostenes, em hetman bilong haus lotu bilong ol Juda, na ol I paitim em klostu long ples bilong kot. Tasol Galio i no wari long dispela samting ol i mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul, having stayed after this many more days, took his leave of the brothers, and sailed from there for Syria, together with Priscilla and Aquila. He shaved his head in Cenchreae, for he had a vow.

block.text: Pol i stap long Korin planti de, na bihain em i gutbai long ol Kristen. Na em i go long taun Senkria na i kalap long wanpela sip i laik i go long distrik Siria. Prisila wantaim Akwila tupela i go wantaim em. Long taim Pol i stap long Senkria em i katim gras bilong en, long wanem, em i bin mekim wanpela promis long God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to Ephesus, and he left them there; but he himself entered into the synagogue, and reasoned with the Jews.

block.text: Ol i go kamap long taun Efesus, na Pol i lusim tupela long dispela hap. Em yet i go insait long haus lotu bilong ol Juda na i toktok wantaim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they asked him to stay with them a longer time, he declined;

block.text: Ol i tokim em olsem, "Yu mas i stap longtaim liklik wantaim mipela." Tasol em i tok, "Mi no inap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: but taking his leave of them, he said,

block.text: Na bihain em i tok gutbai long ol, na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I must by all means keep this coming feast in Jerusalem, but I will return again to you if God wills,”

block.text: "Sapos God i laik, orait mi bai kam bek gen long yupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: he set sail from Ephesus.

block.text: Na em i go long sip na i lusim Efesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had landed at Caesarea, he went up and greeted the assembly, and went down to Antioch.

block.text: Sip i go sua long taun Sisaria, na Pol i lusim sip na i go antap long Jerusalem na i givim gude long ol manmeri bilong sios. Na bihain em i lusim ol na i go daun long taun Antiok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having spent some time there, he departed. He went through the region of Galatia, and Phrygia, establishing all the disciples in each place.

block.text: Pol i stap longpela taim liklik long Antiok na bihain em i go. Em i wokabaut i go long ol ples i stap long graun bilong distrik Galesia na Frigia, na em i wok long strongim bilip bilong olgeta manmeri i bilip long Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now a certain Jew named Apollos, an Alexandrian by race, an eloquent man, came to Ephesus. He was well versed in the Scriptures.

block.text: Wanpela Juda, em i man bilong taun Aleksandria, em i kam i stap long Efesus. Nem bilong en Apolos. Em i man bilong mekim gutpela toktok, na em i save tumas long buk bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This man had been instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in spirit, he spoke and taught accurately the things concerning Jesus, although he knew only the baptism of John.

block.text: Ol i bin skulim em long Rot bilong Bikpela, na bel bilong en i strong moa long skulim ol manmeri, na em i save tokim ol stret long ol samting Jisas i bin mekim. Tasol em i save long baptais bilong Jon tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He began to speak boldly in the synagogue. But when Priscilla and Aquila heard him, they took him aside, and explained to him the way of God more accurately.

block.text: Em i go long haus lotu bilong ol Juda na i autim tok. Em i no pret long ol manmeri. Na Prisila wantaim Akwila i harim tok bilong en, na tupela i kisim em i go na tokim em long Rot bilong God, bai em i ken klia gut long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had determined to pass over into Achaia, the brothers encouraged him, and wrote to the disciples to receive him. When he had come, he greatly helped those who had believed through grace;

block.text: Bihain Apolos i laik i go long provins Akaia, na ol Kristen bilong Efesus i strongim tingting bilong em long i go. Ol i raitim pas long ol Kristen bilong Akaia na tokim ol long ol i mas kisim em. Na taim Apolos i kamap long Akaia, orait em i helpim ol Kristen moa yet, em ol dispela manmeri God i bin marimari long ol na givim bilip long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: for he powerfully refuted the Jews, publicly showing by the Scriptures that Jesus was the Christ.

block.text: Em i strong moa long autim tok long ai bilong ol manmeri, bilong bekim na daunim tru ol tok kranki ol Juda i bin mekim. Em i autim tok bilong buk bilong God bilong soim ol klia tumas olsem, Jisas em i man God i makim bilong kisim bek ol manmeri bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 19
It happened that, while Apollos was at Corinth, Paul, having passed through the upper country, came to Ephesus, and found certain disciples.
He said to them,

block.text: Long taim Apolos i stap long Korin, Pol i raun yet long ol ples i stap long ples maunten na bihain em i kam kamap long taun Efesus. Long Efesus em i bungim sampela disaipel
na em i askim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you believed?”

block.text: "Taim yupela i bilip, yupela i kisim Holi Spirit, o nogat?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Na ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “No, we haven’t even heard that there is a Holy Spirit.”

block.text: "Nogat. Mipela i no harim tok long wanpela Holi Spirit i stap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na Pol i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Into what then were you baptized?”

block.text: "Olsem na yupela i kisim wanem kain baptais?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Na ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Into John’s baptism.”

block.text: "Mipela i kisim baptais bilong Jon."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul said,

block.text: Na Pol i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “John indeed baptized with the baptism of repentance. He told the people that they should believe in the one who would come after him, that is, in Jesus.”

block.text: "Bipo Jon i baptaisim ol manmeri, na em i tok, 'Yupela i mas tanim bel na kisim baptais. Na yupela i mas bilip long dispela man i kam bihain long mi.' Dispela man Jon i bin tok long em, em Jisas."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

block.text: Ol i harim dispela tok, na ol i kisim baptais long nem bilong Bikpela Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Paul had laid his hands on them, the Holy Spirit came on them, and they spoke with other languages and prophesied.

block.text: Na Pol i putim han antap long ol, na Holi Spirit i kam long ol, na ol i mekim tok long ol kain kain tok ples, na ol i autim tok olsem profet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were about twelve men in all.

block.text: Dispela lain i klostu inap 12 -pela man olgeta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He entered into the synagogue, and spoke boldly for a period of three months. He reasoned persuasively with them concerning the Kingdom of God.

block.text: Orait Pol i go insait long haus lotu bilong ol Juda na em i tokaut strong long gutnius. Em i toktok wantaim ol na em i kirapim tingting bilong ol long ol samting bilong kingdom bilong God. Em i mekim olsem inap tripela mun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But some were hardened and disobedient, speaking evil of the Way before the multitude. Therefore he departed from them, and separated the disciples, reasoning daily in the school of Tyrannus.

block.text: Tasol sampela i pasim bel strong tumas na ol i no bilip. Na long ai bilong ol manmeri ol i tok nogut long Rot bilong Bikpela. Olsem na Pol wantaim ol lain i bilip long Jisas, ol i no i go moa long haus lotu bilong ol Juda. Long olgeta de Pol i save go autim tok insait long haus skul bilong Tiranus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This continued for two years, so that all those who lived in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Greeks.

block.text: Em i mekim olsem i go inap tupela yia. Olsem na olgeta manmeri i stap long provins Esia ol i harim tok bilong Bikpela, em ol Juda na ol Grik wantaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God worked special miracles by the hands of Paul.

block.text: Long han bilong Pol, God i wokim ol narakain narakain strongpela mirakel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even handkerchiefs or aprons were carried away from his body to the sick, and the evil spirits went out.

block.text: Ol manmeri i save putim ol hankisip na hap laplap samting long skin bilong Pol, na bihain ol i kisim ol dispela samting i go givim long ol sikman. Ol sikman i kisim, na sik bilong ol i pinis, na ol spirit nogut i lusim ol na i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But some of the itinerant Jews, exorcists, took on themselves to invoke over those who had the evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus, saying,

block.text: Sampela Juda i save go nabaut na i wok bisnis long rausim ol spirit nogut. Sampela i traim long kolim nem bilong Bikpela Jisas na long dispela pasin ol i laik rausim ol spirit nogut long ol manmeri. Ol i save tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preaches.”

block.text: "Long nem bilong dispela Jisas, Pol i save autim tok bilong en, mi tok strong tumas long yupela i mas i go."

ReferenceBlocks.text: There were seven sons of one Sceva, a Jewish chief priest, who did this.

block.text: Ol 7 -pela pikinini man bilong wanpela bikpris bilong ol Juda, nem bilong en Skeva, ol i save mekim dispela kain tok long ol spirit nogut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The evil spirit answered,
