block.text: Na wanpela de ol i mekim dispela tok na spirit nogut i bekim tok bilong ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jesus I know, and Paul I know, but who are you?”

block.text: "Mi save long Jisas na mi save long Pol. Tasol yupela i husat tru?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: The man who had the evil spirit leaped on them, and overpowered them. He prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.

block.text: Na dispela man spirit nogut i stap long en, em i kalap long ol, na i paitim ol na i winim ol tru. Em i bagarapim skin bilong ol nogut tru, na i brukim klos bilong ol. Olsem na ol i lusim dispela haus na i ranawe skin nating.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This became known to all, both Jews and Greeks, who lived at Ephesus. Fear fell on them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified.

block.text: Olgeta Juda wantaim olgeta Grik i stap long Efesus ol i harim tok long dispela samting i bin kamap, na bikpela pret i kamap long ol. Na ol i litimapim nem bilong Bikpela Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many also of those who had believed came, confessing, and declaring their deeds.

block.text: Planti manmeri i bilip pinis, ol i kam na long ai bilong ol arapela manmeri, ol i autim olgeta pasin nogut bipo ol i bin mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many of those who practiced magical arts brought their books together and burned them in the sight of all. They counted their price, and found it to be fifty thousand pieces of silver.

block.text: Na planti manmeri i bin wokim posin na marila samting, ol i bungim ol buk bilong ol i gat tok long pasin bilong wokim ol dispela samting, na ol i kukim long paia long ai bilong olgeta manmeri. Ol i kaunim pe bilong olgeta dispela buk, na em inap 50,000 mani silva.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the word of the Lord was growing and becoming mighty.

block.text: Long dispela pasin tok bilong Bikpela i wok strong long ol manmeri, na i kamap strong long laip bilong ol. Na ol i raun na autim tok long planti hap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now after these things had ended, Paul determined in the spirit, when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia, to go to Jerusalem, saying,

block.text: Wok i kamap strong pinis long Efesus, orait Holi Spirit i stiaim tingting bilong Pol, na Pol i pasim tok long em i laik wokabaut i go long provins Masedonia na Akaia na bihain em i laik i go long Jerusalem. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “After I have been there, I must also see Rome.”

block.text: "Mi go lukim ol dispela hap pinis, orait bihain mi mas i go lukim Rom tu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having sent into Macedonia two of those who served him, Timothy and Erastus, he himself stayed in Asia for a while.

block.text: Na em i salim tupela man i save helpim em, em Timoti wantaim Erastus, na tupela i go paslain long em long Masedonia. Tasol Pol yet i stap longpela taim liklik long provins Esia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: About that time there arose no small stir concerning the Way.

block.text: Long dispela taim sampela man i birua long Rot bilong Bikpela na ol i kirapim bikpela tok pait.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For a certain man named Demetrius, a silversmith, who made silver shrines of Artemis, brought no little business to the craftsmen.

block.text: Wanpela man i stap, nem bilong en Demitrius, em i man bilong wokim ol samting long silva. Em i gat bisnis bilong wokim ol liklik piksa bilong haus lotu bilong god meri Artemis long silva. Em i givim planti wok long ol man i save wokim ol samting long silva na ol i kisim bikpela mani.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He gathered together with the workmen of like occupation, and said,

block.text: Orait Demitrius i bungim ol dispela man, wantaim ol man i save wokim ol arapela kain samting, na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sirs, you know that by this business we have our wealth.

block.text: "Ol wanwok, yupela i save, gutpela pe bilong yumi em i save kamap long wok bisnis yumi save mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You see and hear, that not at Ephesus alone, but almost throughout all Asia, this Paul has persuaded and turned away many people, saying that they are no gods, that are made with hands.

block.text: Na dispela man Pol em i save pulim bikpela lain manmeri na i paulim tingting bilong ol, olsem yupela i lukim na harim pinis. Na em i no mekim dispela pasin long taun Efesus tasol. Nogat. Klostu em inapim olgeta hap bilong provins Esia. Em i save tok, 'Ol god yumi wokim long han, ol i no god tru.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Not only is there danger that this our trade come into disrepute, but also that the temple of the great goddess Artemis will be counted as nothing. The goddess herself, who is worshipped throughout the province of Asia and the world will be robbed of her divine majesty.”

block.text: Dispela tok bilong Pol em inap bagarapim nem bilong wok bisnis bilong yumi. Na narapela samting moa i olsem. Tok bilong en em inap mekim haus lotu bilong bikpela god meri Artemis i kamap olsem samting nating long tingting bilong ol manmeri. Pastaim olgeta manmeri bilong provins Esia na bilong olgeta hap bilong graun i save lotu long dispela god meri. Tasol tok bilong Pol i laik bagarapim biknem bilong em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard this they were filled with anger, and cried out, saying,

block.text: Ol man i harim dispela tok, na ol i belhat tru. Na ol i singaut strong olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”

block.text: "Artemis bilong yumi Efesus em i nambawan tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The whole city was filled with confusion. They rushed with one accord into the theater, having seized Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul’s companions in travel.

block.text: Olsem na bikpela singaut moa i kamap long dispela taun, na olgeta manmeri i bikmaus nabaut. Ol i kirap wantaim na i ran i go long ples kibung. Ol i pulim Gaius wantaim Aristarkus i go wantaim ol, em tupela man bilong Masedonia i save wokabaut i go raun wantaim Pol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Paul wanted to enter in to the people, the disciples didn’t allow him.

block.text: Pol yet i laik i go namel long ol manmeri, tasol ol Kristen i pasim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Certain also of the Asiarchs, being his friends, sent to him and begged him not to venture into the theater.

block.text: Na tu, sampela gavman bilong Esia ol i pren bilong Pol, na ol i salim tok long em. Ol i tok strong long em i no ken i go insait long ples kibung.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some therefore cried one thing, and some another, for the assembly was in confusion. Most of them didn’t know why they had come together.

block.text: Dispela bikpela lain manmeri, tingting bilong ol i paul nabaut. Ol i wok long singaut nabaut na mekim ol narapela narapela tok. Na planti manmeri i no save long wanem as tru ol i kam bung.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought Alexander out of the crowd, the Jews putting him forward. Alexander beckoned with his hand, and would have made a defense to the people.

block.text: Ol Juda i subim Aleksander i go sanap long ai bilong ol manmeri, na sampela man i lukim na ol i ting em i as bilong trabel. Na Aleksander i laik bekim tok bilong ol manmeri na em i mekim nais long han bai ol i pasim maus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when they perceived that he was a Jew, all with one voice for a time of about two hours cried out,

block.text: Tasol ol i luksave long em, na ol i save, em i man bilong lain Juda. Olsem na olgeta manmeri i bikmaus wantaim na i singaut strong moa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”

block.text: "Artemis bilong yumi Efesus em i nambawan tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the town clerk had quieted the crowd, he said,

block.text: When the town clerk had quieted the crowd, he said,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You men of Ephesus, what man is there who doesn’t know that the city of the Ephesians is worshipper of the great goddess Artemis, and of the image which fell down from Zeus?

block.text: "Yupela man bilong Efesus, harim. Wanem man i no save olsem Efesus em i taun bilong lukautim haus lotu bilong bikpela god meri Artemis, na bilong lukautim dispela ston tambu i bin pundaun long heven?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Seeing then that these things can’t be denied, you ought to be quiet, and to do nothing rash.

block.text: I no gat man inap long sakim dispela tok. Olsem na yupela i mas sarap. Yupela i no ken hariap tumas na mekim wanpela samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For you have brought these men here, who are neither robbers of temples nor blasphemers of your goddess.

block.text: Yupela i bin bringim dispela tupela man i kam. Tasol tupela i no bin stilim samting bilong haus lotu bilong yumi. Na tupela i no bin tok bilas long god meri bilong yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If therefore Demetrius and the craftsmen who are with him have a matter against anyone, the courts are open, and there are proconsuls. Let them press charges against one another.

block.text: Sapos Demitrius wantaim ol wokman bilong en i gat tok long wanpela man, orait i gat taim bilong harim kot. Na ol namba wan gavman i stap. Ol i mas stretim tok bilong ol long kot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if you seek anything about other matters, it will be settled in the regular assembly.

block.text: Na sapos yupela i gat sampela tok moa, orait yupela i mas stretim long kibung long taim bilong kibung stret.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For indeed we are in danger of being accused concerning this day’s riot, there being no cause. Concerning it, we wouldn’t be able to give an account of this commotion.”

block.text: Olsem na harim. Sapos ol ofisa bilong gavman i harim tok long ol samting yumi bin mekim nau, orait ol inap tru long kotim yumi na tok long yumi laik kirapim bikpela trabel. I no gat as tru bilong dispela pasin yumi bin mekim. Na sapos ol i askim yumi bilong wanem yumi bin kam bung na singaut na bikmaus nabaut, yumi bai i no inap bekim wanpela tok."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.

block.text: Kuskus i tok pinis, na em i salim ol manmeri i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 20
After the uproar had ceased, Paul sent for the disciples and encouraged them. Then he took leave of them and left to go into Macedonia.

block.text: Taim bikmaus na singaut nabaut bilong ol manmeri i pinis, orait Pol i singautim ol Kristen i kam bungim em long wanpela hap. Em i givim sampela tok long ol bilong strongim bel bilong ol, na em i tok gutbai long ol, na em i go long provins Masedonia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had gone through those parts, and had encouraged them with many words, he came into Greece.

block.text: Em i wokabaut long ol dispela hap na i givim planti tok long ol Kristen, bilong strongim bel bilong ol. Na bihain em i kamap long kantri Grik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had spent three months there, and a plot was made against him by Jews as he was about to set sail for Syria, he determined to return through Macedonia.

block.text: Em i stap tripela mun long Grik na bihain em i laik kisim sip na i go long distrik Siria. Tasol em i harim tok olsem ol Juda i bin pasim tok long kilim em i dai, olsem na em i senisim tingting na em i wokabaut i go bek long Masedonia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: These accompanied him as far as Asia: Sopater of Beroea; Aristarchus and Secundus of the Thessalonians; Gaius of Derbe; Timothy; and Tychicus and Trophimus of Asia.

block.text: Wanpela man bilong taun Beria, em Sopater, pikinini bilong Pirus, em i go wantaim Pol. Na tupela man bilong taun Tesalonaika, em Aristarkus wantaim Sekundus, na Gaius bilong taun Derbe, na Timoti, na tupela man bilong provins Esia, em Tikikus na Trofimus, ol tu i go wantaim Pol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But these had gone ahead, and were waiting for us at Troas.

block.text: Ol dispela man i go pas na i wetim mipela long taun Troas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We sailed away from Philippi after the days of Unleavened Bread, and came to them at Troas in five days, where we stayed seven days.

block.text: Mipela i stap long Filipai inap Ol Bikpela De Bilong Bret I No Gat Yis i pinis, orait mipela i kalap long sip na lusim Filipai. Long namba 5 de mipela i go kamap long ol dispela man i wetim mipela long Troas, na mipela i stap 7 -pela de long Troas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the first day of the week, the disciples were gathered together to break bread. Paul talked with them, intending to depart on the next day, and continued his speech until midnight.

block.text: Long namba wan de bilong wik mipela i bung wantaim ol Kristen bilong kaikai wantaim. Na Pol i autim tok long ol manmeri, long wanem, tumora em i laik i go. Olsem na em i pulim tok i go i go inap long biknait.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There were many lights in the upper room where we were gathered together.

block.text: Dispela rum mipela i bung long en, em i gat planti lam i lait i stap. Dispela rum i stap antap

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain young man named Eutychus sat in the window, weighed down with deep sleep. As Paul spoke still longer, being weighed down by his sleep, he fell down from the third story, and was taken up dead.

block.text: long namba 3 plua, na wanpela yangpela man, nem bilong en Yutikus, em i sindaun i stap long wanpela windo. Pol i toktok moa yet, na ai bilong Yutikus i hevi na em i laik slip. Na bihain em i slip tru, na em i pundaun i go daun long graun. Na ol i go daun na kisim em, tasol em i dai pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul went down, and fell upon him, and embracing him said,

block.text: Pol tu i go daun, na em i slip antap long dispela yangpela man na i holim em. Na em i tokim ol manmeri olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t be troubled, for his life is in him.”

block.text: "Yupela i no ken kirap nogut. Laip i stap yet long em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had gone up, and had broken bread, and eaten, and had talked with them a long while, even until break of day, he departed.

block.text: Na Pol i go antap gen, na em i brukim bret, na em i kaikai wantaim ol manmeri. Na bihain em i toktok longpela taim wantaim ol, i go inap long tulait. Tulait i kamap pinis na Pol i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought the boy in alive, and were greatly comforted.

block.text: Na dispela yangpela man i stap laip na ol i kisim em i go. Olsem na bel bilong ol i gutpela tumas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But we who went ahead to the ship set sail for Assos, intending to take Paul aboard there. He had arranged this because he was going there on foot.

block.text: Orait mipela i lusim Pol na mipela i kalap long sip na mipela i go kamap long taun Asos. Na mipela i wetim Pol long Asos. Pol yet i bin tokim mipela long i go pas, long wanem, em i laik wokabaut long rot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he met us at Assos, we took him aboard, and came to Mitylene.

block.text: Olsem na Pol i kam bungim mipela long Asos, na mipela i kisim em i go long sip, na mipela i go long taun Mitilini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Sailing from there, we came the following day opposite Chios. The next day we touched at Samos and stayed at Trogyllium, and the day after we came to Miletus.

block.text: Na mipela i lusim Mitilini, na long de bihain mipela i kamap klostu long ailan Kios. Na long de bihain gen mipela i go sua long taun Samos. Na long de bihain gen mipela i go kamap long taun Miletus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Paul had determined to sail past Ephesus, that he might not have to spend time in Asia; for he was hastening, if it were possible for him, to be in Jerusalem on the day of Pentecost.

block.text: Pol i pasim tingting pinis long em i laik abrusim Efesus, long wanem, em i no laik lusim planti taim long provins Esia. Em i laik hariap. Sapos inap, em i laik lukim Bikpela De Bilong Pentikos long Jerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: From Miletus he sent to Ephesus, and called to himself the elders of the assembly.

block.text: Mipela i kamap long taun Miletus na Pol i salim tok i go long ol hetman bilong sios long Efesus. Em i singautim ol i kam lukim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had come to him, he said to them,

block.text: Ol i kamap pinis, orait em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You yourselves know, from the first day that I set foot in Asia, how I was with you all the time.

block.text: "Yupela yet i save long ol pasin mi bin mekim long namba wan taim mi kamap long Esia, na long olgeta taim mi stap wantaim yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I served the Lord with all humility, with many tears, and with trials which happened to me by the plots of the Jews;

block.text: Yupela i save, planti taim ol Juda i pasim tok long daunim mi, na dispela i givim mi planti bel hevi na traim na mi krai planti taim. Tasol mi daunim nem bilong mi olgeta, na mi mekim wok bilong Bikpela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I didn’t shrink from declaring to you anything that was profitable. I taught you publically, from house to house.

block.text: Na mi no surik long autim olkain gutpela tok inap long helpim yupela. Na long ol bung bilong ol manmeri na long olgeta haus bilong yupela tu, mi bin skulim yupela. Em yupela i save.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I testified both to Jews and to Greeks of repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.

block.text: Oltaim mi bin autim tok strong long ol Juda na long ol Grik, long yumi mas tanim bel i go long God, na yumi mas bilip long Bikpela bilong yumi Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now, behold, I go bound by the Spirit to Jerusalem, not knowing what will happen to me there;

block.text: Orait harim. Nau Holi Spirit tasol i mekim na mi mas i go long Jerusalem. Wanem samting bai i kamap long mi long Jerusalem, em mi no save.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I only know that the Holy Spirit testifies in every city, saying that bonds and afflictions wait for me.

block.text: Dispela tasol mi save. Long olgeta ples mi go long en, Holi Spirit i save autim tok long mi olsem, kalabus na planti hevi i wetim mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But these things don’t count; nor do I hold my life dear to myself, so that I may finish my race with joy, and the ministry which I received from the Lord Jesus, to fully testify to the Good News of the grace of God.”

block.text: "Tasol mi no ting laip bilong mi em i namba wan samting. Mi no strong tumas long holimpas laip bilong mi. Nogat. Mi laik bihainim dispela rot mi wokabaut long en na pinisim dispela wok mi bin kisim long Bikpela Jisas. Dispela wok em bilong autim tok long gutnius bilong marimari bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now, behold, I know that you all, among whom I went about preaching the Kingdom of God, will see my face no more.

block.text: "Orait ol brata, harim. Bipo mi stap namel long yupela, na mi autim tok bilong kingdom bilong God. Tasol nau mi save, bihain yupela olgeta bai i no inap lukim pes bilong mi moa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I testify to you this day that I am clean from the blood of all men.

block.text: Olsem na mi laik tokaut klia long yupela nau. Sapos wanpela namel long yupela em i lus, dispela em i no asua bilong mi,

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I didn’t shrink from declaring to you the whole counsel of God.

block.text: long wanem, mi no bin surik long autim olgeta tingting bilong God long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Take heed, therefore, to yourselves, and to all the flock, in which the Holy Spirit has made you overseers, to shepherd the assembly of the Lord and God which he purchased with his own blood.

block.text: Yupela i mas was gut long yupela yet, na long olgeta manmeri bilong sios bilong God, em ol dispela manmeri em i bin baim long blut bilong Pikinini bilong em yet. Na Holi Spirit i makim yupela i stap wasman bilong ol dispela sipsip bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I know that after my departure, vicious wolves will enter in among you, not sparing the flock.

block.text: Mi save, taim mi lusim yupela na mi go pinis, ol weldok nogut tru bai i kam namel long yupela, na ol bai i bagarapim ol sipsip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Men will arise from among your own selves, speaking perverse things, to draw away the disciples after them.

block.text: Na sampela man bilong yupela yet bai i kirap na mekim tok giaman nabaut, bilong pulim ol manmeri bilong God i go bihainim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore watch, remembering that for a period of three years I didn’t cease to admonish everyone night and day with tears.

block.text: Olsem na yupela i mas was gut oltaim. Yupela i no ken lusim tingting long pasin mi bin mekim. Long tripela yia, long nait na long san, mi no slek long givim gutpela tingting long yupela olgeta wan wan. Na taim mi skulim yupela, wara bilong ai bilong mi i kapsait wantaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now, brothers, I entrust you to God, and to the word of his grace. It is able to build you up, and to give you the inheritance among all those who are sanctified.

block.text: "Nau mi putim yupela i stap long han bilong God, na mi laik bai yupela i tingim tok bilong marimari bilong em. Dispela marimari em inap strongim yupela, na em inap givim yupela olgeta gutpela samting God i save givim long olgeta manmeri em i bin makim bilong em yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I coveted no one’s silver, or gold, or clothing.

block.text: "Mi no bin mangal long silva na gol na laplap samting bilong wanpela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You yourselves know that these hands served my necessities, and those who were with me.

block.text: Yupela yet i save, long han bilong mi yet mi bin mekim wok bilong lukautim mi yet, na bilong helpim ol man i stap wantaim mi tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In all things I gave you an example, that so laboring you ought to help the weak. We must remember the words that the Lord Jesus said, ‘It is more blessed to give than to receive.’”

block.text: Long olgeta wok mi mekim, mi bin soim yupela olsem, yumi mas bihainim dispela pasin bilong wok strong. Olsem bai yumi inap long helpim ol man i no inap helpim ol yet. Na yumi mas tingim dispela tok Bikpela Jisas yet i mekim. Em i bin tok olsem, 'Amamas bilong man i givim samting long ol arapela man, dispela i winim amamas bilong man i kisim samting bilong em yet.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had spoken these things, he knelt down and prayed with them all.

block.text: Pol i mekim dispela tok pinis, orait em i brukim skru na i beten wantaim olgeta dispela hetman.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all wept a lot, and fell on Paul’s neck and kissed him.

block.text: Bihain olgeta i krai planti, na ol i holimpas Pol na i givim kis long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were sad most of all because of the word which he had spoken, that they should see his face no more. And they accompanied him to the ship.

block.text: Ol i sori nogut tru, long wanem, Pol i bin tok long ol bai i no inap lukim pes bilong en moa. Na ol i bringim em i go long sip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 21
When it happened that we had parted from them and had set sail, we came with a straight course to Cos. The next day to we sailed to Rhodes, and from there to Patara.

block.text: Mipela i lusim ol hetman, na mipela i go long sip na sip i luslain. Mipela i sut stret i go long ailan Kos. Na long de bihain mipela i kamap long ailan Rodes. Na mipela i lusim Rodes na i go kamap long taun Patara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia, we went aboard, and set sail.

block.text: Na long Patara mipela i lukim wanpela sip i laik i go long distrik Fonisia, na mipela i kalap long dispela sip na sip i luslain.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we had come in sight of Cyprus, leaving it on the left hand, we sailed to Syria. We landed at Tyre, for there the ship was to unload her cargo.

block.text: Orait bihain mipela i lukim ailan Saiprus na abrusim long han kais. Na mipela i go kamap long provins Siria na i go sua long taun Tair, long wanem, sip i laik lusim kago long dispela taun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having found disciples, we stayed there seven days. These said to Paul through the Spirit, that he should not go up to Jerusalem.

block.text: Na mipela i go lukim ol Kristen, na mipela i stap long dispela taun inap 7 -pela de. Holi Spirit i givim tok long ol Kristen, na ol i tokim Pol long em i no ken i go long Jerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it happened that we had accomplished the days, we departed and went on our journey. They all, with wives and children, brought us on our way until we were out of the city. Kneeling down on the beach, we prayed.

block.text: Long taim sip i laik lusim Tair, mipela i lusim taun na wokabaut i go. Na ol Kristen wantaim ol meri pikinini bilong ol, ol i bringim mipela i go ausait long taun. Na long nambis mipela i brukim skru na mekim prea.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After saying goodbye to each other, we went on board the ship, and they returned home again.

block.text: Na ol i tok gutbai long mipela, na mipela i tok gutbai long ol. Orait na mipela i kalap long sip, na ol i go bek long haus bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we had finished the voyage from Tyre, we arrived at Ptolemais. We greeted the brothers, and stayed with them one day.

block.text: Orait mipela i lusim Tair, na mipela i go kamap long taun Tolemes. Mipela i tok gude long ol Kristen, na mipela i stap wanpela de wantaim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the next day, we, who were Paul’s companions, departed, and came to Caesarea. We entered into the house of Philip the evangelist, who was one of the seven, and stayed with him.

block.text: Long de bihain mipela i lusim Tolemes na mipela i go kamap long taun Sisaria. Na mipela i go long haus bilong Filip, em wanpela man i save autim gutnius long ol manmeri, na mipela i stap wantaim em. Em i wanpela bilong ol 7 -pela man i save helpim ol aposel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now this man had four virgin daughters who prophesied.

block.text: Em i gat 4 -pela pikinini meri ol i no marit. Ol i save autim tok bilong God olsem profet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As we stayed there some days, a certain prophet named Agabus came down from Judea.

block.text: Mipela i stap long Sisaria sampela de moa, na wanpela profet, nem bilong en Agabus, em i lusim distrik Judia na i kam daun long Sisaria.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Coming to us, and taking Paul’s belt, he bound his own feet and hands, and said,

block.text: Em i kam long mipela na i kisim let bilong Pol na i pasim lek na han bilong em yet. Na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Thus says the Holy Spirit: ‘So will the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man who owns this belt, and will deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles.’”

block.text: "Holi Spirit i tok olsem, 'Long dispela pasin ol Juda long Jerusalem bai I pasim papa bilong dispela let, na bai ol i givim em long han bilong ol man bilong narapela lain.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we heard these things, both we and they of that place begged him not to go up to Jerusalem.
Then Paul answered,

block.text: Mipela i harim dispela, na mipela wantaim ol manmeri bilong dispela taun mipela i tok strong long Pol, long em i no ken i go long Jerusalem.
Tasol Pol i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What are you doing, weeping and breaking my heart? For I am ready not only to be bound, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.”

block.text: "Bilong wanem yupela i krai krai na bagarapim tingting bilong mi? Mi redi tasol long ol i ken kalabusim mi. Na mi redi tu long i dai long Jerusalem bilong litimapim nem bilong Bikpela Jisas."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying,

block.text: Mipela i lukim olsem Pol i strong long i go, olsem na mipela i no traim moa long senisim tingting bilong en. Mipela i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Lord’s will be done.”

block.text: "Samting Bikpela I laik bai i kamap, em i ken kamap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: After these days we took up our baggage and went up to Jerusalem.

block.text: Sampela de i go pinis, orait mipela i redim ol samting na mipela i go long Jerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of the disciples from Caesarea also went with us. They brought Mnason of Cyprus, an early disciple, with whom we would stay.

block.text: Na sampela bilong ol disaipel i stap long Sisaria ol i go wantaim mipela. Ol i bringim mipela i go long haus bilong Nason, em i man bilong Saiprus, na bipo yet em i bin kamap disaipel. Na mipela i stap long haus bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we had come to Jerusalem, the brothers received us gladly.

block.text: Mipela i kamap long Jerusalem, na ol Kristen i amamas long kisim mipela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The day following, Paul went in with us to James; and all the elders were present.

block.text: Long de bihain Pol i go wantaim mipela long lukim Jems. Na olgeta hetman bilong sios tu i kam bung long dispela taim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had greeted them, he reported one by one the things which God had worked among the Gentiles through his ministry.

block.text: Pol i givim gude long ol, na em i stori gut long ol long olgeta samting God i bin mekim long han bilong en namel long ol manmeri bilong ol arapela lain.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They, when they heard it, glorified God. They said to him,

block.text: Ol hetman i harim pinis tok bilong Pol, na ol i litimapim nem bilong God. Na ol i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You see, brother, how many thousands there are among the Jews of those who have believed, and they are all zealous for the law.

block.text: "Brata, yu save, planti tausen Juda i bilip pinis long Jisas. Na dispela olgeta manmeri ol i strong moa long bihainim lo bilong Moses.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They have been informed about you, that you teach all the Jews who are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses. They tell them not to circumcise their children neither to walk after the customs.

block.text: Tasol sampela man i bin tokim ol long yu, olsem, 'Pol i save tokim ol Juda i stap namel long ol arapela lain long ol i mas lusim lo bilong Moses. Em i save tok, "Yupela i no ken katim skin bilong ol pikinini bilong yupela. Na yupela i no ken bihainim moa ol pasin bilong bipo.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: What then? The assembly must certainly meet, for they will hear that you have come.

block.text: Yumi save, ol bai i harim tok long yu kam pinis. Olsem na bai yumi mekim wanem?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore do what we tell you. We have four men who have taken a vow.

block.text: Orait mipela i laik tokim yu long wanpela pasin mipela i laik bai yu mas bihainim. Mipela i gat 4 -pela man, ol i bin mekim wanpela promis long God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Take them, and purify yourself with them, and pay their expenses for them, that they may shave their heads. Then all will know that there is no truth in the things that they have been informed about you, but that you yourself also walk keeping the law.

block.text: Yu mas kisim dispela ol man, na yupela olgeta i mas bihainim pasin bilong kamap klin long ai bilong God. Na tu, yu mas baim ol ofa ol i mas mekim, bilong ol i ken sevim gras bilong het bilong ol. Yu mekim olsem, na olgeta man i ken save, dispela tok ol i bin mekim long yu, em i giaman tok tasol. Ol i ken save, yu tu yu save bihainim lo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But concerning the Gentiles who believe, we have sent a letter with our decision: They should abstain from what has been sacrificed to idols, and from blood, and from what has been strangled, and from sexual immorality.”

block.text: Long ol manmeri bilong ol arapela lain i bilip long Jisas, yumi salim pas pinis na tokim ol long dispela tok yumi pasim bipo. Yumi tokim ol long ol i mas lukaut gut, na ol i no ken kaikai abus ol man i bin kilim bilong mekim ofa long ol giaman god, na ol i no ken kaikai abus i gat blut i stap yet long en na ol abus ol man i bin pasim nek bilong en na kilim em i dai, na ol i no ken mekim pasin pamuk."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Paul took the men, and the next day, purified himself. He went with them into the temple, declaring the fulfillment of the days of purification, until the offering was offered for every one of them.

block.text: Olsem na Pol i kisim ol dispela man i bin mekim promis long God, na long de bihain em i bihainim olgeta pasin bilong mekim em yet i kamap klin wantaim ol. Na em i go insait long banis bilong tempel bilong tokim ol pris long wanem de ol bai i kamap klin pinis na ol i laik bringim ol ofa bilong ol wan wan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the seven days were almost completed, the Jews from Asia, when they saw him in the temple, stirred up all the multitude and laid hands on him,
crying out,

block.text: Taim 7 -pela de klostu i laik pinis, ol Juda i bin kam long provins Esia i lukim Pol i stap insait long banis bilong tempel, na ol i kirapim bel bilong olgeta manmeri na mekim ol i kros long Pol. Orait ol i holimpas Pol,
na ol i singaut strong olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Men of Israel, help us! This is the man who teaches all men everywhere against the people, and the law, and this place.

block.text: "Yupela man bilong Israel, helpim mipela. Dispela man hia em i save tokim olgeta man long olgeta ples long daunim lain bilong yumi wantaim lo bilong Moses na dispela tempel tu. Na em i no mekim dispela pasin tasol. Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Moreover, he also brought Greeks into the temple, and has defiled this holy place!”

block.text: Em i bringim ol Grik i kam insait long banis bilong tempel na ol i mekim dispela ples God i bin makim bilong em yet i kamap doti long ai bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: For they had seen Trophimus, the Ephesian, with him in the city, and they supposed that Paul had brought him into the temple.

block.text: Ol i mekim dispela tok,
long wanem, bipo ol i lukim Trofimus bilong taun Efesus i stap insait long taun wantaim Pol, na ol i ting Pol i bin bringim em i kam insait long banis bilong tempel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the city was moved, and the people ran together. They seized Paul and dragged him out of the temple. Immediately the doors were shut.

block.text: Ol manmeri i harim dispela tok, na olgeta Jerusalem i kirap nogut, na ol manmeri i ran i kam bung. Ol i holimpas Pol na pulim em i go ausait long banis bilong tempel. Na kwiktaim ol i pasim olgeta dua bilong banis bilong tempel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they were trying to kill him, news came up to the commanding officer of the regiment that all Jerusalem was in an uproar.

block.text: Ol man i wok long kilim Pol, na namba wan ofisa bilong ol lain soldia bilong Rom i harim tok olsem, "Olgeta Jerusalem i kros na ol i wok long pait nabaut."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he took soldiers and centurions, and ran down to them. When they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, they stopped beating Paul.

block.text: Olsem na kwiktaim em i kisim ol ofisa na soldia na ol i lusim haus bilong ol soldia na ran i go daun long dispela hap ol manmeri i stap long en. Ol Juda i lukim namba wan ofisa i kam wantaim ol soldia, na ol i lusim Pol na ol i no paitim em moa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the commanding officer came near, arrested him, commanded him to be bound with two chains. He inquired who he was and what he had done.

block.text: Orait namba wan ofisa i kam klostu na i holimpas Pol, na i tokim ol soldia long pasim em long tupela sen. Na em i askim ol Juda olsem, "Dispela man, em husat? Em i mekim wanem?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some shouted one thing, and some another, among the crowd. When he couldn’t find out the truth because of the noise, he commanded him to be brought into the barracks.

block.text: Bikpela lain manmeri i stap, na ol i singaut nabaut na i mekim ol narapela narapela tok. Ol i mekim bikpela nois tumas, na ofisa i no inap harim as bilong tok. Olsem na em i tokim ol soldia long bringim Pol i go insait long haus bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he came to the stairs, it happened that he was carried by the soldiers because of the violence of the crowd;

block.text: Tasol taim Pol i go kamap long lata bilong dispela haus, ol soldia i lukim ol manmeri i strong tumas long kilim em, olsem na ol soldia i karim em i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: for the multitude of the people followed after, crying out,

block.text: Bikpela lain manmeri i bihainim ol na ol i wok long singaut strong olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Away with him!”

block.text: "Kilim em i dai."

ReferenceBlocks.text: As Paul was about to be brought into the barracks, he asked the commanding officer,

block.text: Ol soldia i laik bringim Pol i go insait long haus bilong ol, na Pol i tokim namba wan ofisa long tok Grik olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “May I speak to you?”

block.text: "Ating mi ken mekim wanpela tok long yu?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na ofisa i tok,

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you know Greek?

block.text: "Yu save tok Grik, a?

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: Aren’t you then the Egyptian, who before these days stirred up to sedition and led out into the wilderness the four thousand men of the Assassins?”

block.text: Mi ting yu dispela Isip, bipo liklik em I bin kirapim pait long gavman, na em i kisim 4,000 man i save pait long bainat na em i bringim ol i go long graun i no gat man."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Paul said,

block.text: Na Pol i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am a Jew, from Tarsus in Cilicia, a citizen of no insignificant city. I beg you, allow me to speak to the people.”

block.text: "Mi man bilong lain Juda. Mi bilong taun Tarsus long distrik Silisia. Taun bilong mi em i gat biknem. Plis, mi laik givim tok long ol manmeri."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had given him permission, Paul, standing on the stairs, beckoned with his hand to the people. When there was a great silence, he spoke to them in the Hebrew language, saying,

block.text: Ofisa i orait long dispela askim, na Pol i sanap long dispela lata na i mekim nais long han bai ol manmeri I pasim maus. Olsem na olgeta ol i pasim maus, na Pol i toktok long ol long tok Hibru. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 22
“Brothers and fathers, listen to the defense which I now make to you.”

block.text: "Ol brata na ol papa, yupela harim. Nau mi laik tokaut klia long yupela long mi no bin mekim wanpela rong."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard that he spoke to them in the Hebrew language, they were even more quiet. He said,

block.text: Ol i harim Pol I toktok long tok Hibru, na ol i pasim maus na ol i stap isi tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am indeed a Jew, born in Tarsus of Cilicia, but brought up in this city. At the feet of Gamaliel, I was instructed according to the strict tradition of the law of our fathers, being zealous for God, even as you all are this day.

block.text: "Mi wanpela Juda. Mama bilong mi i bin karim mi long taun Tarsus long distrik Silisia, tasol mi kamap bikpela long dispela taun hia. Mi sumatin bilong Gamaliel, na em i bin skulim mi gut tru long olgeta lo bilong ol tumbuna bilong yumi. Na mi bin wok hat tru long strongim ol pasin God i laikim, wankain olsem yupela i mekim nau.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I persecuted this Way to the death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women.

block.text: Mi bin wok long bagarapim ol lain i bilip na i bihainim dispela Rot, em ol man na meri wantaim, na mi laik kilim ol i dai. Mi bin pasim ol long sen na mi bringim ol i go long haus kalabus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The high priest and all the council of the elders testify. I even obtained letters from them to their brothers in Damascus, and I went there to bring these people as prisoners to Jerusalem to be punished.

block.text: Hetpris wantaim olgeta kaunsil bilong ol hetman ol i save long dispela pasin mi bin mekim, na ol inap tokim yupela long en. Ol i bin givim mi ol pas ol i bin raitim long ol lain bilong yumi i stap long Damaskus. Na mi bin wokabaut i go long Damaskus, bilong kalabusim ol manmeri bilong dispela ples i bilip na i bihainim dispela Rot. Mi laik bringim ol i kam long Jerusalem, bai ol bikman i ken mekim save long ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened that, as I made my journey, and came close to Damascus, about noon, suddenly there shone from the sky a great light around me.

block.text: Pol i tok moa olsem, "Mi wokabaut i go na long samting olsem 12 klok belo mi kamap klostu long Damaskus. Na wantu tasol wanpela bikpela lait i kam long heven na i lait tumas long mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I fell to the ground, and heard a voice saying to me, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?’

block.text: Na mi pundaun long graun na mi harim maus bilong wanpela man i askim mi olsem, 'Sol, Sol, bilong wanem yu wok long bagarapim mi?'

ReferenceBlocks.text: I answered, ‘Who are you, Lord?’ He said to me, ‘I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom you persecute.’”

block.text: Na mi tok, 'Bikpela, yu husat?' Na em i tok, 'Mi Jisas bilong Nasaret, yu wok long bagarapim mi.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Those who were with me indeed saw the light and were afraid, but they didn’t understand the voice of him who spoke to me.

block.text: Ol man i stap wantaim mi ol i lukim lait, tasol ol i no harim maus bilong dispela man i givim tok long mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I said, ‘What shall I do, Lord?’ The Lord said to me, ‘Arise, and go into Damascus. There you will be told about all things which are appointed for you to do.’

block.text: "Na mi tok, 'Bikpela, bai mi mekim wanem nau?' Na Bikpela i tokim mi olsem, 'Yu kirap na yu go insait long taun Damaskus. Na long dispela hap wanpela man bai i tokim yu long olgeta wok mi bin makim bilong yu.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: When I couldn’t see for the glory of that light, being led by the hand of those who were with me, I came into Damascus.

block.text: Dispela lait em i lait moa yet, na mi no inap lukim wanpela samting. Olsem na ol man i stap wantaim mi ol i holim han bilong mi na ol i bringim mi i go long Damaskus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: One Ananias, a devout man according to the law, well reported of by all the Jews who lived in Damascus.

block.text: "I gat wanpela man i stap long Damaskus, nem bilong en Ananaias. Em i man bilong aninit long God na bihainim lo gut tru. Olgeta Juda i stap long Damaskus ol i save tok, em i gutpela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to me, and standing by me said to me, ‘Brother Saul, receive your sight!’ In that very hour I looked up at him.

block.text: Em i kam sanap klostu long mi na i tokim mi olsem, 'Brata Sol, ai bilong yu i ken lukluk gen.' Na long dispela taim stret ai bilong mi i orait gen, na mi lukim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said, ‘The God of our fathers has appointed you to know his will, and to see the Righteous One, and to hear a voice from his mouth.

block.text: Na em i tok, 'God bilong ol tumbuna bilong yumi em i bin makim yu bai yu ken save long laik bilong em, na yu ken lukim dispela Man bilong mekim stretpela pasin na yu ken harim tok em i mekim long maus bilong em yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For you will be a witness for him to all men of what you have seen and heard.

block.text: Yu bai autim tok bilong en na tokim olgeta manmeri long ol samting yu bai lukim na harim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now why do you wait? Arise, be baptized, and wash away your sins, calling on the name of the Lord.’”

block.text: Orait bilong wanem yu wet moa? Yu kirap na kisim baptais. Yu kolim nem bilong en, na em bai i wasim yu na rausim ol sin bilong yu.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It happened that, when I had returned to Jerusalem, and while I prayed in the temple, I fell into a trance,

block.text: Pol i tokim ol manmeri moa olsem, "Bihain mi kam bek long Jerusalem, na mi kam beten i stap insait long tempel, na long samting olsem driman

ReferenceBlocks.text: I saw him saying to me, ‘Hurry and get out of Jerusalem quickly, because they will not receive testimony concerning me from you.’

block.text: mi lukim Bikpela. Em i tokim mi olsem, 'Yu mas kirap kwiktaim na lusim Jerusalem na yu go. Sapos yu autim tok bilong mi long dispela taun, ol bai i no inap harim.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: I said, ‘Lord, they themselves know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue those who believed in you.

block.text: Na mi tok, 'Bikpela, ol yet i save, bipo mi bin i go long olgeta haus lotu na mi kalabusim ol manmeri i bilip long yu, na mi wipim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the blood of Stephen, your witness, was shed, I also was there too. I consented to his death and guarded the cloaks of those who killed him.’”

block.text: Na taim ol i kilim i dai Stiven, dispela man bilong autim tok bilong yu, mi bin sanap klostu, na long ai bilong mi dispela pasin ol i mekim em i gutpela. Na mi bin was long ol longpela klos bilong ol man i kilim em i dai.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said to me, ‘Depart, for I will send you out far from here to the Gentiles.’”

block.text: Tasol Bikpela i tokim mi olsem, 'Yu go. Bai mi salim yu na yu go long ol manmeri bilong ol arapela lain i stap ol longwe ples.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They listened to him until he said that; then they lifted up their voice, and said,

block.text: Taim ol Juda i harim Pol i tok long ol manmeri bilong ol arapela lain, ol i no laik harim tok bilong en moa. Olsem na ol I singaut bikmaus olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rid the earth of this fellow, for he isn’t fit to live!”

block.text: "Kilim em i dai. Kain man olsem i no ken i stap long graun. Em i no ken i stap laip."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They cried out, and threw off their cloaks, and threw dust into the air.

block.text: Ol i wok long singaut nabaut, na ol i rausim ol saket bilong ol na tromoi nabaut na ol i tromoi das i go antap, bilong soim olsem ol i no laikim tru dispela tok Pol i bin mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The commanding officer commanded him to be brought into the barracks. He ordered him to be examined by scourging, that he might know for what crime they shouted against him.

block.text: Olsem na namba wan ofisa i tok, na ol soldia i bringim Pol i go insait long haus bilong ol. Na namba wan ofisa i tokim ol soldia long wipim em na askim em long as bilong dispela trabel. Em i laik save gut, bilong wanem ol manmeri i belhat na i singaut strong long Pol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had tied him up with thongs, Paul asked the centurion who stood by,

block.text: Orait ol i pasim hanlek bilong Pol. Pol i lukim kepten bilong ol i sanap klostu na Pol i askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is it lawful for you to scourge a man who is a Roman, and not found guilty?”

block.text: "Ating lo I tok long yupela i ken mekim dispela pasin long man bilong kantri Rom, o nogat? Yupela i wipim mi long taim yupela i no kotim mi yet, ating dispela pasin i orait, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the centurion heard it, he went to the commanding officer and told him,

block.text: Kepten i harim dispela tok, na em i go tokim namba wan ofisa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Watch what you are about to do, for this man is a Roman!”

block.text: "Bai yu mekim wanem nau? Dispela man em i man bilong Rom."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The commanding officer came and asked him,

block.text: Orait namba wan ofisa i kam long Pol na i tokim em,

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell me, are you a Roman?”

block.text: "Yu tokim mi. Yu man bilong Rom, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na Pol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes.”

block.text: "Yes."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The commanding officer answered,

block.text: Na namba wan ofisa i tok olsem,

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “I bought my citizenship for a great price.”

block.text: "Mi bin autim bikpela mani bilong mi long kamap man bilong Rom."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul said,

block.text: Na Pol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But I was born a Roman.”

block.text: "Mi nogat. Mama I karim mi na mi stap man bilong kantri Rom."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately those who were about to examine him departed from him. The commanding officer also was afraid when he realized that he was a Roman, because he had bound him.

block.text: Ol soldia i laik wipim em ol i harim dispela tok, na kwiktaim ol i surik. Na taim namba wan ofisa i save olsem, Pol em i man bilong Rom, orait em tu i pret, long wanem, em i bin tokim ol soldia long pasim em long sen.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But on the next day, He desired to know the truth about why he was accused by the Jews. So he freed him from the bonds, and commanded the chief priests and all the council to come together. Then he brought Paul down and set him before them.

block.text: Namba wan ofisa i laik save gut, ol Juda i ting Pol i bin mekim wanem rong tru. Olsem na long de bihain em i lusim sen ol i bin pasim Pol long en, na em i salim tok i go long ol bikpris na long olgeta kaunsil bilong ol Juda, long ol i mas kam bung. Na em i bringim Pol i kam daun na i sanapim em long pes bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 23
Paul, looking steadfastly at the council, said,

block.text: Orait Pol i lukluk i go stret long ol kaunsil, na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers, I have lived before God in all good conscience until this day.”

block.text: "Ol brata, mi bin wokabaut long ai bilong God, na bel bilong mi em i orait long ol pasin mi bin mekim, i kam inap long nau. Mi no pilim olsem mi bin mekim wanpela rong."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The high priest, Ananias, commanded those who stood by him to
strike him on the mouth.
Then Paul said to him,

block.text: Em i tok olsem, na hetpris Ananaias i tokim ol man i sanap klostu long em
long paitim maus bilong en.
Na Pol i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “God will strike you, you whitewashed wall! Do you sit to judge me according to the law, and command me to be struck contrary to the law?”

block.text: "God bai i paitim yu yet, long wanem, yu olsem banis nogut ol i bin penim long waitpela pen, bai ol man i no ken lukim samting nogut i stap aninit. Yu ting long bihainim lo na kotim mi, olsem na yu kam sindaun i stap. Tasol yu yet yu sakim lo, na yu tokim ol long paitim mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who stood by said,

block.text: Ol man i sanap klostu, ol I harim dispela tok na ol i askim Pol olsem,

block.characterId: those standing near Paul in Sanhedrin

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: those standing near Paul in Sanhedrin
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you malign God’s high priest?”

block.text: "Olsem wanem? Yu laik tok nogut long hetpris bilong God, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul said,

block.text: Na Pol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I didn’t know, brothers, that he was high priest. For it is written, ‘You shall not speak evil of a ruler of your people.’”

block.text: "Ol brata, mi no save dispela man em i hetpris. Mi mekim rong, long wanem, buk bilong God i gat tok olsem, 'Yupela i no ken tok nogut long wanpela hetman bilong yupela.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees and the other Pharisees, he cried out in the council,

block.text: Pol i save olsem, sampela man bilong kaunsil ol i bilong lain Sadyusi na sampela i bilong lain Farisi. Olsem na em i singaut long ol kaunsil olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Men and brothers, I am a Pharisee, a son of Pharisees. Concerning the hope and resurrection of the dead I am being judged!”

block.text: "Ol brata, mi man bilong lain Farisi, na mi pikinini bilong ol Farisi. Mi bilip olsem, ol man i dai pinis ol bai i kirap bek, na long dispela as tasol nau ol i kotim mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, an argument arose between the Pharisees and Sadducees, and the assembly was divided.

block.text: Pol i mekim dispela tok, na tok pait i kamap namel long ol Farisi na ol Sadyusi, na kibung i bruk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, nor angel, nor spirit; but the Pharisees confess all of these.

block.text: Ol Sadyusi i save tok olsem, ol man i no inap kirap bek long matmat, na i no gat ol ensel na ol spirit i stap. Tasol ol Farisi i bilip long ol dispela samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A great clamor arose, and some of the scribes of the Pharisees part stood up, and contended, saying,

block.text: Olsem na ol i wok long singaut bikmaus moa yet. Na sampela saveman bilong lo, ol i bilong lain bilong ol Farisi, ol i sanap na i tok strong olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We find no evil in this man. But if a spirit or angel has spoken to him, let’s not fight against God!”

block.text: "Mipela I lukim dispela man i no gat rong. Nogut em i tok tru, na wanpela spirit o wanpela ensel i bin givim tok long em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When a great argument arose, the commanding officer feared that Paul would be torn in pieces by them. He commanded the soldiers to go down and take him by force from among them, and bring him into the barracks.

block.text: Na namba wan ofisa i lukim tok pait i kamap bikpela moa, na em i pret, nogut tupela lain i pulim Pol nabaut na brukim bodi bilong en na em bai i dai. Olsem na em i tokim ol soldia long ol i mas i go daun na rausim Pol long han bilong ol Juda, na bringim em i go insait long haus bilong ol soldia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The following night, the Lord stood by him, and said,

block.text: Na long nait Bikpela i sanap klostu long Pol na i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Cheer up, Paul, for as you have testified about me at Jerusalem, so you must testify also at Rome.”

block.text: "Yu mas sanap strong, na yu no ken pret. Yu bin autim strong tok bilong mi long Jerusalem, na long wankain pasin yu mas autim tok bilong mi long Rom."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it was day, some of the Jews banded together, and bound themselves under a curse, saying that they would neither eat nor drink until they had killed Paul.

block.text: Orait long moning ol Juda i bung na pasim tok long kilim Pol i dai. Ol i mekim strongpela tok promis olsem, "Tru antap, yumi mas kilim Pol i dai. Na taim yumi no kilim em i dai yet, yumi no ken kaikai na dring."

ReferenceBlocks.text: There were more than forty people who had made this conspiracy.

block.text: Namba bilong ol man i mekim dispela tok promis, em i winim 40 .

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to the chief priests and the elders, and said,

block.text: Ol dispela man i go long ol bikpris na ol hetman na i tok olsem,

block.characterId: Jews, more than forty in conspiracy

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Jews, more than forty in conspiracy
ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have bound ourselves under a great curse, to taste nothing until we have killed Paul.

block.text: "Mipela i mekim strongpela tok promis olsem, mipela i no ken kisim kaikai liklik, i go inap long taim mipela i kilim Pol i dai.

block.characterId: Jews, more than forty in conspiracy

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Jews, more than forty in conspiracy
ReferenceBlocks.text: Now therefore, you with the council inform the commanding officer that he should bring him down to you tomorrow, as though you were going to judge his case more exactly.

block.text: Olsem na yupela wantaim ol kaunsil, yupela i mas salim tok i go long namba wan ofisa, long em i mas bringim Pol i kam daun long yupela. Yupela i ken trikim em na tok olsem yupela i laik painimaut gut long as bilong sampela tok bilong Pol.

block.characterId: Jews, more than forty in conspiracy

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Jews, more than forty in conspiracy
ReferenceBlocks.text: We are ready to kill him before he comes near.”

block.text: Na mipela bai i redi na wet i stap. Na taim em i no kamap yet long yupela, mipela bai i kilim em i dai."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Paul’s nephew heard of their lying in wait. He came and entered into the barracks and told Paul.

block.text: Tasol pikinini man bilong susa bilong Pol em i harim tok long dispela samting ol i laik mekim. Olsem na em i go long haus bilong ol soldia na i go insait na i tokim Pol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul summoned one of the centurions, and said,

block.text: Na Pol i singautim wanpela kepten i kam na i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Bring this young man to the commanding officer, for he has something to tell him.”

block.text: "Bringim dispela yangpela man i go long namba wan ofisa. Em i gat wanpela tok em i laik givim long em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: So he took him, and brought him to the commanding officer, and said,

block.text: Olsem na kepten i bringim em i go long namba wan ofisa, na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Paul, the prisoner, summoned me and asked me to bring this young man to you, who has something to tell you.”

block.text: "Kalabusman Pol i singautim mi na i tokim mi long bringim dispela yangpela man i kam long yu. Em i gat wanpela tok em i laik givim long yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The commanding officer took him by the hand, and going aside, asked him privately,

block.text: Olsem na namba wan ofisa i holim han bilong en, na i kisim em i go long arere. Tupela tasol i stap, na em i askim yangpela man olsem,

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is it that you have to tell me?”

block.text: "Yu laik givim wanem tok long mi?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na yangpela man i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Jews have agreed to ask you to bring Paul down to the council tomorrow, as though intending to inquire somewhat more accurately concerning him.

block.text: "Ol Juda i pasim tok pinis long ol bai i askim yu long bringim Pol i go daun long kaunsil long tumora. Ol bai i trikim yu na tok olsem ol i laik painimaut gut long as bilong tok bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore don’t yield to them, for more than forty men lie in wait for him, who have bound themselves under a curse neither to eat nor to drink until they have killed him. Now they are ready, looking for the promise from you.”

block.text: Tasol yu no ken bihainim tok bilong ol. Sampela man bilong ol, namba bilong ol em i winim 40, ol i bin mekim strongpela promis olsem ol i no ken kaikai na dring wanpela samting inap ol i kilim Pol i dai. Na nau ol i wet i stap long yu i orait long tok bilong ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the commanding officer let the young man go, charging him,

block.text: Orait namba wan ofisa i salim yangpela man i go, na I tokim em strong olsem,

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell no one that you have revealed these things to me.”

block.text: "Yu no ken tokim wanpela man long yu bin kamapim dispela tok long mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called to himself two of the centurions, and said,

block.text: Orait namba wan ofisa i singautim tupela kepten, na i tokim tupela olsem,

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Prepare two hundred soldiers to go as far as Caesarea, with seventy horsemen, and two hundred men armed with spears, at the third hour of the night.

block.text: "Yutupela i mas kisim 200 soldia, wantaim 70 soldia i save sindaun long ol hos na 200 soldia i holim spia. Na yupela i mas redi long i go long Sisaria long 9 klok long nait.

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: Provide mounts for Paul to ride, and bring him safely to Felix the governor.”

block.text: Yupela i mas redim ol hos bilong Pol tu, na yupela i mas bringim em i go kamap gut long namba wan gavman Feliks."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He wrote a letter like this:

block.text: Na namba wan ofisa i raitim wanpela pas olsem,

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Claudius Lysias to the most excellent governor Felix: Greetings.”

block.text: "Mi Klodius Lisias mi raitim dispela pas i go long bikman, em namba wan gavman Feliks. Gude tru.

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man was seized by the Jews, and was about to be killed by them. Then I came with the soldiers and rescued him, having learned that he was a Roman.

block.text: Ol Juda i bin holimpas dispela man na ol i laik kilim em i dai. Tasol mi harim olsem em i man bilong Rom, olsem na mi wantaim ol soldia mipela i go kisim em bek long han bilong ol.

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: Desiring to know the cause why they accused him, I brought him down to their council.

block.text: Mi laik save long as bilong tok ol i sutim long dispela man, na mi bringim em i go daun long kaunsil bilong ol.

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: I found him to be accused about questions of their law, but not to be charged with anything worthy of death or of imprisonment.

block.text: Mi askim ol na ol i tokim mi long sampela tok bilong lo bilong ol na ol i sutim dispela tok long em. Tasol ol i no kotim em long wanpela samting inap long yumi kilim em i dai o yumi kalabusim em.

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: When I was told that the Jews lay in wait for the man, I sent him to you immediately. I also ordered his accusers to bring their accusations against him before you. Farewell.”

block.text: Na nau mi harim pinis olsem ol i bin pasim wanpela tok hait long kilim dispela man i dai. Olsem na kwiktaim mi salim em i go long yu. Na mi tokim ol man i sutim tok long em long ol i mas i go autim tok long pes bilong yu stret, na yu ken save long samting ol i laik kotim em long en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the soldiers, carrying out their orders, took Paul and brought him by night to Antipatris.

block.text: Orait ol soldia i bihainim tok bilong namba wan ofisa na long dispela nait ol i kisim Pol na bringim em i go long taun Antipatris.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But on the next day they left the horsemen to go with him, and returned to the barracks.

block.text: Na long de bihain ol soldia i save sindaun long ol hos, ol i bringim Pol i go long taun Sisaria. Na ol arapela soldia i go bek long haus bilong ol soldia long Jerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they came to Caesarea and delivered the letter to the governor, they also presented Paul to him.

block.text: Ol soldia i save sindaun long ol hos ol i go kamap long Sisaria, na ol i givim pas long namba wan gavman, na ol i bringim Pol tu i kam sanap long pes bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After the governor had read the letter, he asked Paul:

block.text: Namba wan gavman i ritim pas, na em i askim Pol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What province are you from?”

block.text: "Yu bilong wanem provins?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul replied:

block.text: Na Pol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am from Cilicia.”

block.text: "Mi bilong Silisia."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The governor said:

block.text: Orait namba wan gavman i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will hear you fully when your accusers also arrive.”

block.text: "Taim ol man i sutim tok long yu, ol i kamap, orait mi bai harim tok bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Felix commanded, saying:

block.text: Na em i tok, ol i

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Keep him in Herod’s palace.”

block.text: mas kalabusim Pol long haus gavman bilong Herot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 24
After five days, the high priest, Ananias, came down with certain elders and an orator, one Tertullus. They informed the governor against Paul.

block.text: Taim 5 -pela de i go pinis, hetpris Ananaias i kam daun long taun Sisaria wantaim ol hetman na wanpela saveman bilong lo bilong ol Rom, nem bilong en Tertulus. Na ol i tokim namba wan gavman long dispela tok ol i laik kotim Pol long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he was called, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying,

block.text: Orait namba wan gavman i singautim Pol, na taim em i kam pinis, Tertulus i stat long sutim tok long em. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have enjoyed a long period of peace under you, and your foresight has brought about reforms in this nation.

block.text: "Bikman Feliks, yu bin helpim mipela long sindaun gutpela tumas, na i no gat pait samting i kamap. Long gutpela tingting bilong yu, yu bin helpim ol lain bilong mipela long stretim ol planti samting bipo ol i no bin i stap gut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everywhere and in every way, most excellent Felix, we acknowledge this with profound gratitude.

block.text: Mipela i lukim ol dispela samting, na bel bilong mipela i gutpela moa, na mipela i tenkyu tru long yu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But, that I don’t delay you, I entreat you to bear with us and hear a few words.

block.text: "Tasol nogut mi pasim yu longtaim tumas. Mi laik askim yu long marimari long mipela na harim sotpela tok bilong mipela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We have found this man to be a plague, an instigator of insurrections among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes.

block.text: Mipela i lukim dispela man em i man bilong kamapim planti trabel. Em i save kirapim kros na pait namel long olgeta Juda long olgeta hap bilong graun. Na em i lida bilong dispela ol man i bin lusim lain bilong mipela na i kamapim narakain lain, em ol i kolim lain bilong Nasaret.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He even tried to profane the temple, and we arrested him.

block.text: He even tried to profane the temple, and we arrested him.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the chief captain Lysias came upon us, and violently took him away out of our hands.

block.text: But the chief captain Lysias came upon us, and violently took him away out of our hands.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By examining him yourself you may ascertain all these things of which we accuse him.”

block.text: By examining him yourself you may ascertain all these things of which we accuse him.”

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Jews also joined in the attack, affirming that these things were so.

block.text: Ol Juda tu i helpim tok bilong Tertulus na i sutim tok long Pol. Ol i tokaut olsem, "Olgeta dispela tok i tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the governor had beckoned to him to speak, Paul answered,

block.text: Orait namba wan gavman i mekim nais long han bilong soim Pol olsem em i ken toktok, na Pol i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Because I know that you have been a judge of this nation for many years, I cheerfully make my defense.

block.text: "Mi save, planti yia yu bin i stap jas bilong dispela lain manmeri. Olsem na bel bilong mi em i gutpela long bekim tok long yu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You can recognize that it is not more than twelve days since I went up to worship at Jerusalem.

block.text: Sapos yu askim nabaut, orait yu bai painimaut olsem, 12 -pela de bipo tasol mi bin i go long Jerusalem bilong mekim lotu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the temple they didn’t find me disputing with anyone or stirring up a crowd, either in the synagogues, or in the city.

block.text: Na ol Juda i no bin lukim mi i pait long toktok wantaim wanpela man insait long banis bilong tempel. Na ol i no lukim mi i kirapim bung bilong ol manmeri insait long ol haus lotu o insait long taun. Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nor can they prove to you the things of which they now accuse me.

block.text: Na dispela tok nau ol i kotim mi long en, em i no tru. Ol i no gat rot bilong soim olsem dispela tok bilong ol em i tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But this I confess to you, that after the Way, which they call heresy, so I serve the God of our fathers, believing all things which are according to the law, and which are written in the prophets.

block.text: "Tok i tru, em i olsem. Mi save bihainim dispela Rot ol i kolim 'narakain lain.' Mi bihainim dispela Rot na mi lotu yet long God bilong ol tumbuna bilong mipela. Mi bilip long olgeta tok i stap long lo na olgeta tok ol profet i bin raitim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have the same hope toward God which these also themselves look for, that there will be a resurrection of the dead, both of the just and unjust.

block.text: Mi bilip na mi wet long God bai i kirapim bek ol man i dai pinis, em ol stretpela man na ol man nogut wantaim. Ol tu i bilip na wetim God i mekim olsem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Herein I also practice always having a conscience void of offense toward God and men.

block.text: Olsem na long olgeta taim mi strong long bel bilong mi i mas i stap stret na i no gat rong, long ai bilong God na long ai bilong ol manmeri wantaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now after some years, I came to bring gifts for the needy to my nation, and offerings.

block.text: "Mi bin i stap sampela yia long ol arapela ples, na bihain mi kam bek long lain bilong mi. Mi bringim ol mani samting i kam bilong helpim ol manmeri i sot long ol samting, na mi bringim sampela ofa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple, not with a mob, nor with turmoil.

block.text: Mi laik i go long tempel, olsem na mi bihainim pasin bilong kamap klin long ai bilong God pastaim, na mi go. Na taim ol i lukim mi i stap long tempel, mi stap klin pinis. Na i no gat planti man i stap wantaim mi, na i no gat ol man i mekim nois nabaut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They ought to have been here before you, and to make accusation, if they had anything against me.

block.text: Tasol sampela Juda bilong provins Esia i kam holimpas mi. Sapos ol dispela man i gat tok long mi, mobeta ol yet i kam hia long pes bilong yu na kotim mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or else let these men themselves say what injustice they found in me when I stood before the council --

block.text: Sapos nogat, orait dispela ol man hia i bin i stap long kaunsil bilong ol long taim mi bin autim tok long ol, ol i mas tokim yu long wanem rong ol i bin painim long mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: unless it is for this one thing that I cried standing among them, ‘Concerning the resurrection of the dead I am being judged before you today!’”

block.text: Ating mi bin mekim wanpela tok tasol ol i no amamas long en. Taim mi sanap namel long ol, mi bin singaut olsem, 'Mi bilip olsem, ol man i dai pinis ol bai i kirap bek, na long dispela as tasol nau ol i bringim mi i kam long kot bilong yupela.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Felix, having more exact knowledge concerning the Way, deferred them, saying,

block.text: Feliks i save gut pinis long bilip na pasin bilong ol manmeri i bihainim Rot bilong Bikpela, olsem na taim Pol i autim tok pinis, Feliks i tokim ol Juda long ol i mas wet. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When Lysias, the commanding officer, comes down, I will decide your case.”

block.text: "Taim namba wan ofisa Lisias i kam daun, orait mi ken stretim dispela tok bilong yupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He ordered the centurion that Paul should be kept in custody, and should have some privileges, and not to forbid any of his friends to serve him or to visit him.

block.text: Na em i tokim kepten long em i mas putim Pol long kalabus, tasol em i no ken kalabusim em strong tumas. Em i no ken tambuim ol pren bilong Pol long helpim em long ol samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But after some days, Felix came with Drusilla, his wife, who was a Jewess. He sent for Paul, and heard him concerning the faith in Christ Jesus.

block.text: Sampela de i go pinis, na Feliks i kam wantaim meri bilong en Drusila. Drusila em i meri bilong lain Juda. Na Feliks i singautim Pol na i harim sampela tok bilong en. Pol i tokim em long pasin bilong bilip long Krais Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he reasoned about righteousness, self-control, and the judgment to come, Felix was terrified, and answered,

block.text: Na Pol i tok long stretpela pasin, na long man i mas bosim gut laip bilong em yet, na long God bai i kotim yumi bihain. Feliks i harim ol dispela tok na em i pret. Na em i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go your way for this time, and when it is convenient for me, I will summon you.”

block.text: "Yu go nau. Sapos bihain mi gat taim, orait bai mi singautim yu gen."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Meanwhile, he also hoped that money would be given to him by Paul, that he might release him. Therefore also he sent for him more often, and talked with him.

block.text: Na Feliks i wet long narapela samting tu. Em i ting Pol bai i givim sampela mani long em bilong grisim Feliks long larim em i go fri. Olsem na planti taim em i singautim em i kam na i toktok wantaim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when two years were fulfilled, Felix was succeeded by Porcius Festus. Felix desired to gain favor with the Jews, so he left Paul in bonds.

block.text: Taim tupela yia i go pinis, orait Porsius Festus i kisim ples bilong Feliks. Na Feliks i laik mekim ol Juda i amamas long em, olsem na em i larim Pol i stap long kalabus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 25
Festus therefore, having come into the province, after three days went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea.

block.text: Festus i kam pinis na i kamap namba wan gavman bilong distrik Judia. Orait em i stap tripela de pastaim na em i lusim taun Sisaria na i go antap long Jerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the high priest and the principal men of the Jews informed him against Paul.

block.text: Na ol bikpris na ol bikman bilong ol Juda i go long em na ol i sutim tok long Pol. Ol i tok strong long em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They asked Festus for a favor against him, that he would summon him to Jerusalem; plotting to kill him on the way.
However Festus answered saying:

block.text: "Yu mas helpim mipela, na yu mas salim dispela man i kam long Jerusalem." Ol i tok olsem, long wanem, ol i bin tokim ol man long hait i stap long rot na kilim Pol i dai.
Na Festus i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Paul is being held at Caesarea, and I myself am going there soon.

block.text: "Pol i stap kalabus long Sisaria. Liklik taim na bai mi yet mi go long Sisaria.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let some of your leaders come with me and press charges against him there, if he has done anything wrong.”

block.text: Olsem na ol hetman bilong yupela i ken i go daun wantaim mi. Na sapos dispela man i bin mekim rong, orait ol i ken kotim em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had stayed among them more than ten days, he went down to Caesarea. On the next day he sat on the judgment seat, and commanded Paul to be brought.

block.text: Festus i stap wantaim ol inap olsem 8 -pela o 10 -pela de, na em i go daun long Sisaria. Na long de bihain em i sindaun long haus kot, na em i tokim ol long bringim Pol i kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had come, the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him, bringing against him many and grievous charges which they could not prove.

block.text: Em i kam pinis, orait ol Juda i bin lusim Jerusalem na i kam daun, ol i sanap klostu long em, na ol i sutim planti tok long em. Ol i tok long em i bin mekim ol kain kain pasin nogut tru, tasol ol i no inap soim Festus olsem dispela tok bilong ol em i tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul defended himself saying,

block.text: Ol i tok pinis, orait Pol i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Neither against the law of the Jews, nor against the temple, nor against Caesar, have I sinned at all.”

block.text: "Mi no bin mekim wanpela rong. Mi no bin brukim lo bilong ol Juda, na mi no mekim wanpela samting nogut long tempel, na mi no bin mekim rong long Sisar."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Festus, desiring to gain favor with the Jews, answered Paul and said,

block.text: Tasol Festus i laik mekim ol Juda i amamas long em, olsem na em i askim Pol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem, and be judged by me there concerning these things?”

block.text: "Ating yu laik i go kot long Jerusalem? Sapos olsem, orait mi ken harim dispela kot bilong yu long Jerusalem."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Paul said,

block.text: Tasol Pol i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am standing before Caesar’s judgment seat, where I ought to be tried.

block.text: "Dispela haus hia, nau mi sanap long en, em i haus kot bilong Sisar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have done no wrong to the Jews, as you also know very well.

block.text: Dispela haus tasol em i ples bilong harim kot bilong mi. Yu save pinis, mi no bin mekim wanpela rong long ol Juda.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if I have done wrong, and have committed anything worthy of death, I don’t refuse to die. But if none of those things is true that they accuse me of, no one can give me up to them. I appeal to Caesar!”

block.text: Sapos mi bin mekim wanpela rong inap long mi dai long en, orait mi ken i dai. Tasol sapos dispela tok ol i kotim mi long en, em i no tru, orait i no gat man inap long putim mi long han bilong ol. Mi laik bai Sisar yet i mas harim kot bilong mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Festus, when he had conferred with the council, answered,

block.text: Orait Festus i toktok wantaim ol man i save givim tingting long en, na bihain em i tokim Pol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You have appealed to Caesar. To Caesar you shall go.”

block.text: "Yu tok olsem yu laik bai Sisar i mas harim kot bilong yu. Orait yu ken i go long Sisar."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when some days had passed, King Agrippa and Bernice arrived at Caesarea, and greeted Festus.

block.text: Sampela de i go pinis, na King Agripa wantaim susa bilong en Bernaisi tupela i kam long Sisaria bilong givim gude long Festus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he stayed there many days, Festus laid Paul’s case before the king, saying,

block.text: Tupela i stap long Sisaria planti de, olsem na Festus i toksave long king long tok bilong Pol. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “There is a certain man here whom Felix left as a prisoner.

block.text: "Wanpela man i stap, bipo Feliks i bin kalabusim em, na em i stap yet long kalabus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When I went to Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews brought charges against him and asked that he be condemned.

block.text: Taim mi stap long Jerusalem, ol bikpris na ol hetman bilong ol Juda i bin sutim tok long em, na ol i laik bai mi mas tok olsem, em i gat asua na ol soldia i mas mekim save long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I said to them that it is not the custom of the Romans to give up any man to destruction, before the accused has met the accusers face to face, and has had opportunity to make his defense concerning the matter laid against him.

block.text: Tasol mi bekim tok bilong ol olsem, 'Mipela Rom i no gat pasin bilong mekim save nating long wanpela man. Man i gat kot, em i mas sanap pastaim long pes bilong ol man i kotim em, na yumi mas givim taim long em bilong bekim tok bilong ol long ol samting ol i kotim em long en.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: When therefore they had come together here, I didn’t delay, but on the next day sat on the judgment seat, and commanded the man to be brought.

block.text: "Olsem na taim mi kam bek long Sisaria, ol dispela man i kam wantaim mi. Na mi no mekim ol i wet. Long de bihain tasol mi sindaun long haus kot na mi tok long ol i mas bringim dispela man i kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Concerning whom, when the accusers stood up, they brought no charge of such things as I supposed.

block.text: Na ol man i kotim em ol i sanap. Mi bin ting ol bai i tok long em i bin mekim ol pasin nogut, tasol nogat.
