ReferenceBlocks.text: But they had certain questions against him about their own religion, and about one Jesus, who was dead, whom Paul affirmed to be alive.

block.text: Ol i tok pait wantaim em long ol pasin bilong lotu bilong ol na long wanpela man i dai pinis, nem bilong en Jisas. Tasol Pol i tok, dispela man i stap laip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being perplexed how to inquire concerning these things, I asked whether he was willing to go to Jerusalem and there be judged concerning these matters.

block.text: Mi laik painimaut as bilong dispela tok, tasol tingting bilong mi i no klia na mi no inap. Olsem na mi askim em, 'Ating yu laik i go long Jerusalem, na bai mi harim dispela kot bilong yu long Jerusalem?'

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Paul had appealed to be kept for the decision of the emperor, I commanded him to be kept until I could send him to Caesar.”

block.text: Tasol Pol i tok, em i laik i stap long kalabus, na bihain Sisar yet i ken harim kot bilong em. Olsem na mi tok long em i mas i stap kalabus, inap long mi painim rot bilong salim em i go long Sisar."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Agrippa said to Festus,

block.text: Agripa i harim dispela tok na em i tokim Festus olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I also would like to hear the man myself.”

block.text: "Mi yet mi laik harim tok bilong dispela man."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tomorrow,”

block.text: "Tumora,

ReferenceBlocks.text: he said,

block.text: Na Festus i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “you shall hear him.”

block.text: yu ken harim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: So on the next day, Agrippa and Bernice had come with great pomp, and they entered into the place of hearing with the commanding officers and principal men of the city. At the command of Festus, Paul was brought in.
Festus said,

block.text: Olsem na long tumora Agripa tupela Bernaisi i putim ol gutpela bilas bilong tupela na tupela i kam. Tupela i go insait long haus kibung wantaim ol namba wan ofisa na ol bikman bilong dispela taun. Na Festus i tok, na ol i bringim Pol i kam.
Na Festus i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “King Agrippa, and all men who are here present with us, you see this man. All the multitude of the Jews petitioned me, both at Jerusalem and here. They shouted that he ought not to live any longer.

block.text: "King Agripa, na yupela olgeta man i stap wantaim mipela, yupela lukim dispela man. Olgeta lain manmeri bilong Juda, long Jerusalem na long hia tu, ol i bin sutim tok long dispela man. Ol i bin singaut strong long mi olsem, 'Yu mas kilim em i dai. Nogut em i stap laip moa.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death, and as he himself appealed to the emperor I determined to send him.

block.text: Tasol mi lukim em i no bin mekim wanpela samting inap long em i dai. Na em i laik bai Sisar yet i mas harim kot bilong em. Olsem na mi pasim tok long salim em i go long Sisar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I have nothing definite to write to my lord. Therefore I have brought him forth before you, and especially before you, King Agrippa, that, after examination, I may have something to write.

block.text: Tasol mi no klia long wanem tok tru mi mas raitim na salim i go long bikman bilong yumi, bai em i ken save bilong wanem ol i kotim dispela man. Olsem na King Agripa, mi bringim dispela man i kam long yu, na long yupela olgeta arapela man tu. Yumi ken harim gut tok bilong em, na bai mi ken save long ol tok mi mas raitim long pas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it seems to me unreasonable, in sending a prisoner, not to also specify the charges against him.”

block.text: Sapos mi salim wanpela kalabus i go, na mi no salim tok long samting ol i kotim em long en, orait mi pilim olsem dispela pasin i no stret."

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 26
Agrippa said to Paul,

block.text: Orait Agripa i tokim Pol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You may speak for yourself.”

block.text: "Yu ken autim tok bilong yu yet."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Paul stretched out his hand, and made his defense.

block.text: Olsem na Pol i litimapim han na i autim tok bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I think myself happy, King Agrippa, that I am to make my defense before you this day concerning all the things that I am accused of by the Jews,

block.text: "King Agripa, mi laik bekim dispela tok ol Juda i bin sutim long mi, na mi tingting olsem, i gutpela tru long mi ken autim dispela tok bilong mi long yu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: especially because you are expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews. Therefore I beg you to hear me patiently.”

block.text: Yu save tumas long olgeta pasin bilong mipela Juda, na long ol samting mipela i save tok pait long en. Olsem na mi laik bai yu sindaun isi tasol na harim gut olgeta tok bilong mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Indeed, all the Jews know my way of life from my youth up, which was from the beginning among my own nation and at Jerusalem.

block.text: "Olgeta Juda i save gut long mi. Ol i save olsem, taim mi stap pikinini yet mi bin i stap namel long ol lain bilong mi, na bihain mi bin i go i stap long Jerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If they are willing to testify, they would say that I lived my life after the strictest sect of our religion. I was a Pharisee.

block.text: Ol i save pinis long mi, na sapos ol i laik, ol yet inap tokim yu long pasin bilong mi. Ol i save olsem, stat long taim mi yangpela yet mi stap wanpela bilong ol lain Farisi, na mi bihainim pasin bilong ol. Ol Farisi i gat planti lo i hat tru long bihainim. Ol arapela lain bilong mipela Juda i no gat kain strongpela lo olsem bilong ol Farisi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now I stand here to be judged for the hope of the promise made by God to our fathers.

block.text: Na nau mi sanap hia, na ol i kotim mi. Na as bilong kot i olsem. Mi bilip na mi wet long God i mekim samting i kamap olsem bipo em i bin tokim ol tumbuna bilong mipela long em bai i mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Our twelve tribes, earnestly serving night and day, hoped to attain this promise. Concerning this hope I am accused by the Jews, King Agrippa!

block.text: Ol 12 -pela lain bilong mipela ol i save lotu long God long san na long nait, na ol i bilip tru na wetim dispela samting tasol i kamap. Na king, mi tu mi bilip na wetim dispela samting. Na dispela tasol em i as bilong tok ol Juda i sutim long mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Why is it judged incredible with you, if God does raise the dead?”

block.text: Bilong wanem yupela sampela man i ting, yumi no ken bilip long God bai i kirapim bek ol man i dai pinis?

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I myself most certainly thought that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.

block.text: "Bipo mi yet mi bin ting mi mas mekim planti samting bilong daunim nem bilong Jisas bilong Nasaret.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This I also did in Jerusalem. I both shut up many of the saints in prisons, having received authority from the chief priests. And when they were put to death I gave my vote against them.

block.text: Na mi mekim ol dispela samting long Jerusalem. Mi bin kisim namba long ol bikpris, na mi kalabusim planti manmeri bilong God. Na taim ol lida i vot long kilim ol i dai, mi tu mi bin tok long ol i mas i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Punishing them often in all the synagogues, I tried to make them blaspheme. Being exceedingly enraged against them, I persecuted them even to foreign cities.”

block.text: Na planti taim mi bin i go insait long ol haus lotu bilong holimpas ol na mekim save long ol. Mi bin trai hat long mekim ol i givim baksait long Bikpela na tok nogut long em. Mi belhat nogut tru long ol, na mi bin i go painim ol long ol taun i stap longwe tu, bai mi ken mekim save long ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I was traveling to Damascus with the authority and commission from the chief priests.

block.text: Pol i tok moa olsem, "Olsem na mi kisim namba long ol bikpris na ol i salim mi i go, na mi wokabaut i go long taun Damaskus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: At noon, O king, I saw on the way a light from the sky, brighter than the sun, shining around me and those who traveled with me.

block.text: Orait king, long samting olsem 12 klok belo mi wokabaut long rot, na mi lukim wanpela bikpela lait i kam long heven. Dispela lait i lait strong tru na i winim lait bilong san. Em i kam lait long mi wantaim ol man i wokabaut wantaim mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we had all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice saying to me in the Hebrew language, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me? It is hard for you to kick against the goads.’”

block.text: Mipela olgeta i pundaun long graun, na mi harim maus bilong wanpela man i tok Hibru na i askim mi olsem, 'Sol, Sol, bilong wanem yu wok long bagarapim mi? Yu wok long kikim samting i gat sap, na yu givim pen long yu yet.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I said, ‘Who are you, Lord?’” “He said, ‘I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting.

block.text: Na mi tok, 'Bikpela, yu husat?' Na Bikpela i tok olsem, 'Mi Jisas, yu wok long bagarapim mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But arise, and stand on your feet, for I have appeared to you for this purpose: to appoint you a servant and a witness both of the things which you have seen, and of the things which I will reveal to you.

block.text: Tasol yu kirap na sanap. Mi kam long yu nau bilong makim yu bilong holim wok bilong mi. Na bai yu autim tok long ol samting nau yu lukim pinis na long ol samting bihain bai mi soim yu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I will keep you safe from the jews and from the Gentiles, to whom I send you.

block.text: Bai mi no larim ol man bilong lain bilong yu yet na ol man bilong ol arapela lain i mekim nogut long yu. Nogat. Mi bai salim yu i go long ol

ReferenceBlocks.text: You are to open their eyes, that they may turn from darkness to light and from the power of Satan to God. In this way they may receive remission of sins and an inheritance among those who are sanctified by faith in me.’”

block.text: bilong opim ai bilong ol, bai ol i ken givim baksait long tudak na tanim bel na i kam long lait. Ol i ken lusim strong bilong Satan na i kam long God. Olsem na mi ken lusim ol sin bilong ol, na ol i ken kisim namba wantaim ol manmeri i bilip long mi na ol i ken i stap insait long ol lain manmeri mi makim bilong mi yet.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Therefore, King Agrippa, I was not disobedient to the heavenly vision.

block.text: Pol i tok moa olsem, "King Agripa, mi lukim dispela samting bilong heven, na mi no sakim tok bilong en. Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I declared first to them of Damascus, at Jerusalem, and throughout all the country of Judea, and also to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, doing works worthy of repentance.

block.text: Mi autim tok long ol man bilong Damaskus pastaim, na bihain mi kam autim long ol manmeri bilong Jerusalem, na long olgeta hap bilong Judia, na long ol manmeri bilong ol arapela lain tu. Mi autim tok olsem, 'Yupela i mas tanim bel na bilip long God, na pasin bilong yupela i mas soim olsem yupela i tanim bel pinis.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this reason the Jews seized me in the temple, and tried to kill me.

block.text: Mi save autim dispela kain tok, na long dispela as tasol ol Juda i bin holimpas mi long tempel, na ol i laik kilim mi i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having therefore obtained the help that is from God, I stand to this day testifying both to small and great. I say nothing but what the prophets and Moses said would happen.

block.text: God i bin helpim mi na mi stap gut i kam inap long nau. Olsem na nau mi sanap hia, na mi autim tok long olgeta man nating na long olgeta bikman wantaim. Mi no autim narapela tok. Mi autim dispela tok tasol bipo ol profet na Moses tu ol i bin tok long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I explained how the Christ must suffer, and how, by the resurrection of the dead, he would be first to proclaim light both to these people and to the Gentiles.”

block.text: Ol i bin tok olsem, 'Dispela man God i makim bilong kisim bek ol manmeri bilong en, em i mas karim pen, na bihain bai em i kamap namba wan man bilong kirap long matmat. Na em bai i autim tok bilong lait bilong God long ol Israel na long ol arapela lain tu.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he thus made his defense, Festus said with a loud voice,

block.text: Pol i wok long autim tok, na Festus i singaut strong moa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Paul, you are crazy! Your great learning is driving you insane!”

block.text: "Pol, yu longlong. Yu skul planti tumas, na bikpela save bilong yu i mekim yu i kamap longlong!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said,

block.text: Na Pol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am not crazy, most excellent Festus, but boldly declare words of truth and reasonableness.

block.text: "Bikman Festus, mi no longlong. Nogat. Mi tok tru, na mi gat tingting na mi tok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the king knows of these things, to whom also I speak freely. For I am persuaded that none of these things is hidden from him, for this has not been done in a corner.

block.text: King Agripa i save pinis long olgeta dispela samting mi bin tok long en. Olsem na mi tokaut stret long em, na mi no pret. Mi save, dispela olgeta samting i no bin abrusim ai na yau bilong en. Nogat. Em i save pinis long ol, long wanem, ol dispela samting i no bin kamap long ples hait.

ReferenceBlocks.text: King Agrippa, do you believe the prophets? I know that you believe.”

block.text: King Agripa, yu bilipim tok bilong ol profet, o nogat? Mi save pinis, yu bilip."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Agrippa said to Paul,

block.text: Na Agripa i askim Pol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “With a little persuasion are you trying to make me a Christian?”

block.text: "Olsem wanem? Long dispela sotpela taim tasol, yu ting yu bai mekim mi i kamap Kristen?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul said,

block.text: Na Pol i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I pray to God, that whether with little or with much, not only you, but also all that hear me this day, might become such as I am, except for these bonds.”

block.text: "Maski sotpela taim o longpela taim, mi prea long God olsem, yu wantaim ol dispela lain nau i harim tok bilong mi, yupela olgeta i ken kamap wankain olsem mi. Tasol mi no laik bai ol i putim ol sen long yupela na yupela i stap kalabus."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The king rose up with the governor, and Bernice, and those who sat with them.

block.text: Orait king wantaim namba wan gavman na Bernaisi na ol man i stap wantaim ol, ol i sanap

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had withdrawn, they spoke one to another, saying,

block.text: na ol i wokabaut i go lusim dispela rum. Na ol i toktok namel long ol yet olsem,

block.characterId: King Herod Agrippa II/Festus, governor of Judea/Bernice

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: King Herod Agrippa II/Festus, governor of Judea/Bernice
ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man does nothing worthy of death or of bonds.”

block.text: "Dispela man i no bin mekim wanpela rong inap long em i dai o em i stap kalabus."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Agrippa said to Festus,

block.text: Na Agripa i tokim Festus olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man might have been set free if he had not appealed to Caesar.”

block.text: "Yu inap long lusim dispela man i go fri, tasol em yet i bin tok long Sisar i mas harim kot bilong em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 27
When it was determined that we should sail for Italy, they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners to a centurion named Julius, of the Augustan band.

block.text: Ol i pasim tok pinis long mipela i mas kisim sip na i go long kantri Itali. Na ol i putim Pol wantaim ol arapela kalabus long han bilong wanpela kepten bilong 100 soldia. Nem bilong dispela kepten em Julius, na em i bilong lain ami bilong Sisar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Embarking in a ship of Adramyttium, which was about to sail to places on the coast of Asia, we put to sea. Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica was with us.

block.text: Mipela i kalap long wanpela sip bilong taun Adramitium. Dispela sip i laik i go long ol pasis bilong ol taun bilong provins Esia. Orait mipela i luslain na i go. Aristarkus bilong taun Tesalonaika long provins Masedonia em i go wantaim mipela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The next day, we touched at Sidon. Julius treated Paul kindly, and gave him permission to go to his friends and refresh himself.

block.text: Long de bihain mipela i go anka long taun Saidon, na Julius i mekim gutpela pasin long Pol. Em i orait long Pol i go lukim ol pren bilong en na kisim kaikai samting long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Putting to sea from there, we sailed under the lee of Cyprus, because the winds were contrary.

block.text: Orait bihain mipela i lusim Saidon, na win i sakim mipela, olsem na sip i ran i go baksait long ailan Saiprus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we had sailed across the sea which is off Cilicia and Pamphylia, we came to Myra, a city of Lycia.

block.text: Orait mipela i go brukim solwara klostu long provins Silisia na Pamfilia, na bihain mipela i kamap long taun Maira bilong provins Lisia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing for Italy, and he put us on board.

block.text: Long dispela taun kepten bilong ol soldia i lukim wanpela sip bilong taun Aleksandria i stap, na em i laik i go long Itali. Na em i bringim mipela i go long dispela sip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we had sailed slowly many days, and had come with difficulty opposite Cnidus, the wind not allowing us further, we sailed under the lee of Crete, opposite Salmone.

block.text: Orait mipela i luslain, na sip i ran isi isi inap long sampela de, long wanem strongpela win i wok long sakim mipela. Ol boskru i hatwok tru na mipela i go kamap klostu long taun Nidus, tasol win i pasim mipela, na mipela i no inap i go moa. Olsem na mipela i tanim na i go long ailan Krit, klostu long poin Salmone, na mipela i go olgeta long hapsait bilong ailan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: With difficulty sailing along it we came to a certain place called Fair Havens, near the city of Lasea.

block.text: Ol boskru i hatwok na mipela i ran bihainim nambis bilong Krit. Na bihain mipela i kamap long wanpela ples, ol i kolim Gutpela Pasis, em i stap klostu long taun Lasea.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When much time had passed and the voyage was now dangerous, because the Fast had now already gone by, Paul admonished them,
and said to them,

block.text: Planti de i lus, na bikpela de bilong ol Juda i tambu long kaikai, em i go pinis. Na si i nogut tru, olsem na Pol i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sirs, I perceive that the voyage will be with injury and much loss, not only of the cargo and the ship, but also of our lives.”

block.text: "Yupela ol man, harim. Mi save, sapos yumi go nau, bai yumi painim taim nogut tru, na planti samting bai i lus. I no ol kago na sip tasol bai i lus. Nogat. Yumi bai lusim laip bilong yumi tu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the centurion gave more heed to the master and to the owner of the ship than to those things which were spoken by Paul.

block.text: Tasol kepten bilong ol soldia i no harim dispela tok bilong Pol. Nogat. Em i bihainim tingting bilong kepten bilong sip na bilong papa bilong sip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Because the haven was not suitable to winter in, the majority advised going to sea from there, if by any means they could reach Phoenix, and winter there. This was a port of Crete, looking northwest and southwest.

block.text: Dispela pasis em i no gutpela ples bilong sip i stap long en na hait long ol bikpela win. Olsem na planti man long sip ol i pasim tok long ol i laik lusim dispela ples na i go. Sapos ol inap, ol i laik i go kamap long Finiks na i stap long dispela ples long taim bilong bikpela win. Finiks em i wanpela pasis i stap long hap saut bilong ailan Krit, na em i lukluk i go long hap bilong san i go daun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the south wind blew softly, they supposed that they had obtained their purpose. They weighed anchor and sailed along Crete, close to shore.

block.text: Orait win bilong hap saut i kirap, na em i no strong tumas. Olsem na ol i ting ol inap ran gut i go long dispela pasis ol i toktok long en. Olsem na ol i pulim anka na ol i ran i go klostu tru long nambis bilong Krit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But before long, a stormy wind beat down from shore, which is called Euroclydon.

block.text: Tasol i no longtaim na wanpela strongpela win i kirap, em win ol i kolim win bilong hap not. Dispela win i kam long hapsait bilong ailan Krit

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the ship was caught, and couldn’t face the wind, we gave way to it, and were driven along.

block.text: na i sakim sip strong tru. Ol boskru i laik tanim sip na i go bek, tasol ol i no inap.
Olsem na ol i larim win i sakim sip i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Running under the lee of a small island called Clauda, we were able, with difficulty, to secure the boat.

block.text: Running under the lee of a small island called Clauda, we were able, with difficulty, to secure the boat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After they had hoisted it up, they used cables to help reinforce the ship. Fearing that they would run aground on the Syrtis sand bars, they lowered the sea anchor, and so were driven along.

block.text: After they had hoisted it up, they used cables to help reinforce the ship. Fearing that they would run aground on the Syrtis sand bars, they lowered the sea anchor, and so were driven along.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As we labored exceedingly with the storm, the next day they began to throw things overboard.

block.text: Win na bikpela si i sakim mipela strong tumas, olsem na long de bihain ol boskru i stat long tromoi ol kago i go long solwara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the third day, they threw out the ship’s tackle with their own hands.

block.text: Na long de namba 3, ol boskru i wari tru na ol i stat long tromoi ol sel na mas samting bilong sip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When neither sun nor stars shone on us for many days, and no small storm pressed on us, all hope that we would be saved was now taken away.

block.text: Planti de mipela i no lukim san na ol sta, na bikpela win tru i sakim mipela oltaim. Olsem na bihain mipela i no moa ting mipela bai i stap gut. Nogat. Mipela i ting mipela olgeta bai i lus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had been long without food, Paul stood up in the middle of them, and said,

block.text: Planti de ol man i no kisim kaikai, na bihain Pol i sanap namel long ol na i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sirs, you should have listened to me, and not have set sail from Crete, and have gotten this injury and loss.

block.text: "Yupela ol man, sapos yupela i bin bihainim tok bilong mi na yupela i no lusim ailan Krit, orait yumi bai i no inap painim dispela taim nogut, na olgeta samting bai i no inap lus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now I exhort you to cheer up, for there will be no loss of life among you, but only of the ship.

block.text: Tasol nau mi tokim yupela olsem, yupela i ken bel isi, long wanem, i no gat wanpela man bilong yumi bai i lus. Sip tasol bai i lus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For there stood by me this night an angel, belonging to the God whose I am and whom I serve.

block.text: Mi man bilong God, na mi save lotu long em. Na long dispela nait ensel bilong God i bin kam sanap klostu long mi,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said, ‘Don’t be afraid, Paul. You must stand before Caesar. Behold, God has granted you all those who sail with you.’

block.text: na em i tok olsem, 'Pol, yu no ken pret. Yu mas i go sanap long pes bilong Sisar. Na harim. God i harim beten bilong yu, na olgeta man i stap wantaim yu long sip, ol bai i no inap lus.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore, sirs, cheer up! For I believe God, that it will be just as it has been spoken to me.

block.text: Ensel i tok olsem, olsem na yupela ol man, yupela i no ken pret. Mi bilip long God bai i mekim olgeta samting i kamap olsem em i tokim mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But we must run aground on a certain island.”

block.text: Tasol yumi mas larim sip i ran i go, na win bai i sakim sip i go pas long wanpela ailan."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the fourteenth night had come, we were driven back and forth in the Adriatic Sea. About midnight the sailors surmised that they were drawing near to some land.

block.text: Orait long namba 14 nait mipela i trip i go long biksolwara Mediterenian. Na klostu long 12 klok long nait ol boskru i pilim olsem sip i kamap klostu long wanpela nambis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They took soundings, and found twenty fathoms. After a little while, they took soundings again, and found fifteen fathoms.

block.text: Olsem na ol i tromoi meta bilong painimaut solwara i daun tru o nogat, na ol i metaim 40 mita. Na sip i go liklik moa, na ol i tromoi meta gen na metaim 30 mita.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Fearing that we would run aground on rocky ground, they let go four anchors from the stern, and wished for daylight.

block.text: Na ol i pret, nogut sip i ran i go pas long ples i gat ston na i bruk olgeta. Olsem na ol i tromoi 4 -pela anka long stan bilong sip. Na ol i beten long san i ken kamap kwiktaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The sailors were trying to flee out of the ship, and had lowered the boat into the sea, pretending that they would lay out anchors from the bow.

block.text: Ol boskru i laik painim rot bilong lusim sip. Olsem na ol i slingim dingi i go daun, na ol i giaman olsem ol i laik tromoi ol anka long poret bilong sip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers,

block.text: Tasol Pol i tokim kepten wantaim ol soldia olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Unless these stay in the ship, you can’t be saved.”

block.text: "Sapos ol dispela man i no i stap long sip, orait yupela bai I lus."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the soldiers cut away the ropes of the boat, and let it fall off.

block.text: Olsem na ol soldia i katim baklain i holim dingi na em i pundaun long solwara na trip i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: While the day was coming on, Paul begged them all to take some food, saying,

block.text: Klostu san i laik kamap, na Pol i givim tok long olgeta man. Em i laik kirapim ol long kisim sampela kaikai, na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This day is the fourteenth day that you wait and continue fasting, having taken nothing.

block.text: "Longtaim tumas bel bilong yupela i no sindaun gut, na yupela i no kaikai. Yupela i stap nating tasol, inap 14 de.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I beg you to take some food, for this is for your safety. Not a hair will perish from any of your heads.”

block.text: Olsem na mi tokim yupela strong, yupela i mas kisim sampela kaikai. Em bai i strongim yupela. Harim. Yupela i no inap bagarap liklik. Nogat. Yupela olgeta bai i stap gut."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, and had taken bread, he gave thanks to God in the presence of all, and he broke it, and began to eat.

block.text: Em i tok olsem, na em i kisim bret na long pes bilong ol em i tenkyu long God. Na em i brukim bret na i stat long kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they all cheered up, and they also took food.

block.text: Olsem na olgeta man ol i belgut, na ol tu i kisim sampela kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In all, we were two hundred seventy-six souls on the ship.

block.text: Mipela man i stap long sip, mipela inap 276 man olgeta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, throwing out the wheat into the sea.

block.text: Ol i kaikai inap pinis, orait ol i tromoi wit i go long solwara, bai sip i no ken hevi tumas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it was day, they didn’t recognize the land, but they noticed a certain bay with a beach. They decided to try to drive the ship onto it.

block.text: San i kamap, na ol boskru i lukim dispela nambis mipela i kamap long en, tasol ol i no save, em nambis bilong wanem hap graun. Ol i lukim wanpela pasis i go insait moa na i gat gutpela wesan long en. Na ol i ting, sapos ol inap, ol i laik mekim sip i ran i go sua long dispela nambis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Casting off the anchors, they left them in the sea, at the same time untying the rudder ropes. Hoisting up the foresail to the wind, they made for the beach.

block.text: Olsem na ol i katim baklain bilong olgeta anka na lusim i stap long solwara. Na ol i lusim ol baklain ol i bin pasim tupela bikpela pul ol i save stiaim sip long en. Na ol i pulim ol sel i go antap bilong kisim win, na sip i ran i go olsem long nambis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But coming to a place where two seas met, they ran the vessel aground. The bow struck and remained immovable, but the stern began to break up by the violence of the waves.

block.text: Tasol sip i go antap long wanpela wesan i stap namel long solwara, na i pas long en. Poret bilong sip i pas strong tumas long wesan na i stap. Na si i wok long paitim stan bilong sip na i brukim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The soldiers’ counsel was to kill the prisoners, so that none of them would swim out and escape.

block.text: Orait ol soldia i ting long kilim ol kalabus i dai, nogut ol i swim i go na i ranawe.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the centurion, desiring to save Paul, stopped them from their purpose. He commanded that those who could swim should throw themselves overboard first to go toward the land.

block.text: Tasol kepten bilong ol soldia i laik helpim Pol, olsem na em i tambuim ol soldia long ol i no ken kilim ol kalabus. Em i tokim olgeta man i save swim, long ol i mas kalap long solwara na i go sua pastaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded the rest to follow, some on planks, and some on other things from the ship. So it happened that they all escaped safely to the land.

block.text: Na ol arapela man i mas holim ol plang na ol hap bilong sip i bruk, na ol i mas trip i go sua. Orait ol i mekim olsem kepten i tok, na olgeta bilong mipela i kamap long nambis. I no gat wanpela i lus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS 28
When we had escaped, then they learned that the island was called Malta.

block.text: Mipela i kamap gut long sua, na mipela i painimaut olsem mipela i stap long wanpela ailan ol i kolim Malta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The natives showed us uncommon kindness. They kindled a fire, and received us all, because of the present rain, and because of the cold.

block.text: Ol man bilong dispela ples i mekim gutpela pasin tru long mipela. Ren i wok long pundaun na ples i kol, olsem na ol i wokim paia na ol i bringim mipela olgeta i go klostu long paia bai mipela i ken hatim skin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks and laid them on the fire, a viper came out because of the heat, and fastened on his hand.

block.text: Pol i bungim sampela paiawut na i putim long paia. Na wanpela snek i stap insait long ol paiawut, em i pilim hat bilong paia, na i kam ausait, na i planim tit bilong en long han bilong Pol na i hangamap i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the natives saw the creature hanging from his hand, they said one to another,

block.text: Ol manmeri bilong ples i lukim dispela snek i kaikaim han bilong Pol na i hangamap i stap. Na ol i tok long ol yet olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “No doubt this man is a murderer. Though he has escaped from the sea, Justice has not allowed him to live.”

block.text: "Lukim. Ating dispela man em i man bilong kilim man i dai. Em i no i dai long solwara, tasol nau god bilong bekim ol pasin nogut i no laik bai em i stap laip moa."

ReferenceBlocks.text: However he shook off the creature into the fire, and wasn’t harmed.

block.text: Tasol Pol i sakim dispela snek i go pundaun long paia, na i no gat wanpela samting i kamap long Pol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they expected that he would have swollen or fallen down dead suddenly. But when they watched for a long time and saw nothing bad happen to him, they changed their minds, and said,

block.text: Ol manmeri i wet i stap, long wanem, ol i ting bodi bilong Pol bai i solap, o em bai i pundaun kwiktaim na i dai. Tasol ol i wet longtaim, na ol i no lukim wanpela samting i kamap long em. Olsem na ol i senisim tingting na ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He is a god!”

block.text: "Em i wanpela god."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now in the neighborhood of that place were lands belonging to the chief man of the island, named Publius. He received us, and courteously entertained us for three days.

block.text: Graun i stap klostu long dispela ples, em i graun bilong namba wan hetman bilong dispela ailan, nem bilong en Publius. Dispela man i kisim mipela i go long haus bilong en, na em i lukautim mipela gut tru, inap long tripela de.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened that the father of Publius lay sick of fever and dysentery. Paul entered in to him, prayed, and laying his hands on him, healed him.

block.text: Papa bilong Publius em i sik i stap. Em i gat skin i hat wantaim pekpek wara. Orait Pol i go long em na i beten. Na em i putim han long em, na i mekim em i kamap orait gen.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then when this was done, the rest also who had diseases in the island came, and were cured.

block.text: Em i mekim olsem, na ol arapela sikman bilong dispela ailan ol i kam long Pol, na em i mekim ol tu i kamap orait gen.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They also honored us with many honors, and when we sailed, they put on board the things that we needed.

block.text: Ol i mekim gutpela pasin tru long mipela. Na taim mipela i laik lusim ol na i go, ol i givim mipela olgeta samting mipela i sot long en, na ol i putim long sip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After three months, we set sail in a ship of Alexandria. It had wintered in the island, and its name was “The Twin Brothers.”

block.text: Mipela i stap tripela mun long ailan Malta. Na bihain mipela i kalap long wanpela sip i bin i stap long dispela ailan long taim bilong bikpela win. Em i sip bilong taun Aleksandria. Long poret i gat piksa bilong tupela pikinini man bilong god Sus. Orait mipela i luslain na i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Touching at Syracuse, we stayed there three days.

block.text: Mipela i go kamap long taun Sirakyus, na mipela i stap tripela de.

ReferenceBlocks.text: From there we circled around and arrived at Rhegium. After one day, a south wind sprang up, and on the second day we came to Puteoli.

block.text: Na mipela i lusim Sirakyus na bihain mipela i go kamap long taun Regium. Na long de bihain, win bilong hap saut i kirap, olsem na mipela i lusim Regium. Na long de namba 3 mipela i kamap long taun Puteoli.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There we found brothers, and were entreated to stay with them for seven days. So we came to Rome.

block.text: Long dispela taun mipela i bungim sampela Kristen. Na ol i askim mipela long i stap wantaim ol, na mipela i stap inap long 7 -pela de. Na mipela i lusim ol, na mipela i wokabaut i go long biktaun Rom.

ReferenceBlocks.text: From there the brothers, when they heard of us, came to meet us as far as The Market of Appius and The Three Taverns. When Paul saw them, he thanked God, and took courage.

block.text: Taim ol Kristen bilong Rom i harim tok olsem mipela i wokabaut i kam, ol i kam bilong bungim mipela long rot. Na mipela i bungim ol long Maket Bilong Apius na long ples ol i kolim Tripela Haus Pasindia. Pol i lukim ol, na em i tenkyu long God, na bel bilong en i kisim strong.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we entered into Rome, the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard, but Paul was allowed to stay by himself with the soldier who guarded him.

block.text: Mipela i go insait long Rom, na gavman i orait long Pol i stap long wanpela haus bilong em yet, wantaim wanpela soldia i was long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened that after three days Paul called together those who were the leaders of the Jews. When they had come together, he said to them,

block.text: Pol i stap tripela de long Rom, na em i singautim ol hetman bilong ol Juda. Ol i kam bung pinis, na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers, I have done nothing against our people or against the customs of our ancestors. However, I was arrested in Jerusalem and was delivered to the Romans.

block.text: "Ol brata, mi no bin mekim wanpela samting bilong daunim lain bilong yumi o bilong sakim pasin bilong ol tumbuna bilong yumi. Tasol ol i kalabusim mi long Jerusalem, na ol i putim mi long han bilong ol Rom.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had examined me, they desired to set me free because there was no reason for the death penalty in my case.

block.text: Orait ol Rom i harim kot bilong mi, na ol i lukim olsem mi no gat rong inap long ol i kilim mi i dai, olsem na ol i laik lusim mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Jews objected and so I was compelled to appeal to Caesar. However, I had no charge to bring against my nation.

block.text: Tasol ol Juda i sakim dispela tok. Olsem na mi no gat narapela rot. Mi tok long Sisar i mas harim kot bilong mi. Tasol i no olsem mi laik kotim lain bilong mi long wanpela samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this cause therefore I asked to see you and to speak with you. For because of the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain.”

block.text: Na long dispela as tasol mi singautim yupela i kam. Mi laik lukim yupela, na givim tok long yupela. Mi bilip na mi wetim dispela samting yumi olgeta Israel i wetim. Dispela tasol em i as bilong dispela sen i pasim mi nau."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Na ol i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We neither received letters from Judea concerning you, nor did any of the brothers come here and report or speak any evil of you.

block.text: "I no gat sampela man bilong Judia i salim pas long mipela bilong tokim mipela long yu. Na i no gat wanpela Juda i kam stori long mipela na i mekim sampela tok nogut long yu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But we desire to hear what your views are. For we know that people everywhere are talking against this sect.”

block.text: Tasol mipela i laik harim yu yet yu autim tingting bilong yu, long wanem, mipela i save, long olgeta ples, ol manmeri i save mekim tok nogut long dispela nupela lain i bin kamap namel long yumi Juda."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had appointed him a day, many people came to him at his lodging. He explained to them, testifying about the Kingdom of God, and persuading them concerning Jesus, both from the law of Moses and from the prophets, from morning until evening.

block.text: Orait ol i makim wanpela de, na planti man i kam long Pol long dispela haus em i stap long en. Na long moningtaim i go inap long apinun, em i autim tok bilong kingdom bilong God long ol. Em i kamapim sampela tok i stap long lo bilong Moses na long ol buk bilong ol profet, na long dispela ol tok em i wok strong long kirapim tingting bilong ol bai ol i ken bilip long Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some believed the things which were spoken, and some disbelieved.

block.text: Orait na sampela man i ting dispela tok Pol i mekim, em i stret. Tasol sampela i no bilipim tok bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they didn’t agree among themselves, they departed after Paul had spoken one word,

block.text: Ol i wok long tok pait namel long ol yet, na ol i go. Tasol pastaim Pol i mekim wanpela tok long ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Holy Spirit spoke rightly through Isaiah, the prophet, to our fathers, saying,

block.text: "Holi Spirit i tok tru tumas long ol tumbuna bilong yumi long maus bilong profet Aisaia. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘Go to this people, and say, in hearing, you will hear, but will in no way understand. In seeing, you will see, but will in no way perceive.

block.text: 'Yu go long dispela lain manmeri na yu tokim ol olsem, "Bai yupela i harim tok planti taim, tasol bai yupela i no inap save long as bilong en. Bai yupela i lukluk planti taim, tasol bai yupela i no inap luksave long wanpela samting."

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this people’s heart has grown callous. Their ears are dull of hearing. Their eyes they have closed. Lest they should see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their heart, and would turn again, and I would heal them.’”

block.text: Tingting bilong dispela lain manmeri i pas pinis, na yau bilong ol i les long harim toktok, na ol i pasim pinis ai bilong ol, nogut ol i lukim wanpela samting na harim tok na save long as bilong tok, na ol i tanim bel na kam bek long mi, na bai mi mekim ol i kamap orait gen.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be it known therefore to you, that the salvation of God is sent to the nations. They will also listen.”

block.text: Na Pol i tok moa olsem, "Olsem na yupela i ken save, dispela tok bilong gutpela wok God i mekim bilong kisim bek yumi, em God I bringim i go pinis long ol manmeri bilong ol arapela lain. Ol bai I harim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said these words, the Jews departed, having a great dispute among themselves.
Paul stayed two whole years in his own rented house, and received all who were coming to him.

block.text: Tupela yia olgeta Pol i stap long wanpela haus. Em i save givim mani long papa bilong haus, bilong em i ken i stap long dispela haus. Na em i save amamas long lukim ol man i kam long haus bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He preached the Kingdom of God, and taught the things concerning the Lord Jesus Christ with all boldness and without hindrance.

block.text: Em i save autim tok bilong kingdom bilong God, na em i skulim ol manmeri long tok bilong Bikpela Jisas Krais. Em i no pret long autim tok na i no gat wanpela man i tambuim em.
